content: 6 and the Horites in their hill country of Seir as far as El-paran, which is by the wilderness.
content_old: 6 and the Horites in their hill country of Seir as far as El-paran, which is by the wilderness.

content: 7 On their way back they came to En-mishpat, which is Kadesh, and subdued all the territory of the Amalekites, and also the Amorites who dwelt in Hazazon-tamar.
content_old: 7 On their way back they came to En-mishpat, which is Kadesh, and subdued all the territory of the Amalekites, and also the Amorites who dwelt in Hazazon-tamar.

content: 8 Then the king of Sodom, the king of Gomorrah, the king of Admah, the king of Zeboiim, and the king of Bela, which is Zoar, went forth and engaged them in battle in the Valley of Siddim:
content_old: 8 Then the king of Sodom, the king of Gomorrah, the king of Admah, the king of Zeboiim, and the king of Bela, which is Zoar, went forth and engaged them in battle in the Valley of Siddim:

content: 9 King Chedorlaomer of Elam, King Tidal of Goiim, King Amraphel of Shinar, and King Arioch of Ellasar—four kings against those five.
content_old: 9 King Chedorlaomer of Elam, King Tidal of Goiim, King Amraphel of Shinar, and King Arioch of Ellasar—four kings against those five.

content: 10 Now the Valley of Siddim was dotted with bitumen pits; and the kings of Sodom and Gomorrah, in their flight, threw themselves into them, while the rest escaped to the hill country.
content_old: 10 Now the Valley of Siddim was dotted with bitumen pits; and the kings of Sodom and Gomorrah, in their flight, threw themselves into them, while the rest escaped to the hill country.

content: 11 The invaders seized all the wealth of Sodom and Gomorrah and all their provisions, and went their way.
content_old: 11 The invaders seized all the wealth of Sodom and Gomorrah and all their provisions, and went their way.

content: 12 They also took Lot, the son of Abram’s brother, and his possessions, and departed; for he had settled in Sodom.
content_old: 12 They also took Lot, the son of Abram’s brother, and his possessions, and departed; for he had settled in Sodom.

content: 13 A fugitive brought the news to Abram the Hebrew, who was dwelling at the terebinths of Mamre the Amorite, kinsman of Eshkol and Aner, these being Abram’s allies.
content_old: 13 A fugitive brought the news to Abram the Hebrew, who was dwelling at the terebinths of Mamre the Amorite, kinsman of Eshkol and Aner, these being Abram’s allies.

content: 14 When Abram heard that his kinsman had been taken captive, he mustered his retainers, born into his household, numbering three hundred and eighteen, and went in pursuit as far as Dan.
content_old: 14 When Abram heard that his kinsman had been taken captive, he mustered his retainers, born into his household, numbering three hundred and eighteen, and went in pursuit as far as Dan.

content: 15 At night, he and his servants deployed against them and defeated them; and he pursued them as far as Hobah, which is north of Damascus.
content_old: 15 At night, he and his servants deployed against them and defeated them; and he pursued them as far as Hobah, which is north of Damascus.

content: 16 He brought back all the possessions; he also brought back his kinsman Lot and his possessions, and the women and the rest of the people.
content_old: 16 He brought back all the possessions; he also brought back his kinsman Lot and his possessions, and the women and the rest of the people.

content: 17 When he returned from defeating Chedorlaomer and the kings with him, the king of Sodom came out to meet him in the Valley of Shaveh, which is the Valley of the King.
content_old: 17 When he returned from defeating Chedorlaomer and the kings with him, the king of Sodom came out to meet him in the Valley of Shaveh, which is the Valley of the King.

content: 18 And King Melchizedek of Salem brought out bread and wine; he was a priest of God Most High.
content_old: 18 And King Melchizedek of Salem brought out bread and wine; he was a priest of God Most High.

content: 19 He blessed him, saying, “Blessed be Abram of God Most High, Creator of heaven and earth.
content_old: 19 He blessed him, saying, “Blessed be Abram of God Most High, Creator of heaven and earth.

content: 20 And blessed be God Most High, Who has delivered your foes into your hand.” And Abram gave him a tenth of everything.
content_old: 20 And blessed be God Most High, Who has delivered your foes into your hand.” And Abram gave him a tenth of everything.

content: 21 Then the king of Sodom said to Abram, “Give me the persons, and take the possessions for yourself.”
content_old: 21 Then the king of Sodom said to Abram, “Give me the persons, and take the possessions for yourself.”

content: 22 But Abram said to the king of Sodom, “I swear to the LORD, God Most High, Creator of heaven and earth:
content_old: 22 But Abram said to the king of Sodom, “I swear to the LORD, God Most High, Creator of heaven and earth:

content: 23 I will not take so much as a thread or a sandal strap of what is yours; you shall not say, ‘It is I who made Abram rich.’
content_old: 23 I will not take so much as a thread or a sandal strap of what is yours; you shall not say, ‘It is I who made Abram rich.’

content: 1 Some time later, the word of the LORD came to Abram in a vision. He said, “Fear not, Abram, I am a shield to you; Your reward shall be very great.”
content_old: 1 Some time later, the word of the LORD came to Abram in a vision. He said, “Fear not, Abram, I am a shield to you; Your reward shall be very great.”

content: 2 But Abram said, “O Lord GOD, what can You give me, seeing that I shall die childless, and the one in charge of my household is Dammesek Eliezer!”
content_old: 2 But Abram said, “O Lord GOD, what can You give me, seeing that I shall die childless, and the one in charge of my household is Dammesek Eliezer!”

content: 3 Abram said further, “Since You have granted me no offspring, my steward will be my heir.”
content_old: 3 Abram said further, “Since You have granted me no offspring, my steward will be my heir.”

content: 4 The word of the LORD came to him in reply, “That one shall not be your heir; none but your very own issue shall be your heir.”
content_old: 4 The word of the LORD came to him in reply, “That one shall not be your heir; none but your very own issue shall be your heir.”

content: 5 He took him outside and said, “Look toward heaven and count the stars, if you are able to count them.” And He added, “So shall your offspring be.”
content_old: 5 He took him outside and said, “Look toward heaven and count the stars, if you are able to count them.” And He added, “So shall your offspring be.”

content: 6 And because he put his trust in the LORD, He reckoned it to his merit.
content_old: 6 And because he put his trust in the LORD, He reckoned it to his merit.

content: 7 Then He said to him, “I am the LORD who brought you out from Ur of the Chaldeans to assign this land to you as a possession.”
content_old: 7 Then He said to him, “I am the LORD who brought you out from Ur of the Chaldeans to assign this land to you as a possession.”

content: 8 And he said, “O Lord GOD, how shall I know that I am to possess it?”
content_old: 8 And he said, “O Lord GOD, how shall I know that I am to possess it?”

content: 9 He answered, “Bring Me a three-year-old heifer, a three-year-old she-goat, a three-year-old ram, a turtledove, and a young bird.”
content_old: 9 He answered, “Bring Me a three-year-old heifer, a three-year-old she-goat, a three-year-old ram, a turtledove, and a young bird.”

content: 10 He brought Him all these and cut them in two, placing each half opposite the other; but he did not cut up the bird.
content_old: 10 He brought Him all these and cut them in two, placing each half opposite the other; but he did not cut up the bird.

content: 11 Birds of prey came down upon the carcasses, and Abram drove them away.
content_old: 11 Birds of prey came down upon the carcasses, and Abram drove them away.

content: 12 As the sun was about to set, a deep sleep fell upon Abram, and a great dark dread descended upon him.
content_old: 12 As the sun was about to set, a deep sleep fell upon Abram, and a great dark dread descended upon him.

content: 13 And He said to Abram, “Know well that your offspring shall be strangers in a land not theirs, and they shall be enslaved and oppressed four hundred years;
content_old: 13 And He said to Abram, “Know well that your offspring shall be strangers in a land not theirs, and they shall be enslaved and oppressed four hundred years;

content: 14 but I will execute judgment on the nation they shall serve, and in the end they shall go free with great wealth.
content_old: 14 but I will execute judgment on the nation they shall serve, and in the end they shall go free with great wealth.

content: 15 As for you, You shall go to your fathers in peace; You shall be buried at a ripe old age.
content_old: 15 As for you, You shall go to your fathers in peace; You shall be buried at a ripe old age.

content: 16 And they shall return here in the fourth generation, for the iniquity of the Amorites is not yet complete.”
content_old: 16 And they shall return here in the fourth generation, for the iniquity of the Amorites is not yet complete.”

content: 17 When the sun set and it was very dark, there appeared a smoking oven, and a flaming torch which passed between those pieces.
content_old: 17 When the sun set and it was very dark, there appeared a smoking oven, and a flaming torch which passed between those pieces.

content: 18 On that day the LORD made a covenant with Abram, saying, “To your offspring I assign this land, from the river of Egypt to the great river, the river Euphrates:
content_old: 18 On that day the LORD made a covenant with Abram, saying, “To your offspring I assign this land, from the river of Egypt to the great river, the river Euphrates:

content: 19 the Kenites, the Kenizzites, the Kadmonites,

content: 20 the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Rephaim,
content_old: 20 the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Rephaim,

content: 1 Sarai, Abram’s wife, had borne him no children. She had an Egyptian maidservant whose name was Hagar.
content_old: 1 Sarai, Abram’s wife, had borne him no children. She had an Egyptian maidservant whose name was Hagar.

content: 2 And Sarai said to Abram, “Look, the LORD has kept me from bearing. Consort with my maid; perhaps I shall have a son through her.” And Abram heeded Sarai’s request.
content_old: 2 And Sarai said to Abram, “Look, the LORD has kept me from bearing. Consort with my maid; perhaps I shall have a son through her.” And Abram heeded Sarai’s request.

content: 3 So Sarai, Abram’s wife, took her maid, Hagar the Egyptian—after Abram had dwelt in the land of Canaan ten years—and gave her to her husband Abram as concubine.
content_old: 3 So Sarai, Abram’s wife, took her maid, Hagar the Egyptian—after Abram had dwelt in the land of Canaan ten years—and gave her to her husband Abram as concubine.

content: 4 He cohabited with Hagar and she conceived; and when she saw that she had conceived, her mistress was lowered in her esteem.
content_old: 4 He cohabited with Hagar and she conceived; and when she saw that she had conceived, her mistress was lowered in her esteem.

content: 5 And Sarai said to Abram, “The wrong done me is your fault! I myself put my maid in your bosom; now that she sees that she is pregnant, I am lowered in her esteem. The LORD decide between you and me!”
content_old: 5 And Sarai said to Abram, “The wrong done me is your fault! I myself put my maid in your bosom; now that she sees that she is pregnant, I am lowered in her esteem. The LORD decide between you and me!”

content: 6 Abram said to Sarai, “Your maid is in your hands. Deal with her as you think right.” Then Sarai treated her harshly, and she ran away from her.
content_old: 6 Abram said to Sarai, “Your maid is in your hands. Deal with her as you think right.” Then Sarai treated her harshly, and she ran away from her.

content: 7 An angel of the LORD found her by a spring of water in the wilderness, the spring on the road to Shur,
content_old: 7 An angel of the LORD found her by a spring of water in the wilderness, the spring on the road to Shur,

content: 8 and said, “Hagar, slave of Sarai, where have you come from, and where are you going?” And she said, “I am running away from my mistress Sarai.”
content_old: 8 and said, “Hagar, slave of Sarai, where have you come from, and where are you going?” And she said, “I am running away from my mistress Sarai.”

content: 9 And the angel of the LORD said to her, “Go back to your mistress, and submit to her harsh treatment.”
content_old: 9 And the angel of the LORD said to her, “Go back to your mistress, and submit to her harsh treatment.”

content: 10 And the angel of the LORD said to her, “I will greatly increase your offspring, And they shall be too many to count.”
content_old: 10 And the angel of the LORD said to her, “I will greatly increase your offspring, And they shall be too many to count.”

content: 11 The angel of the LORD said to her further, “Behold, you are with child And shall bear a son; You shall call him Ishmael, For the LORD has paid heed to your suffering.
content_old: 11 The angel of the LORD said to her further, “Behold, you are with child And shall bear a son; You shall call him Ishmael, For the LORD has paid heed to your suffering.

content: 12 He shall be a wild ass of a man; His hand against everyone, And everyone’s hand against him; He shall dwell alongside of all his kinsmen.”
content_old: 12 He shall be a wild ass of a man; His hand against everyone, And everyone’s hand against him; He shall dwell alongside of all his kinsmen.”

content: 13 And she called the LORD who spoke to her, “You Are El-roi,” by which she meant, “Have I not gone on seeing after He saw me!”
content_old: 13 And she called the LORD who spoke to her, “You Are El-roi,” by which she meant, “Have I not gone on seeing after He saw me!”

content: 14 Therefore the well was called Beer-lahai-roi; it is between Kadesh and Bered.—
content_old: 14 Therefore the well was called Beer-lahai-roi; it is between Kadesh and Bered.—

content: 15 Hagar bore a son to Abram, and Abram gave the son that Hagar bore him the name Ishmael.
content_old: 15 Hagar bore a son to Abram, and Abram gave the son that Hagar bore him the name Ishmael.

content: 1 When Abram was ninety-nine years old, the LORD appeared to Abram and said to him, “I am El Shaddai. Walk in My ways and be blameless.
content_old: 1 When Abram was ninety-nine years old, the LORD appeared to Abram and said to him, “I am El Shaddai. Walk in My ways and be blameless.

content: 2 I will establish My covenant between Me and you, and I will make you exceedingly numerous.”
content_old: 2 I will establish My covenant between Me and you, and I will make you exceedingly numerous.”

content: 3 Abram threw himself on his face; and God spoke to him further,
content_old: 3 Abram threw himself on his face; and God spoke to him further,

content: 4 “As for Me, this is My covenant with you: You shall be the father of a multitude of nations.
content_old: 4 “As for Me, this is My covenant with you: You shall be the father of a multitude of nations.

content: 5 And you shall no longer be called Abram, but your name shall be Abraham, for I make you the father of a multitude of nations.
content_old: 5 And you shall no longer be called Abram, but your name shall be Abraham, for I make you the father of a multitude of nations.

content: 6 I will make you exceedingly fertile, and make nations of you; and kings shall come forth from you.
content_old: 6 I will make you exceedingly fertile, and make nations of you; and kings shall come forth from you.

content: 7 I will maintain My covenant between Me and you, and your offspring to come, as an everlasting covenant throughout the ages, to be God to you and to your offspring to come.
content_old: 7 I will maintain My covenant between Me and you, and your offspring to come, as an everlasting covenant throughout the ages, to be God to you and to your offspring to come.

content: 8 I assign the land you sojourn in to you and your offspring to come, all the land of Canaan, as an everlasting holding. I will be their God.”
content_old: 8 I assign the land you sojourn in to you and your offspring to come, all the land of Canaan, as an everlasting holding. I will be their God.”

content: 9 God further said to Abraham, “As for you, you and your offspring to come throughout the ages shall keep My covenant.
content_old: 9 God further said to Abraham, “As for you, you and your offspring to come throughout the ages shall keep My covenant.

content: 10 Such shall be the covenant between Me and you and your offspring to follow which you shall keep: every male among you shall be circumcised.
content_old: 10 Such shall be the covenant between Me and you and your offspring to follow which you shall keep: every male among you shall be circumcised.

content: 11 You shall circumcise the flesh of your foreskin, and that shall be the sign of the covenant between Me and you.
content_old: 11 You shall circumcise the flesh of your foreskin, and that shall be the sign of the covenant between Me and you.

content: 12 And throughout the generations, every male among you shall be circumcised at the age of eight days. As for the homeborn slave and the one bought from an outsider who is not of your offspring,
content_old: 12 And throughout the generations, every male among you shall be circumcised at the age of eight days. As for the homeborn slave and the one bought from an outsider who is not of your offspring,

content: 13 they must be circumcised, homeborn, and purchased alike. Thus shall My covenant be marked in your flesh as an everlasting pact.
content_old: 13 they must be circumcised, homeborn, and purchased alike. Thus shall My covenant be marked in your flesh as an everlasting pact.

content: 14 And if any male who is uncircumcised fails to circumcise the flesh of his foreskin, that person shall be cut off from his kin; he has broken My covenant.”
content_old: 14 And if any male who is uncircumcised fails to circumcise the flesh of his foreskin, that person shall be cut off from his kin; he has broken My covenant.”

content: 15 And God said to Abraham, “As for your wife Sarai, you shall not call her Sarai, but her name shall be Sarah.
content_old: 15 And God said to Abraham, “As for your wife Sarai, you shall not call her Sarai, but her name shall be Sarah.

content: 16 I will bless her; indeed, I will give you a son by her. I will bless her so that she shall give rise to nations; rulers of peoples shall issue from her.”
content_old: 16 I will bless her; indeed, I will give you a son by her. I will bless her so that she shall give rise to nations; rulers of peoples shall issue from her.”

content: 17 Abraham threw himself on his face and laughed, as he said to himself, “Can a child be born to a man a hundred years old, or can Sarah bear a child at ninety?”
content_old: 17 Abraham threw himself on his face and laughed, as he said to himself, “Can a child be born to a man a hundred years old, or can Sarah bear a child at ninety?”

content: 18 And Abraham said to God, “O that Ishmael might live by Your favor!”
content_old: 18 And Abraham said to God, “O that Ishmael might live by Your favor!”

content: 19 God said, “Nevertheless, Sarah your wife shall bear you a son, and you shall name him Isaac; and I will maintain My covenant with him as an everlasting covenant for his offspring to come.
content_old: 19 God said, “Nevertheless, Sarah your wife shall bear you a son, and you shall name him Isaac; and I will maintain My covenant with him as an everlasting covenant for his offspring to come.

content: 20 As for Ishmael, I have heeded you. I hereby bless him. I will make him fertile and exceedingly numerous. He shall be the father of twelve chieftains, and I will make of him a great nation.
content_old: 20 As for Ishmael, I have heeded you. I hereby bless him. I will make him fertile and exceedingly numerous. He shall be the father of twelve chieftains, and I will make of him a great nation.

content: 21 But My covenant I will maintain with Isaac, whom Sarah shall bear to you at this season next year.”
content_old: 21 But My covenant I will maintain with Isaac, whom Sarah shall bear to you at this season next year.”

content: 22 And when He was done speaking with him, God was gone from Abraham.
content_old: 22 And when He was done speaking with him, God was gone from Abraham.

content: 23 Then Abraham took his son Ishmael, and all his homeborn slaves and all those he had bought, every male in Abraham’s household, and he circumcised the flesh of their foreskins on that very day, as God had spoken to him.
content_old: 23 Then Abraham took his son Ishmael, and all his homeborn slaves and all those he had bought, every male in Abraham’s household, and he circumcised the flesh of their foreskins on that very day, as God had spoken to him.

content: 24 Abraham was ninety-nine years old when he circumcised the flesh of his foreskin,
content_old: 24 Abraham was ninety-nine years old when he circumcised the flesh of his foreskin,

content: 25 and his son Ishmael was thirteen years old when he was circumcised in the flesh of his foreskin.
content_old: 25 and his son Ishmael was thirteen years old when he was circumcised in the flesh of his foreskin.

content: 26 Thus Abraham and his son Ishmael were circumcised on that very day;
content_old: 26 Thus Abraham and his son Ishmael were circumcised on that very day;

content: 1 The LORD appeared to him by the terebinths of Mamre; he was sitting at the entrance of the tent as the day grew hot.
content_old: 1 The LORD appeared to him by the terebinths of Mamre; he was sitting at the entrance of the tent as the day grew hot.

content: 2 Looking up, he saw three men standing near him. As soon as he saw them, he ran from the entrance of the tent to greet them and, bowing to the ground,
content_old: 2 Looking up, he saw three men standing near him. As soon as he saw them, he ran from the entrance of the tent to greet them and, bowing to the ground,

content: 3 he said, “My lords, if it please you, do not go on past your servant.
content_old: 3 he said, “My lords, if it please you, do not go on past your servant.

content: 4 Let a little water be brought; bathe your feet and recline under the tree.
content_old: 4 Let a little water be brought; bathe your feet and recline under the tree.

content: 5 And let me fetch a morsel of bread that you may refresh yourselves; then go on—seeing that you have come your servant’s way.” They replied, “Do as you have said.”
content_old: 5 And let me fetch a morsel of bread that you may refresh yourselves; then go on—seeing that you have come your servant’s way.” They replied, “Do as you have said.”

content: 6 Abraham hastened into the tent to Sarah, and said, “Quick, three seahs of choice flour! Knead and make cakes!”
content_old: 6 Abraham hastened into the tent to Sarah, and said, “Quick, three seahs of choice flour! Knead and make cakes!”

content: 7 Then Abraham ran to the herd, took a calf, tender and choice, and gave it to a servant-boy, who hastened to prepare it.
content_old: 7 Then Abraham ran to the herd, took a calf, tender and choice, and gave it to a servant-boy, who hastened to prepare it.

content: 8 He took curds and milk and the calf that had been prepared and set these before them; and he waited on them under the tree as they ate.
content_old: 8 He took curds and milk and the calf that had been prepared and set these before them; and he waited on them under the tree as they ate.

content: 9 They said to him, “Where is your wife Sarah?” And he replied, “There, in the tent.”
content_old: 9 They said to him, “Where is your wife Sarah?” And he replied, “There, in the tent.”

content: 10 Then one said, “I will return to you next year, and your wife Sarah shall have a son!” Sarah was listening at the entrance of the tent, which was behind him.
content_old: 10 Then one said, “I will return to you next year, and your wife Sarah shall have a son!” Sarah was listening at the entrance of the tent, which was behind him.

content: 11 Now Abraham and Sarah were old, advanced in years; Sarah had stopped having the periods of women.
content_old: 11 Now Abraham and Sarah were old, advanced in years; Sarah had stopped having the periods of women.

content: 12 And Sarah laughed to herself, saying, “Now that I am withered, am I to have enjoyment—with my husband so old?”
content_old: 12 And Sarah laughed to herself, saying, “Now that I am withered, am I to have enjoyment—with my husband so old?”

content: 13 Then the LORD said to Abraham, “Why did Sarah laugh, saying, ‘Shall I in truth bear a child, old as I am?’
content_old: 13 Then the LORD said to Abraham, “Why did Sarah laugh, saying, ‘Shall I in truth bear a child, old as I am?’

content: 14 Is anything too wondrous for the LORD? I will return to you at the time next year, and Sarah shall have a son.”
content_old: 14 Is anything too wondrous for the LORD? I will return to you at the time next year, and Sarah shall have a son.”

content: 15 Sarah lied, saying, “I did not laugh,” for she was frightened. But He replied, “You did laugh.”
content_old: 15 Sarah lied, saying, “I did not laugh,” for she was frightened. But He replied, “You did laugh.”

content: 16 The men set out from there and looked down toward Sodom, Abraham walking with them to see them off.
content_old: 16 The men set out from there and looked down toward Sodom, Abraham walking with them to see them off.

content: 17 Now the LORD had said, “Shall I hide from Abraham what I am about to do,
content_old: 17 Now the LORD had said, “Shall I hide from Abraham what I am about to do,

content: 18 since Abraham is to become a great and populous nation and all the nations of the earth are to bless themselves by him?
content_old: 18 since Abraham is to become a great and populous nation and all the nations of the earth are to bless themselves by him?

content: 19 For I have singled him out, that he may instruct his children and his posterity to keep the way of the LORD by doing what is just and right, in order that the LORD may bring about for Abraham what He has promised him.”
content_old: 19 For I have singled him out, that he may instruct his children and his posterity to keep the way of the LORD by doing what is just and right, in order that the LORD may bring about for Abraham what He has promised him.”

content: 20 Then the LORD said, “The outrage of Sodom and Gomorrah is so great, and their sin so grave!
content_old: 20 Then the LORD said, “The outrage of Sodom and Gomorrah is so great, and their sin so grave!

content: 21 I will go down to see whether they have acted altogether according to the outcry that has reached Me; if not, I will take note.”
content_old: 21 I will go down to see whether they have acted altogether according to the outcry that has reached Me; if not, I will take note.”

content: 22 The men went on from there to Sodom, while Abraham remained standing before the LORD.
content_old: 22 The men went on from there to Sodom, while Abraham remained standing before the LORD.

content: 23 Abraham came forward and said, “Will You sweep away the innocent along with the guilty?
content_old: 23 Abraham came forward and said, “Will You sweep away the innocent along with the guilty?

content: 24 What if there should be fifty innocent within the city; will You then wipe out the place and not forgive it for the sake of the innocent fifty who are in it?
content_old: 24 What if there should be fifty innocent within the city; will You then wipe out the place and not forgive it for the sake of the innocent fifty who are in it?

content: 25 Far be it from You to do such a thing, to bring death upon the innocent as well as the guilty, so that innocent and guilty fare alike. Far be it from You! Shall not the Judge of all the earth deal justly?”
content_old: 25 Far be it from You to do such a thing, to bring death upon the innocent as well as the guilty, so that innocent and guilty fare alike. Far be it from You! Shall not the Judge of all the earth deal justly?”

content: 26 And the LORD answered, “If I find within the city of Sodom fifty innocent ones, I will forgive the whole place for their sake.”
content_old: 26 And the LORD answered, “If I find within the city of Sodom fifty innocent ones, I will forgive the whole place for their sake.”

content: 27 Abraham spoke up, saying, “Here I venture to speak to my Lord, I who am but dust and ashes:
content_old: 27 Abraham spoke up, saying, “Here I venture to speak to my Lord, I who am but dust and ashes:

content: 28 What if the fifty innocent should lack five? Will You destroy the whole city for want of the five?” And He answered, “I will not destroy if I find forty-five there.”
content_old: 28 What if the fifty innocent should lack five? Will You destroy the whole city for want of the five?” And He answered, “I will not destroy if I find forty-five there.”

content: 29 But he spoke to Him again, and said, “What if forty should be found there?” And He answered, “I will not do it, for the sake of the forty.”
content_old: 29 But he spoke to Him again, and said, “What if forty should be found there?” And He answered, “I will not do it, for the sake of the forty.”

content: 30 And he said, “Let not my Lord be angry if I go on: What if thirty should be found there?” And He answered, “I will not do it if I find thirty there.”
content_old: 30 And he said, “Let not my Lord be angry if I go on: What if thirty should be found there?” And He answered, “I will not do it if I find thirty there.”

content: 31 And he said, “I venture again to speak to my Lord: What if twenty should be found there?” And He answered, “I will not destroy, for the sake of the twenty.”
content_old: 31 And he said, “I venture again to speak to my Lord: What if twenty should be found there?” And He answered, “I will not destroy, for the sake of the twenty.”

content: 32 And he said, “Let not my Lord be angry if I speak but this last time: What if ten should be found there?” And He answered, “I will not destroy, for the sake of the ten.”
content_old: 32 And he said, “Let not my Lord be angry if I speak but this last time: What if ten should be found there?” And He answered, “I will not destroy, for the sake of the ten.”

content: 1 The two angels arrived in Sodom in the evening, as Lot was sitting in the gate of Sodom. When Lot saw them, he rose to greet them and, bowing low with his face to the ground,
content_old: 1 The two angels arrived in Sodom in the evening, as Lot was sitting in the gate of Sodom. When Lot saw them, he rose to greet them and, bowing low with his face to the ground,

content: 2 he said, “Please, my lords, turn aside to your servant’s house to spend the night, and bathe your feet; then you may be on your way early.” But they said, “No, we will spend the night in the square.”
content_old: 2 he said, “Please, my lords, turn aside to your servant’s house to spend the night, and bathe your feet; then you may be on your way early.” But they said, “No, we will spend the night in the square.”

content: 3 But he urged them strongly, so they turned his way and entered his house. He prepared a feast for them and baked unleavened bread, and they ate.
content_old: 3 But he urged them strongly, so they turned his way and entered his house. He prepared a feast for them and baked unleavened bread, and they ate.

content: 4 They had not yet lain down, when the townspeople, the men of Sodom, young and old—all the people to the last man—gathered about the house.
content_old: 4 They had not yet lain down, when the townspeople, the men of Sodom, young and old—all the people to the last man—gathered about the house.

content: 5 And they shouted to Lot and said to him, “Where are the men who came to you tonight? Bring them out to us, that we may be intimate with them.”
content_old: 5 And they shouted to Lot and said to him, “Where are the men who came to you tonight? Bring them out to us, that we may be intimate with them.”

content: 6 So Lot went out to them to the entrance, shut the door behind him,
content_old: 6 So Lot went out to them to the entrance, shut the door behind him,

content: 7 and said, “I beg you, my friends, do not commit such a wrong.
content_old: 7 and said, “I beg you, my friends, do not commit such a wrong.

content: 8 Look, I have two daughters who have not known a man. Let me bring them out to you, and you may do to them as you please; but do not do anything to these men, since they have come under the shelter of my roof.”
content_old: 8 Look, I have two daughters who have not known a man. Let me bring them out to you, and you may do to them as you please; but do not do anything to these men, since they have come under the shelter of my roof.”

content: 9 But they said, “Stand back! The fellow,” they said, “came here as an alien, and already he acts the ruler! Now we will deal worse with you than with them.” And they pressed hard against the person of Lot, and moved forward to break the door.
content_old: 9 But they said, “Stand back! The fellow,” they said, “came here as an alien, and already he acts the ruler! Now we will deal worse with you than with them.” And they pressed hard against the person of Lot, and moved forward to break the door.

content: 10 But the men stretched out their hands and pulled Lot into the house with them, and shut the door.
content_old: 10 But the men stretched out their hands and pulled Lot into the house with them, and shut the door.

content: 11 And the people who were at the entrance of the house, young and old, they struck with blinding light, so that they were helpless to find the entrance.
content_old: 11 And the people who were at the entrance of the house, young and old, they struck with blinding light, so that they were helpless to find the entrance.

content: 12 Then the men said to Lot, “Whom else have you here? Sons-in-law, your sons and daughters, or anyone else that you have in the city—bring them out of the place.
content_old: 12 Then the men said to Lot, “Whom else have you here? Sons-in-law, your sons and daughters, or anyone else that you have in the city—bring them out of the place.

content: 13 For we are about to destroy this place; because the outcry against them before the LORD has become so great that the LORD has sent us to destroy it.”
content_old: 13 For we are about to destroy this place; because the outcry against them before the LORD has become so great that the LORD has sent us to destroy it.”

content: 14 So Lot went out and spoke to his sons-in-law, who had married his daughters, and said, “Up, get out of this place, for the LORD is about to destroy the city.” But he seemed to his sons-in-law as one who jests.
content_old: 14 So Lot went out and spoke to his sons-in-law, who had married his daughters, and said, “Up, get out of this place, for the LORD is about to destroy the city.” But he seemed to his sons-in-law as one who jests.

content: 15 As dawn broke, the angels urged Lot on, saying, “Up, take your wife and your two remaining daughters, lest you be swept away because of the iniquity of the city.”
content_old: 15 As dawn broke, the angels urged Lot on, saying, “Up, take your wife and your two remaining daughters, lest you be swept away because of the iniquity of the city.”

content: 16 Still he delayed. So the men seized his hand, and the hands of his wife and his two daughters—in the LORD‘s mercy on him—and brought him out and left him outside the city.
content_old: 16 Still he delayed. So the men seized his hand, and the hands of his wife and his two daughters—in the LORD‘s mercy on him—and brought him out and left him outside the city.

content: 17 When they had brought them outside, one said, “Flee for your life! Do not look behind you, nor stop anywhere in the Plain; flee to the hills, lest you be swept away.”
content_old: 17 When they had brought them outside, one said, “Flee for your life! Do not look behind you, nor stop anywhere in the Plain; flee to the hills, lest you be swept away.”

content: 18 But Lot said to them, “Oh no, my lord!
content_old: 18 But Lot said to them, “Oh no, my lord!

content: 19 You have been so gracious to your servant, and have already shown me so much kindness in order to save my life; but I cannot flee to the hills, lest the disaster overtake me and I die.
content_old: 19 You have been so gracious to your servant, and have already shown me so much kindness in order to save my life; but I cannot flee to the hills, lest the disaster overtake me and I die.

content: 20 Look, that town there is near enough to flee to; it is such a little place! Let me flee there—it is such a little place—and let my life be saved.”
content_old: 20 Look, that town there is near enough to flee to; it is such a little place! Let me flee there—it is such a little place—and let my life be saved.”

content: 21 He replied, “Very well, I will grant you this favor too, and I will not annihilate the town of which you have spoken.
content_old: 21 He replied, “Very well, I will grant you this favor too, and I will not annihilate the town of which you have spoken.

content: 22 Hurry, flee there, for I cannot do anything until you arrive there.” Hence the town came to be called Zoar.
content_old: 22 Hurry, flee there, for I cannot do anything until you arrive there.” Hence the town came to be called Zoar.

content: 23 As the sun rose upon the earth and Lot entered Zoar,
content_old: 23 As the sun rose upon the earth and Lot entered Zoar,

content: 24 the LORD rained upon Sodom and Gomorrah sulfurous fire from the LORD out of heaven.
content_old: 24 the LORD rained upon Sodom and Gomorrah sulfurous fire from the LORD out of heaven.

content: 25 He annihilated those cities and the entire Plain, and all the inhabitants of the cities and the vegetation of the ground.
content_old: 25 He annihilated those cities and the entire Plain, and all the inhabitants of the cities and the vegetation of the ground.

content: 26 Lot’s wife looked back, and she thereupon turned into a pillar of salt.
content_old: 26 Lot’s wife looked back, and she thereupon turned into a pillar of salt.

content: 27 Next morning, Abraham hurried to the place where he had stood before the LORD,
content_old: 27 Next morning, Abraham hurried to the place where he had stood before the LORD,

content: 28 and, looking down toward Sodom and Gomorrah and all the land of the Plain, he saw the smoke of the land rising like the smoke of a kiln.
content_old: 28 and, looking down toward Sodom and Gomorrah and all the land of the Plain, he saw the smoke of the land rising like the smoke of a kiln.

content: 29 Thus it was that, when God destroyed the cities of the Plain and annihilated the cities where Lot dwelt, God was mindful of Abraham and removed Lot from the midst of the upheaval.
content_old: 29 Thus it was that, when God destroyed the cities of the Plain and annihilated the cities where Lot dwelt, God was mindful of Abraham and removed Lot from the midst of the upheaval.

content: 30 Lot went up from Zoar and settled in the hill country with his two daughters, for he was afraid to dwell in Zoar; and he and his two daughters lived in a cave.
content_old: 30 Lot went up from Zoar and settled in the hill country with his two daughters, for he was afraid to dwell in Zoar; and he and his two daughters lived in a cave.

content: 31 And the older one said to the younger, “Our father is old, and there is not a man on earth to consort with us in the way of all the world.
content_old: 31 And the older one said to the younger, “Our father is old, and there is not a man on earth to consort with us in the way of all the world.

content: 32 Come, let us make our father drink wine, and let us lie with him, that we may maintain life through our father.”
content_old: 32 Come, let us make our father drink wine, and let us lie with him, that we may maintain life through our father.”

content: 33 That night they made their father drink wine, and the older one went in and lay with her father; he did not know when she lay down or when she rose.
content_old: 33 That night they made their father drink wine, and the older one went in and lay with her father; he did not know when she lay down or when she rose.

content: 34 The next day the older one said to the younger, “See, I lay with Father last night; let us make him drink wine tonight also, and you go and lie with him, that we may maintain life through our father.”
content_old: 34 The next day the older one said to the younger, “See, I lay with Father last night; let us make him drink wine tonight also, and you go and lie with him, that we may maintain life through our father.”

content: 35 That night also they made their father drink wine, and the younger one went and lay with him; he did not know when she lay down or when she rose.
content_old: 35 That night also they made their father drink wine, and the younger one went and lay with him; he did not know when she lay down or when she rose.

content: 36 Thus the two daughters of Lot came to be with child by their father.
content_old: 36 Thus the two daughters of Lot came to be with child by their father.

content: 37 The older one bore a son and named him Moab; he is the father of the Moabites of today.
content_old: 37 The older one bore a son and named him Moab; he is the father of the Moabites of today.

content: 1 Abraham journeyed from there to the region of the Negeb and settled between Kadesh and Shur. While he was sojourning in Gerar,
content_old: 1 Abraham journeyed from there to the region of the Negeb and settled between Kadesh and Shur. While he was sojourning in Gerar,

content: 2 Abraham said of Sarah his wife, “She is my sister.” So King Abimelech of Gerar had Sarah brought to him.
content_old: 2 Abraham said of Sarah his wife, “She is my sister.” So King Abimelech of Gerar had Sarah brought to him.

content: 3 But God came to Abimelech in a dream by night and said to him, “You are to die because of the woman that you have taken, for she is a married woman.”
content_old: 3 But God came to Abimelech in a dream by night and said to him, “You are to die because of the woman that you have taken, for she is a married woman.”

content: 4 Now Abimelech had not approached her. He said, “O Lord, will You slay people even though innocent?
content_old: 4 Now Abimelech had not approached her. He said, “O Lord, will You slay people even though innocent?

content: 5 He himself said to me, ‘She is my sister!’ And she also said, ‘He is my brother.’ When I did this, my heart was blameless and my hands were clean.”
content_old: 5 He himself said to me, ‘She is my sister!’ And she also said, ‘He is my brother.’ When I did this, my heart was blameless and my hands were clean.”

content: 6 And God said to him in the dream, “I knew that you did this with a blameless heart, and so I kept you from sinning against Me. That was why I did not let you touch her.
content_old: 6 And God said to him in the dream, “I knew that you did this with a blameless heart, and so I kept you from sinning against Me. That was why I did not let you touch her.

content: 7 Therefore, restore the man’s wife—since he is a prophet, he will intercede for you—to save your life. If you fail to restore her, know that you shall die, you and all that are yours.”
content_old: 7 Therefore, restore the man’s wife—since he is a prophet, he will intercede for you—to save your life. If you fail to restore her, know that you shall die, you and all that are yours.”

content: 8 Early next morning, Abimelech called his servants and told them all that had happened; and the men were greatly frightened.
content_old: 8 Early next morning, Abimelech called his servants and told them all that had happened; and the men were greatly frightened.

content: 9 Then Abimelech summoned Abraham and said to him, “What have you done to us? What wrong have I done that you should bring so great a guilt upon me and my kingdom? You have done to me things that ought not to be done.
content_old: 9 Then Abimelech summoned Abraham and said to him, “What have you done to us? What wrong have I done that you should bring so great a guilt upon me and my kingdom? You have done to me things that ought not to be done.

content: 10 What, then,” Abimelech demanded of Abraham, “was your purpose in doing this thing?”
content_old: 10 What, then,” Abimelech demanded of Abraham, “was your purpose in doing this thing?”

content: 11 “I thought,” said Abraham, “surely there is no fear of God in this place, and they will kill me because of my wife.
content_old: 11 “I thought,” said Abraham, “surely there is no fear of God in this place, and they will kill me because of my wife.

content: 12 And besides, she is in truth my sister, my father’s daughter though not my mother’s; and she became my wife.
content_old: 12 And besides, she is in truth my sister, my father’s daughter though not my mother’s; and she became my wife.

content: 13 So when God made me wander from my father’s house, I said to her, ‘Let this be the kindness that you shall do me: whatever place we come to, say there of me: He is my brother.’ ”
content_old: 13 So when God made me wander from my father’s house, I said to her, ‘Let this be the kindness that you shall do me: whatever place we come to, say there of me: He is my brother.’ ”

content: 14 Abimelech took sheep and oxen, and male and female slaves, and gave them to Abraham; and he restored his wife Sarah to him.
content_old: 14 Abimelech took sheep and oxen, and male and female slaves, and gave them to Abraham; and he restored his wife Sarah to him.

content: 15 And Abimelech said, “Here, my land is before you; settle wherever you please.”
content_old: 15 And Abimelech said, “Here, my land is before you; settle wherever you please.”

content: 16 And to Sarah he said, “I herewith give your brother a thousand pieces of silver; this will serve you as vindication before all who are with you, and you are cleared before everyone.”
content_old: 16 And to Sarah he said, “I herewith give your brother a thousand pieces of silver; this will serve you as vindication before all who are with you, and you are cleared before everyone.”

content: 17 Abraham then prayed to God, and God healed Abimelech and his wife and his slave girls, so that they bore children;
content_old: 17 Abraham then prayed to God, and God healed Abimelech and his wife and his slave girls, so that they bore children;

content: 1 The LORD took note of Sarah as He had promised, and the LORD did for Sarah as He had spoken.
content_old: 1 The LORD took note of Sarah as He had promised, and the LORD did for Sarah as He had spoken.

content: 2 Sarah conceived and bore a son to Abraham in his old age, at the set time of which God had spoken.
content_old: 2 Sarah conceived and bore a son to Abraham in his old age, at the set time of which God had spoken.

content: 3 Abraham gave his newborn son, whom Sarah had borne him, the name of Isaac.
content_old: 3 Abraham gave his newborn son, whom Sarah had borne him, the name of Isaac.

content: 4 And when his son Isaac was eight days old, Abraham circumcised him, as God had commanded him.
content_old: 4 And when his son Isaac was eight days old, Abraham circumcised him, as God had commanded him.

content: 5 Now Abraham was a hundred years old when his son Isaac was born to him.
content_old: 5 Now Abraham was a hundred years old when his son Isaac was born to him.

content: 6 Sarah said, “God has brought me laughter; everyone who hears will laugh with me.”
content_old: 6 Sarah said, “God has brought me laughter; everyone who hears will laugh with me.”

content: 7 And she added, “Who would have said to Abraham That Sarah would suckle children! Yet I have borne a son in his old age.”
content_old: 7 And she added, “Who would have said to Abraham That Sarah would suckle children! Yet I have borne a son in his old age.”

content: 8 The child grew up and was weaned, and Abraham held a great feast on the day that Isaac was weaned.
content_old: 8 The child grew up and was weaned, and Abraham held a great feast on the day that Isaac was weaned.

content: 9 Sarah saw the son whom Hagar the Egyptian had borne to Abraham playing.
content_old: 9 Sarah saw the son whom Hagar the Egyptian had borne to Abraham playing.

content: 10 She said to Abraham, “Cast out that slave-woman and her son, for the son of that slave shall not share in the inheritance with my son Isaac.”
content_old: 10 She said to Abraham, “Cast out that slave-woman and her son, for the son of that slave shall not share in the inheritance with my son Isaac.”

content: 11 The matter distressed Abraham greatly, for it concerned a son of his.
content_old: 11 The matter distressed Abraham greatly, for it concerned a son of his.

content: 12 But God said to Abraham, “Do not be distressed over the boy or your slave; whatever Sarah tells you, do as she says, for it is through Isaac that offspring shall be continued for you.
content_old: 12 But God said to Abraham, “Do not be distressed over the boy or your slave; whatever Sarah tells you, do as she says, for it is through Isaac that offspring shall be continued for you.

content: 13 As for the son of the slave-woman, I will make a nation of him, too, for he is your seed.”
content_old: 13 As for the son of the slave-woman, I will make a nation of him, too, for he is your seed.”

content: 14 Early next morning Abraham took some bread and a skin of water, and gave them to Hagar. He placed them over her shoulder, together with the child, and sent her away. And she wandered about in the wilderness of Beer-sheba.
content_old: 14 Early next morning Abraham took some bread and a skin of water, and gave them to Hagar. He placed them over her shoulder, together with the child, and sent her away. And she wandered about in the wilderness of Beer-sheba.

content: 15 When the water was gone from the skin, she left the child under one of the bushes,
content_old: 15 When the water was gone from the skin, she left the child under one of the bushes,

content: 16 and went and sat down at a distance, a bowshot away; for she thought, “Let me not look on as the child dies.” And sitting thus afar, she burst into tears.
content_old: 16 and went and sat down at a distance, a bowshot away; for she thought, “Let me not look on as the child dies.” And sitting thus afar, she burst into tears.

content: 17 God heard the cry of the boy, and an angel of God called to Hagar from heaven and said to her, “What troubles you, Hagar? Fear not, for God has heeded the cry of the boy where he is.
content_old: 17 God heard the cry of the boy, and an angel of God called to Hagar from heaven and said to her, “What troubles you, Hagar? Fear not, for God has heeded the cry of the boy where he is.

content: 18 Come, lift up the boy and hold him by the hand, for I will make a great nation of him.”
content_old: 18 Come, lift up the boy and hold him by the hand, for I will make a great nation of him.”

content: 19 Then God opened her eyes and she saw a well of water. She went and filled the skin with water, and let the boy drink.
content_old: 19 Then God opened her eyes and she saw a well of water. She went and filled the skin with water, and let the boy drink.

content: 20 God was with the boy and he grew up; he dwelt in the wilderness and became a bowman.
content_old: 20 God was with the boy and he grew up; he dwelt in the wilderness and became a bowman.

content: 21 He lived in the wilderness of Paran; and his mother got a wife for him from the land of Egypt.
content_old: 21 He lived in the wilderness of Paran; and his mother got a wife for him from the land of Egypt.

content: 22 At that time Abimelech and Phicol, chief of his troops, said to Abraham, “God is with you in everything that you do.
content_old: 22 At that time Abimelech and Phicol, chief of his troops, said to Abraham, “God is with you in everything that you do.

content: 23 Therefore swear to me here by God that you will not deal falsely with me or with my kith and kin, but will deal with me and with the land in which you have sojourned as loyally as I have dealt with you.”
content_old: 23 Therefore swear to me here by God that you will not deal falsely with me or with my kith and kin, but will deal with me and with the land in which you have sojourned as loyally as I have dealt with you.”

content: 24 And Abraham said, “I swear it.”
content_old: 24 And Abraham said, “I swear it.”

content: 25 Then Abraham reproached Abimelech for the well of water which the servants of Abimelech had seized.
content_old: 25 Then Abraham reproached Abimelech for the well of water which the servants of Abimelech had seized.

content: 26 But Abimelech said, “I do not know who did this; you did not tell me, nor have I heard of it until today.”
content_old: 26 But Abimelech said, “I do not know who did this; you did not tell me, nor have I heard of it until today.”

content: 27 Abraham took sheep and oxen and gave them to Abimelech, and the two of them made a pact.
content_old: 27 Abraham took sheep and oxen and gave them to Abimelech, and the two of them made a pact.

content: 28 Abraham then set seven ewes of the flock by themselves,
content_old: 28 Abraham then set seven ewes of the flock by themselves,

content: 29 and Abimelech said to Abraham, “What mean these seven ewes which you have set apart?”
content_old: 29 and Abimelech said to Abraham, “What mean these seven ewes which you have set apart?”

content: 30 He replied, “You are to accept these seven ewes from me as proof that I dug this well.”
content_old: 30 He replied, “You are to accept these seven ewes from me as proof that I dug this well.”

content: 31 Hence that place was called Beer-sheba, for there the two of them swore an oath.
content_old: 31 Hence that place was called Beer-sheba, for there the two of them swore an oath.

content: 32 When they had concluded the pact at Beer-sheba, Abimelech and Phicol, chief of his troops, departed and returned to the land of the Philistines.
content_old: 32 When they had concluded the pact at Beer-sheba, Abimelech and Phicol, chief of his troops, departed and returned to the land of the Philistines.

content: 33 Abraham planted a tamarisk at Beer-sheba, and invoked there the name of the LORD, the Everlasting God.
content_old: 33 Abraham planted a tamarisk at Beer-sheba, and invoked there the name of the LORD, the Everlasting God.

content: 1 Some time afterward, God put Abraham to the test. He said to him, “Abraham,” and he answered, “Here I am.”
content_old: 1 Some time afterward, God put Abraham to the test. He said to him, “Abraham,” and he answered, “Here I am.”

content: 2 And He said, “Take your son, your favored one, Isaac, whom you love, and go to the land of Moriah, and offer him there as a burnt offering on one of the heights that I will point out to you.”
content_old: 2 And He said, “Take your son, your favored one, Isaac, whom you love, and go to the land of Moriah, and offer him there as a burnt offering on one of the heights that I will point out to you.”

content: 3 So early next morning, Abraham saddled his ass and took with him two of his servants and his son Isaac. He split the wood for the burnt offering, and he set out for the place of which God had told him.
content_old: 3 So early next morning, Abraham saddled his ass and took with him two of his servants and his son Isaac. He split the wood for the burnt offering, and he set out for the place of which God had told him.

content: 4 On the third day Abraham looked up and saw the place from afar.
content_old: 4 On the third day Abraham looked up and saw the place from afar.

content: 5 Then Abraham said to his servants, “You stay here with the ass. The boy and I will go up there; we will worship and we will return to you.”
content_old: 5 Then Abraham said to his servants, “You stay here with the ass. The boy and I will go up there; we will worship and we will return to you.”

content: 6 Abraham took the wood for the burnt offering and put it on his son Isaac. He himself took the firestone and the knife; and the two walked off together.
content_old: 6 Abraham took the wood for the burnt offering and put it on his son Isaac. He himself took the firestone and the knife; and the two walked off together.

content: 7 Then Isaac said to his father Abraham, “Father!” And he answered, “Yes, my son.” And he said, “Here are the firestone and the wood; but where is the sheep for the burnt offering?”
content_old: 7 Then Isaac said to his father Abraham, “Father!” And he answered, “Yes, my son.” And he said, “Here are the firestone and the wood; but where is the sheep for the burnt offering?”

content: 8 And Abraham said, “God will see to the sheep for His burnt offering, my son.” And the two of them walked on together.
content_old: 8 And Abraham said, “God will see to the sheep for His burnt offering, my son.” And the two of them walked on together.

content: 9 They arrived at the place of which God had told him. Abraham built an altar there; he laid out the wood; he bound his son Isaac; he laid him on the altar, on top of the wood.
content_old: 9 They arrived at the place of which God had told him. Abraham built an altar there; he laid out the wood; he bound his son Isaac; he laid him on the altar, on top of the wood.

content: 10 And Abraham picked up the knife to slay his son.
content_old: 10 And Abraham picked up the knife to slay his son.

content: 11 Then an angel of the LORD called to him from heaven: “Abraham! Abraham!” And he answered, “Here I am.”
content_old: 11 Then an angel of the LORD called to him from heaven: “Abraham! Abraham!” And he answered, “Here I am.”

content: 12 And he said, “Do not raise your hand against the boy, or do anything to him. For now I know that you fear God, since you have not withheld your son, your favored one, from Me.”
content_old: 12 And he said, “Do not raise your hand against the boy, or do anything to him. For now I know that you fear God, since you have not withheld your son, your favored one, from Me.”

content: 13 When Abraham looked up, his eye fell upon a ram, caught in the thicket by its horns. So Abraham went and took the ram and offered it up as a burnt offering in place of his son.
content_old: 13 When Abraham looked up, his eye fell upon a ram, caught in the thicket by its horns. So Abraham went and took the ram and offered it up as a burnt offering in place of his son.

content: 14 And Abraham named that site Adonai-yireh, whence the present saying, “On the mount of the LORD there is vision.”
content_old: 14 And Abraham named that site Adonai-yireh, whence the present saying, “On the mount of the LORD there is vision.”

content: 15 The angel of the LORD called to Abraham a second time from heaven,
content_old: 15 The angel of the LORD called to Abraham a second time from heaven,

content: 16 and said, “By Myself I swear, the LORD declares: Because you have done this and have not withheld your son, your favored one,
content_old: 16 and said, “By Myself I swear, the LORD declares: Because you have done this and have not withheld your son, your favored one,

content: 17 I will bestow My blessing upon you and make your descendants as numerous as the stars of heaven and the sands on the seashore; and your descendants shall seize the gates of their foes.
content_old: 17 I will bestow My blessing upon you and make your descendants as numerous as the stars of heaven and the sands on the seashore; and your descendants shall seize the gates of their foes.

content: 18 All the nations of the earth shall bless themselves by your descendants, because you have obeyed My command.”
content_old: 18 All the nations of the earth shall bless themselves by your descendants, because you have obeyed My command.”

content: 19 Abraham then returned to his servants, and they departed together for Beer-sheba; and Abraham stayed in Beer-sheba.
content_old: 19 Abraham then returned to his servants, and they departed together for Beer-sheba; and Abraham stayed in Beer-sheba.

content: 20 Some time later, Abraham was told, “Milcah too has borne children to your brother Nahor:
content_old: 20 Some time later, Abraham was told, “Milcah too has borne children to your brother Nahor:

content: 21 Uz the first-born, and Buz his brother, and Kemuel the father of Aram;
content_old: 21 Uz the first-born, and Buz his brother, and Kemuel the father of Aram;

content: 22 and Chesed, Hazo, Pildash, Jidlaph, and Bethuel”—
content_old: 22 and Chesed, Hazo, Pildash, Jidlaph, and Bethuel”—

content: 23 Bethuel being the father of Rebekah. These eight Milcah bore to Nahor, Abraham’s brother.
content_old: 23 Bethuel being the father of Rebekah. These eight Milcah bore to Nahor, Abraham’s brother.

content: 1 Sarah’s lifetime—the span of Sarah’s life—came to one hundred and twenty-seven years.
content_old: 1 Sarah’s lifetime—the span of Sarah’s life—came to one hundred and twenty-seven years.

content: 2 Sarah died in Kiriath-arba—now Hebron—in the land of Canaan; and Abraham proceeded to mourn for Sarah and to bewail her.
content_old: 2 Sarah died in Kiriath-arba—now Hebron—in the land of Canaan; and Abraham proceeded to mourn for Sarah and to bewail her.

content: 3 Then Abraham rose from beside his dead, and spoke to the Hittites, saying,
content_old: 3 Then Abraham rose from beside his dead, and spoke to the Hittites, saying,

content: 4 “I am a resident alien among you; sell me a burial site among you, that I may remove my dead for burial.”
content_old: 4 “I am a resident alien among you; sell me a burial site among you, that I may remove my dead for burial.”

content: 5 And the Hittites replied to Abraham, saying to him,
content_old: 5 And the Hittites replied to Abraham, saying to him,

content: 6 “Hear us, my lord: you are the elect of God among us. Bury your dead in the choicest of our burial places; none of us will withhold his burial place from you for burying your dead.”
content_old: 6 “Hear us, my lord: you are the elect of God among us. Bury your dead in the choicest of our burial places; none of us will withhold his burial place from you for burying your dead.”

content: 7 Thereupon Abraham bowed low to the people of the land, the Hittites,
content_old: 7 Thereupon Abraham bowed low to the people of the land, the Hittites,

content: 8 and he said to them, “If it is your wish that I remove my dead for burial, you must agree to intercede for me with Ephron son of Zohar.
content_old: 8 and he said to them, “If it is your wish that I remove my dead for burial, you must agree to intercede for me with Ephron son of Zohar.

content: 9 Let him sell me the cave of Machpelah that he owns, which is at the edge of his land. Let him sell it to me, at the full price, for a burial site in your midst.”
content_old: 9 Let him sell me the cave of Machpelah that he owns, which is at the edge of his land. Let him sell it to me, at the full price, for a burial site in your midst.”

content: 10 Ephron was present among the Hittites; so Ephron the Hittite answered Abraham in the hearing of the Hittites, all who entered the gate of his town, saying,
content_old: 10 Ephron was present among the Hittites; so Ephron the Hittite answered Abraham in the hearing of the Hittites, all who entered the gate of his town, saying,

content: 11 “No, my lord, hear me: I give you the field and I give you the cave that is in it; I give it to you in the presence of my people. Bury your dead.”
content_old: 11 “No, my lord, hear me: I give you the field and I give you the cave that is in it; I give it to you in the presence of my people. Bury your dead.”

content: 12 Then Abraham bowed low before the people of the land,
content_old: 12 Then Abraham bowed low before the people of the land,

content: 13 and spoke to Ephron in the hearing of the people of the land, saying, “If only you would hear me out! Let me pay the price of the land; accept it from me, that I may bury my dead there.”
content_old: 13 and spoke to Ephron in the hearing of the people of the land, saying, “If only you would hear me out! Let me pay the price of the land; accept it from me, that I may bury my dead there.”

content: 14 And Ephron replied to Abraham, saying to him,
content_old: 14 And Ephron replied to Abraham, saying to him,

content: 15 “My lord, do hear me! A piece of land worth four hundred shekels of silver—what is that between you and me? Go and bury your dead.”
content_old: 15 “My lord, do hear me! A piece of land worth four hundred shekels of silver—what is that between you and me? Go and bury your dead.”

content: 16 Abraham accepted Ephron’s terms. Abraham paid out to Ephron the money that he had named in the hearing of the Hittites—four hundred shekels of silver at the going merchants’ rate.
content_old: 16 Abraham accepted Ephron’s terms. Abraham paid out to Ephron the money that he had named in the hearing of the Hittites—four hundred shekels of silver at the going merchants’ rate.

content: 17 So Ephron’s land in Machpelah, near Mamre—the field with its cave and all the trees anywhere within the confines of that field—passed
content_old: 17 So Ephron’s land in Machpelah, near Mamre—the field with its cave and all the trees anywhere within the confines of that field—passed

content: 18 to Abraham as his possession, in the presence of the Hittites, of all who entered the gate of his town.
content_old: 18 to Abraham as his possession, in the presence of the Hittites, of all who entered the gate of his town.

content: 19 And then Abraham buried his wife Sarah in the cave of the field of Machpelah, facing Mamre—now Hebron—in the land of Canaan.
content_old: 19 And then Abraham buried his wife Sarah in the cave of the field of Machpelah, facing Mamre—now Hebron—in the land of Canaan.

content: 1  Abraham was now old, advanced in years, and the LORD had blessed Abraham in all things.
content_old: 1  Abraham was now old, advanced in years, and the LORD had blessed Abraham in all things.

content: 2 And Abraham said to the senior servant of his household, who had charge of all that he owned, “Put your hand under my thigh
content_old: 2 And Abraham said to the senior servant of his household, who had charge of all that he owned, “Put your hand under my thigh

content: 3 and I will make you swear by the LORD, the God of heaven and the God of the earth, that you will not take a wife for my son from the daughters of the Canaanites among whom I dwell,
content_old: 3 and I will make you swear by the LORD, the God of heaven and the God of the earth, that you will not take a wife for my son from the daughters of the Canaanites among whom I dwell,

content: 4 but will go to the land of my birth and get a wife for my son Isaac.”
content_old: 4 but will go to the land of my birth and get a wife for my son Isaac.”

content: 5 And the servant said to him, “What if the woman does not consent to follow me to this land, shall I then take your son back to the land from which you came?”
content_old: 5 And the servant said to him, “What if the woman does not consent to follow me to this land, shall I then take your son back to the land from which you came?”

content: 6 Abraham answered him, “On no account must you take my son back there!
content_old: 6 Abraham answered him, “On no account must you take my son back there!

content: 7 The LORD, the God of heaven, who took me from my father’s house and from my native land, who promised me on oath, saying, ‘I will assign this land to your offspring’—He will send His angel before you, and you will get a wife for my son from there.
content_old: 7 The LORD, the God of heaven, who took me from my father’s house and from my native land, who promised me on oath, saying, ‘I will assign this land to your offspring’—He will send His angel before you, and you will get a wife for my son from there.

content: 8 And if the woman does not consent to follow you, you shall then be clear of this oath to me; but do not take my son back there.”
content_old: 8 And if the woman does not consent to follow you, you shall then be clear of this oath to me; but do not take my son back there.”

content: 9 So the servant put his hand under the thigh of his master Abraham and swore to him as bidden.
content_old: 9 So the servant put his hand under the thigh of his master Abraham and swore to him as bidden.

content: 10 Then the servant took ten of his master’s camels and set out, taking with him all the bounty of his master; and he made his way to Aram-naharaim, to the city of Nahor.
content_old: 10 Then the servant took ten of his master’s camels and set out, taking with him all the bounty of his master; and he made his way to Aram-naharaim, to the city of Nahor.

content: 11 He made the camels kneel down by the well outside the city, at evening time, the time when women come out to draw water.
content_old: 11 He made the camels kneel down by the well outside the city, at evening time, the time when women come out to draw water.

content: 12 And he said, “O LORD, God of my master Abraham, grant me good fortune this day, and deal graciously with my master Abraham:
content_old: 12 And he said, “O LORD, God of my master Abraham, grant me good fortune this day, and deal graciously with my master Abraham:

content: 13 Here I stand by the spring as the daughters of the townsmen come out to draw water;
content_old: 13 Here I stand by the spring as the daughters of the townsmen come out to draw water;

content: 14 let the maiden to whom I say, ‘Please, lower your jar that I may drink,’ and who replies, ‘Drink, and I will also water your camels’—let her be the one whom You have decreed for Your servant Isaac. Thereby shall I know that You have dealt graciously with my master.”
content_old: 14 let the maiden to whom I say, ‘Please, lower your jar that I may drink,’ and who replies, ‘Drink, and I will also water your camels’—let her be the one whom You have decreed for Your servant Isaac. Thereby shall I know that You have dealt graciously with my master.”

content: 15 He had scarcely finished speaking, when Rebekah, who was born to Bethuel, the son of Milcah the wife of Abraham’s brother Nahor, came out with her jar on her shoulder.
content_old: 15 He had scarcely finished speaking, when Rebekah, who was born to Bethuel, the son of Milcah the wife of Abraham’s brother Nahor, came out with her jar on her shoulder.

content: 16 The maiden was very beautiful, a virgin whom no man had known. She went down to the spring, filled her jar, and came up.
content_old: 16 The maiden was very beautiful, a virgin whom no man had known. She went down to the spring, filled her jar, and came up.

content: 17 The servant ran toward her and said, “Please, let me sip a little water from your jar.”
content_old: 17 The servant ran toward her and said, “Please, let me sip a little water from your jar.”

content: 18 “Drink, my lord,” she said, and she quickly lowered her jar upon her hand and let him drink.
content_old: 18 “Drink, my lord,” she said, and she quickly lowered her jar upon her hand and let him drink.

content: 19 When she had let him drink his fill, she said, “I will also draw for your camels, until they finish drinking.”
content_old: 19 When she had let him drink his fill, she said, “I will also draw for your camels, until they finish drinking.”

content: 20 Quickly emptying her jar into the trough, she ran back to the well to draw, and she drew for all his camels.
content_old: 20 Quickly emptying her jar into the trough, she ran back to the well to draw, and she drew for all his camels.

content: 21 The man, meanwhile, stood gazing at her, silently wondering whether the LORD had made his errand successful or not.
content_old: 21 The man, meanwhile, stood gazing at her, silently wondering whether the LORD had made his errand successful or not.

content: 22 When the camels had finished drinking, the man took a gold nose-ring weighing a half-shekel, and two gold bands for her arms, ten shekels in weight.
content_old: 22 When the camels had finished drinking, the man took a gold nose-ring weighing a half-shekel, and two gold bands for her arms, ten shekels in weight.

content: 23 “Pray tell me,” he said, “whose daughter are you? Is there room in your father’s house for us to spend the night?”
content_old: 23 “Pray tell me,” he said, “whose daughter are you? Is there room in your father’s house for us to spend the night?”

content: 24 She replied, “I am the daughter of Bethuel the son of Milcah, whom she bore to Nahor.”
content_old: 24 She replied, “I am the daughter of Bethuel the son of Milcah, whom she bore to Nahor.”

content: 25 And she went on, “There is plenty of straw and feed at home, and also room to spend the night.”
content_old: 25 And she went on, “There is plenty of straw and feed at home, and also room to spend the night.”

content: 26 The man bowed low in homage to the LORD
content_old: 26 The man bowed low in homage to the LORD

content: 27 and said, “Blessed be the LORD, the God of my master Abraham, who has not withheld His steadfast faithfulness from my master. For I have been guided on my errand by the LORD, to the house of my master’s kinsmen.”
content_old: 27 and said, “Blessed be the LORD, the God of my master Abraham, who has not withheld His steadfast faithfulness from my master. For I have been guided on my errand by the LORD, to the house of my master’s kinsmen.”

content: 28 The maiden ran and told all this to her mother’s household.
content_old: 28 The maiden ran and told all this to her mother’s household.

content: 29 Now Rebekah had a brother whose name was Laban. Laban ran out to the man at the spring—
content_old: 29 Now Rebekah had a brother whose name was Laban. Laban ran out to the man at the spring—

content: 30 when he saw the nose-ring and the bands on his sister’s arms, and when he heard his sister Rebekah say, “Thus the man spoke to me.” He went up to the man, who was still standing beside the camels at the spring.
content_old: 30 when he saw the nose-ring and the bands on his sister’s arms, and when he heard his sister Rebekah say, “Thus the man spoke to me.” He went up to the man, who was still standing beside the camels at the spring.

content: 31 “Come in, O blessed of the LORD,” he said, “why do you remain outside, when I have made ready the house and a place for the camels?”
content_old: 31 “Come in, O blessed of the LORD,” he said, “why do you remain outside, when I have made ready the house and a place for the camels?”

content: 32 So the man entered the house, and the camels were unloaded. The camels were given straw and feed, and water was brought to bathe his feet and the feet of the men with him.
content_old: 32 So the man entered the house, and the camels were unloaded. The camels were given straw and feed, and water was brought to bathe his feet and the feet of the men with him.

content: 33 But when food was set before him, he said, “I will not eat until I have told my tale.” He said, “Speak, then.”
content_old: 33 But when food was set before him, he said, “I will not eat until I have told my tale.” He said, “Speak, then.”

content: 34 “I am Abraham’s servant,” he began.
content_old: 34 “I am Abraham’s servant,” he began.

content: 35 “The LORD has greatly blessed my master, and he has become rich: He has given him sheep and cattle, silver and gold, male and female slaves, camels and asses.
content_old: 35 “The LORD has greatly blessed my master, and he has become rich: He has given him sheep and cattle, silver and gold, male and female slaves, camels and asses.

content: 36 And Sarah, my master’s wife, bore my master a son in her old age, and he has assigned to him everything he owns.
content_old: 36 And Sarah, my master’s wife, bore my master a son in her old age, and he has assigned to him everything he owns.

content: 37 Now my master made me swear, saying, ‘You shall not get a wife for my son from the daughters of the Canaanites in whose land I dwell;
content_old: 37 Now my master made me swear, saying, ‘You shall not get a wife for my son from the daughters of the Canaanites in whose land I dwell;

content: 38 but you shall go to my father���s house, to my kindred, and get a wife for my son.’
content_old: 38 but you shall go to my father���s house, to my kindred, and get a wife for my son.’

content: 39 And I said to my master, ‘What if the woman does not follow me?’
content_old: 39 And I said to my master, ‘What if the woman does not follow me?’

content: 40 He replied to me, ‘The LORD, whose ways I have followed, will send His angel with you and make your errand successful; and you will get a wife for my son from my kindred, from my father’s house.
content_old: 40 He replied to me, ‘The LORD, whose ways I have followed, will send His angel with you and make your errand successful; and you will get a wife for my son from my kindred, from my father’s house.

content: 41 Thus only shall you be freed from my adjuration: if, when you come to my kindred, they refuse you—only then shall you be freed from my adjuration.’
content_old: 41 Thus only shall you be freed from my adjuration: if, when you come to my kindred, they refuse you—only then shall you be freed from my adjuration.’

content: 42 “I came today to the spring, and I said: O LORD, God of my master Abraham, if You would indeed grant success to the errand on which I am engaged!
content_old: 42 “I came today to the spring, and I said: O LORD, God of my master Abraham, if You would indeed grant success to the errand on which I am engaged!

content: 43 As I stand by the spring of water, let the young woman who comes out to draw and to whom I say, ‘Please, let me drink a little water from your jar,’
content_old: 43 As I stand by the spring of water, let the young woman who comes out to draw and to whom I say, ‘Please, let me drink a little water from your jar,’

content: 44 and who answers, ‘You may drink, and I will also draw for your camels’—let her be the wife whom the LORD has decreed for my master’s son.’
content_old: 44 and who answers, ‘You may drink, and I will also draw for your camels’—let her be the wife whom the LORD has decreed for my master’s son.’

content: 45 I had scarcely finished praying in my heart, when Rebekah came out with her jar on her shoulder, and went down to the spring and drew. And I said to her, ‘Please give me a drink.’
content_old: 45 I had scarcely finished praying in my heart, when Rebekah came out with her jar on her shoulder, and went down to the spring and drew. And I said to her, ‘Please give me a drink.’

content: 46 She quickly lowered her jar and said, ‘Drink, and I will also water your camels.’ So I drank, and she also watered the camels.
content_old: 46 She quickly lowered her jar and said, ‘Drink, and I will also water your camels.’ So I drank, and she also watered the camels.

content: 47 I inquired of her, ‘Whose daughter are you?’ And she said, ‘The daughter of Bethuel, son of Nahor, whom Milcah bore to him.’ And I put the ring on her nose and the bands on her arms.
content_old: 47 I inquired of her, ‘Whose daughter are you?’ And she said, ‘The daughter of Bethuel, son of Nahor, whom Milcah bore to him.’ And I put the ring on her nose and the bands on her arms.

content: 48 Then I bowed low in homage to the LORD and blessed the LORD, the God of my master Abraham, who led me on the right way to get the daughter of my master’s brother for his son.
