content_old: 48 Then I bowed low in homage to the LORD and blessed the LORD, the God of my master Abraham, who led me on the right way to get the daughter of my master’s brother for his son.

content: 49 And now, if you mean to treat my master with true kindness, tell me; and if not, tell me also, that I may turn right or left.”
content_old: 49 And now, if you mean to treat my master with true kindness, tell me; and if not, tell me also, that I may turn right or left.”

content: 50 Then Laban and Bethuel answered, “The matter was decreed by the LORD; we cannot speak to you bad or good.
content_old: 50 Then Laban and Bethuel answered, “The matter was decreed by the LORD; we cannot speak to you bad or good.

content: 51 Here is Rebekah before you; take her and go, and let her be a wife to your master’s son, as the LORD has spoken.”
content_old: 51 Here is Rebekah before you; take her and go, and let her be a wife to your master’s son, as the LORD has spoken.”

content: 52 When Abraham’s servant heard their words, he bowed low to the ground before the LORD.
content_old: 52 When Abraham’s servant heard their words, he bowed low to the ground before the LORD.

content: 53 The servant brought out objects of silver and gold, and garments, and gave them to Rebekah; and he gave presents to her brother and her mother.
content_old: 53 The servant brought out objects of silver and gold, and garments, and gave them to Rebekah; and he gave presents to her brother and her mother.

content: 54 Then he and the men with him ate and drank, and they spent the night. When they arose next morning, he said, “Give me leave to go to my master.”
content_old: 54 Then he and the men with him ate and drank, and they spent the night. When they arose next morning, he said, “Give me leave to go to my master.”

content: 55 But her brother and her mother said, “Let the maiden remain with us some ten days; then you may go.”
content_old: 55 But her brother and her mother said, “Let the maiden remain with us some ten days; then you may go.”

content: 56 He said to them, “Do not delay me, now that the LORD has made my errand successful. Give me leave that I may go to my master.”
content_old: 56 He said to them, “Do not delay me, now that the LORD has made my errand successful. Give me leave that I may go to my master.”

content: 57 And they said, “Let us call the girl and ask for her reply.”
content_old: 57 And they said, “Let us call the girl and ask for her reply.”

content: 58 They called Rebekah and said to her, “Will you go with this man?” And she said, “I will.”
content_old: 58 They called Rebekah and said to her, “Will you go with this man?” And she said, “I will.”

content: 59 So they sent off their sister Rebekah and her nurse along with Abraham’s servant and his men.
content_old: 59 So they sent off their sister Rebekah and her nurse along with Abraham’s servant and his men.

content: 60 And they blessed Rebekah and said to her, “O sister! May you grow Into thousands of myriads; May your offspring seize The gates of their foes.”
content_old: 60 And they blessed Rebekah and said to her, “O sister! May you grow Into thousands of myriads; May your offspring seize The gates of their foes.”

content: 61 Then Rebekah and her maids arose, mounted the camels, and followed the man. So the servant took Rebekah and went his way.
content_old: 61 Then Rebekah and her maids arose, mounted the camels, and followed the man. So the servant took Rebekah and went his way.

content: 62 Isaac had just come back from the vicinity of Beer-lahai-roi, for he was settled in the region of the Negeb.
content_old: 62 Isaac had just come back from the vicinity of Beer-lahai-roi, for he was settled in the region of the Negeb.

content: 63 And Isaac went out walking in the field toward evening and, looking up, he saw camels approaching.
content_old: 63 And Isaac went out walking in the field toward evening and, looking up, he saw camels approaching.

content: 64 Raising her eyes, Rebekah saw Isaac. She alighted from the camel
content_old: 64 Raising her eyes, Rebekah saw Isaac. She alighted from the camel

content: 65 and said to the servant, “Who is that man walking in the field toward us?” And the servant said, “That is my master.” So she took her veil and covered herself.
content_old: 65 and said to the servant, “Who is that man walking in the field toward us?” And the servant said, “That is my master.” So she took her veil and covered herself.

content: 66 The servant told Isaac all the things that he had done.
content_old: 66 The servant told Isaac all the things that he had done.

content: 1 Abraham took another wife, whose name was Keturah.
content_old: 1 Abraham took another wife, whose name was Keturah.

content: 2 She bore him Zimran, Jokshan, Medan, Midian, Ishbak, and Shuah.
content_old: 2 She bore him Zimran, Jokshan, Medan, Midian, Ishbak, and Shuah.

content: 3 Jokshan begot Sheba and Dedan. The descendants of Dedan were the Asshurim, the Letushim, and the Leummim.
content_old: 3 Jokshan begot Sheba and Dedan. The descendants of Dedan were the Asshurim, the Letushim, and the Leummim.

content: 4 The descendants of Midian were Ephah, Epher, Enoch, Abida, and Eldaah. All these were descendants of Keturah.
content_old: 4 The descendants of Midian were Ephah, Epher, Enoch, Abida, and Eldaah. All these were descendants of Keturah.

content: 5 Abraham willed all that he owned to Isaac;
content_old: 5 Abraham willed all that he owned to Isaac;

content: 6 but to Abraham’s sons by concubines Abraham gave gifts while he was still living, and he sent them away from his son Isaac eastward, to the land of the East.
content_old: 6 but to Abraham’s sons by concubines Abraham gave gifts while he was still living, and he sent them away from his son Isaac eastward, to the land of the East.

content: 7 This was the total span of Abraham’s life: one hundred and seventy-five years.
content_old: 7 This was the total span of Abraham’s life: one hundred and seventy-five years.

content: 8 And Abraham breathed his last, dying at a good ripe age, old and contented; and he was gathered to his kin.
content_old: 8 And Abraham breathed his last, dying at a good ripe age, old and contented; and he was gathered to his kin.

content: 9 His sons Isaac and Ishmael buried him in the cave of Machpelah, in the field of Ephron son of Zohar the Hittite, facing Mamre,
content_old: 9 His sons Isaac and Ishmael buried him in the cave of Machpelah, in the field of Ephron son of Zohar the Hittite, facing Mamre,

content: 10 the field that Abraham had bought from the Hittites; there Abraham was buried, and Sarah his wife.
content_old: 10 the field that Abraham had bought from the Hittites; there Abraham was buried, and Sarah his wife.

content: 11 After the death of Abraham, God blessed his son Isaac. And Isaac settled near Beer-lahai-roi.
content_old: 11 After the death of Abraham, God blessed his son Isaac. And Isaac settled near Beer-lahai-roi.

content: 12 This is the line of Ishmael, Abraham’s son, whom Hagar the Egyptian, Sarah’s slave, bore to Abraham.
content_old: 12 This is the line of Ishmael, Abraham’s son, whom Hagar the Egyptian, Sarah’s slave, bore to Abraham.

content: 13 These are the names of the sons of Ishmael, by their names, in the order of their birth: Nebaioth, the first-born of Ishmael, Kedar, Adbeel, Mibsam,
content_old: 13 These are the names of the sons of Ishmael, by their names, in the order of their birth: Nebaioth, the first-born of Ishmael, Kedar, Adbeel, Mibsam,

content: 14 Mishma, Dumah, Massa,
content_old: 14 Mishma, Dumah, Massa,

content: 15 Hadad, Tema, Jetur, Naphish, and Kedmah.
content_old: 15 Hadad, Tema, Jetur, Naphish, and Kedmah.

content: 16 These are the sons of Ishmael and these are their names by their villages and by their encampments: twelve chieftains of as many tribes.—
content_old: 16 These are the sons of Ishmael and these are their names by their villages and by their encampments: twelve chieftains of as many tribes.—

content: 17 These were the years of the life of Ishmael: one hundred and thirty-seven years; then he breathed his last and died, and was gathered to his kin.—
content_old: 17 These were the years of the life of Ishmael: one hundred and thirty-seven years; then he breathed his last and died, and was gathered to his kin.—

content: 18 They dwelt from Havilah, by Shur, which is close to Egypt, all the way to Asshur; they camped alongside all their kinsmen.
content_old: 18 They dwelt from Havilah, by Shur, which is close to Egypt, all the way to Asshur; they camped alongside all their kinsmen.

content: 19 This is the story of Isaac, son of Abraham. Abraham begot Isaac.
content_old: 19 This is the story of Isaac, son of Abraham. Abraham begot Isaac.

content: 20 Isaac was forty years old when he took to wife Rebekah, daughter of Bethuel the Aramean of Paddan-aram, sister of Laban the Aramean.
content_old: 20 Isaac was forty years old when he took to wife Rebekah, daughter of Bethuel the Aramean of Paddan-aram, sister of Laban the Aramean.

content: 21 Isaac pleaded with the LORD on behalf of his wife, because she was barren; and the LORD responded to his plea, and his wife Rebekah conceived.
content_old: 21 Isaac pleaded with the LORD on behalf of his wife, because she was barren; and the LORD responded to his plea, and his wife Rebekah conceived.

content: 22 But the children struggled in her womb, and she said, “If so, why do I exist?” She went to inquire of the LORD,
content_old: 22 But the children struggled in her womb, and she said, “If so, why do I exist?” She went to inquire of the LORD,

content: 23 and the LORD answered her, “Two nations are in your womb, Two separate peoples shall issue from your body; One people shall be mightier than the other, And the older shall serve the younger.”
content_old: 23 and the LORD answered her, “Two nations are in your womb, Two separate peoples shall issue from your body; One people shall be mightier than the other, And the older shall serve the younger.”

content: 24 When her time to give birth was at hand, there were twins in her womb.
content_old: 24 When her time to give birth was at hand, there were twins in her womb.

content: 25 The first one emerged red, like a hairy mantle all over; so they named him Esau.
content_old: 25 The first one emerged red, like a hairy mantle all over; so they named him Esau.

content: 26 Then his brother emerged, holding on to the heel of Esau; so they named him Jacob. Isaac was sixty years old when they were born.
content_old: 26 Then his brother emerged, holding on to the heel of Esau; so they named him Jacob. Isaac was sixty years old when they were born.

content: 27 When the boys grew up, Esau became a skillful hunter, a man of the outdoors; but Jacob was a mild man who stayed in camp.
content_old: 27 When the boys grew up, Esau became a skillful hunter, a man of the outdoors; but Jacob was a mild man who stayed in camp.

content: 28 Isaac favored Esau because he had a taste for game; but Rebekah favored Jacob.
content_old: 28 Isaac favored Esau because he had a taste for game; but Rebekah favored Jacob.

content: 29 Once when Jacob was cooking a stew, Esau came in from the open, famished.
content_old: 29 Once when Jacob was cooking a stew, Esau came in from the open, famished.

content: 30 And Esau said to Jacob, “Give me some of that red stuff to gulp down, for I am famished”—which is why he was named Edom.
content_old: 30 And Esau said to Jacob, “Give me some of that red stuff to gulp down, for I am famished”—which is why he was named Edom.

content: 31 Jacob said, “First sell me your birthright.”
content_old: 31 Jacob said, “First sell me your birthright.”

content: 32 And Esau said, “I am at the point of death, so of what use is my birthright to me?”
content_old: 32 And Esau said, “I am at the point of death, so of what use is my birthright to me?”

content: 33 But Jacob said, “Swear to me first.” So he swore to him, and sold his birthright to Jacob.
content_old: 33 But Jacob said, “Swear to me first.” So he swore to him, and sold his birthright to Jacob.

content: 1  There was a famine in the land—aside from the previous famine that had occurred in the days of Abraham—and Isaac went to Abimelech, king of the Philistines, in Gerar.
content_old: 1  There was a famine in the land—aside from the previous famine that had occurred in the days of Abraham—and Isaac went to Abimelech, king of the Philistines, in Gerar.

content: 2 The LORD had appeared to him and said, “Do not go down to Egypt; stay in the land which I point out to you.
content_old: 2 The LORD had appeared to him and said, “Do not go down to Egypt; stay in the land which I point out to you.

content: 3 Reside in this land, and I will be with you and bless you; I will assign all these lands to you and to your heirs, fulfilling the oath that I swore to your father Abraham.
content_old: 3 Reside in this land, and I will be with you and bless you; I will assign all these lands to you and to your heirs, fulfilling the oath that I swore to your father Abraham.

content: 4 I will make your heirs as numerous as the stars of heaven, and assign to your heirs all these lands, so that all the nations of the earth shall bless themselves by your heirs—
content_old: 4 I will make your heirs as numerous as the stars of heaven, and assign to your heirs all these lands, so that all the nations of the earth shall bless themselves by your heirs—

content: 5 inasmuch as Abraham obeyed Me and kept My charge: My commandments, My laws, and My teachings.”
content_old: 5 inasmuch as Abraham obeyed Me and kept My charge: My commandments, My laws, and My teachings.”

content: 6 So Isaac stayed in Gerar.
content_old: 6 So Isaac stayed in Gerar.

content: 7 When the men of the place asked him about his wife, he said, “She is my sister,” for he was afraid to say “my wife,” thinking, “The men of the place might kill me on account of Rebekah, for she is beautiful.”
content_old: 7 When the men of the place asked him about his wife, he said, “She is my sister,” for he was afraid to say “my wife,” thinking, “The men of the place might kill me on account of Rebekah, for she is beautiful.”

content: 8 When some time had passed, Abimelech king of the Philistines, looking out of the window, saw Isaac fondling his wife Rebekah.
content_old: 8 When some time had passed, Abimelech king of the Philistines, looking out of the window, saw Isaac fondling his wife Rebekah.

content: 9 Abimelech sent for Isaac and said, “So she is your wife! Why then did you say: ‘She is my sister?”‘ Isaac said to him, “Because I thought I might lose my life on account of her.”
content_old: 9 Abimelech sent for Isaac and said, “So she is your wife! Why then did you say: ‘She is my sister?”‘ Isaac said to him, “Because I thought I might lose my life on account of her.”

content: 10 Abimelech said, “What have you done to us! One of the people might have lain with your wife, and you would have brought guilt upon us.”
content_old: 10 Abimelech said, “What have you done to us! One of the people might have lain with your wife, and you would have brought guilt upon us.”

content: 11 Abimelech then charged all the people, saying, “Anyone who molests this man or his wife shall be put to death.”
content_old: 11 Abimelech then charged all the people, saying, “Anyone who molests this man or his wife shall be put to death.”

content: 12 Isaac sowed in that land and reaped a hundredfold the same year. The LORD blessed him,
content_old: 12 Isaac sowed in that land and reaped a hundredfold the same year. The LORD blessed him,

content: 13 and the man grew richer and richer until he was very wealthy:
content_old: 13 and the man grew richer and richer until he was very wealthy:

content: 14 he acquired flocks and herds, and a large household, so that the Philistines envied him.
content_old: 14 he acquired flocks and herds, and a large household, so that the Philistines envied him.

content: 15 And the Philistines stopped up all the wells which his father’s servants had dug in the days of his father Abraham, filling them with earth.
content_old: 15 And the Philistines stopped up all the wells which his father’s servants had dug in the days of his father Abraham, filling them with earth.

content: 16 And Abimelech said to Isaac, “Go away from us, for you have become far too big for us.”
content_old: 16 And Abimelech said to Isaac, “Go away from us, for you have become far too big for us.”

content: 17 So Isaac departed from there and encamped in the wadi of Gerar, where he settled.
content_old: 17 So Isaac departed from there and encamped in the wadi of Gerar, where he settled.

content: 18 Isaac dug anew the wells which had been dug in the days of his father Abraham and which the Philistines had stopped up after Abraham’s death; and he gave them the same names that his father had given them.
content_old: 18 Isaac dug anew the wells which had been dug in the days of his father Abraham and which the Philistines had stopped up after Abraham’s death; and he gave them the same names that his father had given them.

content: 19 But when Isaac’s servants, digging in the wadi, found there a well of spring water,
content_old: 19 But when Isaac’s servants, digging in the wadi, found there a well of spring water,

content: 20 the herdsmen of Gerar quarreled with Isaac’s herdsmen, saying, “The water is ours.” He named that well Esek, because they contended with him.
content_old: 20 the herdsmen of Gerar quarreled with Isaac’s herdsmen, saying, “The water is ours.” He named that well Esek, because they contended with him.

content: 21 And when they dug another well, they disputed over that one also; so he named it Sitnah.
content_old: 21 And when they dug another well, they disputed over that one also; so he named it Sitnah.

content: 22 He moved from there and dug yet another well, and they did not quarrel over it; so he called it Rehoboth, saying, “Now at last the LORD has granted us ample space to increase in the land.”
content_old: 22 He moved from there and dug yet another well, and they did not quarrel over it; so he called it Rehoboth, saying, “Now at last the LORD has granted us ample space to increase in the land.”

content: 23 From there he went up to Beer-sheba.
content_old: 23 From there he went up to Beer-sheba.

content: 24 That night the LORD appeared to him and said, “I am the God of your father Abraham. Fear not, for I am with you, and I will bless you and increase your offspring for the sake of My servant Abraham.”
content_old: 24 That night the LORD appeared to him and said, “I am the God of your father Abraham. Fear not, for I am with you, and I will bless you and increase your offspring for the sake of My servant Abraham.”

content: 25 So he built an altar there and invoked the LORD by name. Isaac pitched his tent there and his servants started digging a well.
content_old: 25 So he built an altar there and invoked the LORD by name. Isaac pitched his tent there and his servants started digging a well.

content: 26 And Abimelech came to him from Gerar, with Ahuzzath his councilor and Phicol chief of his troops.
content_old: 26 And Abimelech came to him from Gerar, with Ahuzzath his councilor and Phicol chief of his troops.

content: 27 Isaac said to them, “Why have you come to me, seeing that you have been hostile to me and have driven me away from you?”
content_old: 27 Isaac said to them, “Why have you come to me, seeing that you have been hostile to me and have driven me away from you?”

content: 28 And they said, “We now see plainly that the LORD has been with you, and we thought: Let there be a sworn treaty between our two parties, between you and us. Let us make a pact with you
content_old: 28 And they said, “We now see plainly that the LORD has been with you, and we thought: Let there be a sworn treaty between our two parties, between you and us. Let us make a pact with you

content: 29 that you will not do us harm, just as we have not molested you but have always dealt kindly with you and sent you away in peace. From now on, be you blessed of the LORD!”
content_old: 29 that you will not do us harm, just as we have not molested you but have always dealt kindly with you and sent you away in peace. From now on, be you blessed of the LORD!”

content: 30 Then he made for them a feast, and they ate and drank.
content_old: 30 Then he made for them a feast, and they ate and drank.

content: 31 Early in the morning, they exchanged oaths. Isaac then bade them farewell, and they departed from him in peace.
content_old: 31 Early in the morning, they exchanged oaths. Isaac then bade them farewell, and they departed from him in peace.

content: 32 That same day Isaac’s servants came and told him about the well they had dug, and said to him, “We have found water!”
content_old: 32 That same day Isaac’s servants came and told him about the well they had dug, and said to him, “We have found water!”

content: 33 He named it Shibah; therefore the name of the city is Beer-sheba to this day.
content_old: 33 He named it Shibah; therefore the name of the city is Beer-sheba to this day.

content: 34 When Esau was forty years old, he took to wife Judith daughter of Beeri the Hittite, and Basemath daughter of Elon the Hittite;
content_old: 34 When Esau was forty years old, he took to wife Judith daughter of Beeri the Hittite, and Basemath daughter of Elon the Hittite;

content: 1 When Isaac was old and his eyes were too dim to see, he called his older son Esau and said to him, “My son.” He answered, “Here I am.”
content_old: 1 When Isaac was old and his eyes were too dim to see, he called his older son Esau and said to him, “My son.” He answered, “Here I am.”

content: 2 And he said, “I am old now, and I do not know how soon I may die.
content_old: 2 And he said, “I am old now, and I do not know how soon I may die.

content: 3 Take your gear, your quiver and bow, and go out into the open and hunt me some game.
content_old: 3 Take your gear, your quiver and bow, and go out into the open and hunt me some game.

content: 4 Then prepare a dish for me such as I like, and bring it to me to eat, so that I may give you my innermost blessing before I die.”
content_old: 4 Then prepare a dish for me such as I like, and bring it to me to eat, so that I may give you my innermost blessing before I die.”

content: 5 Rebekah had been listening as Isaac spoke to his son Esau. When Esau had gone out into the open to hunt game to bring home,
content_old: 5 Rebekah had been listening as Isaac spoke to his son Esau. When Esau had gone out into the open to hunt game to bring home,

content: 6 Rebekah said to her son Jacob, “I overheard your father speaking to your brother Esau, saying,
content_old: 6 Rebekah said to her son Jacob, “I overheard your father speaking to your brother Esau, saying,

content: 7 ‘Bring me some game and prepare a dish for me to eat, that I may bless you, with the LORD‘s approval, before I die.’
content_old: 7 ‘Bring me some game and prepare a dish for me to eat, that I may bless you, with the LORD‘s approval, before I die.’

content: 8 Now, my son, listen carefully as I instruct you.
content_old: 8 Now, my son, listen carefully as I instruct you.

content: 9 Go to the flock and fetch me two choice kids, and I will make of them a dish for your father, such as he likes.
content_old: 9 Go to the flock and fetch me two choice kids, and I will make of them a dish for your father, such as he likes.

content: 10 Then take it to your father to eat, in order that he may bless you before he dies.”
content_old: 10 Then take it to your father to eat, in order that he may bless you before he dies.”

content: 11 Jacob answered his mother Rebekah, “But my brother Esau is a hairy man and I am smooth-skinned.
content_old: 11 Jacob answered his mother Rebekah, “But my brother Esau is a hairy man and I am smooth-skinned.

content: 12 If my father touches me, I shall appear to him as a trickster and bring upon myself a curse, not a blessing.”
content_old: 12 If my father touches me, I shall appear to him as a trickster and bring upon myself a curse, not a blessing.”

content: 13 But his mother said to him, “Your curse, my son, be upon me! Just do as I say and go fetch them for me.”
content_old: 13 But his mother said to him, “Your curse, my son, be upon me! Just do as I say and go fetch them for me.”

content: 14 He got them and brought them to his mother, and his mother prepared a dish such as his father liked.
content_old: 14 He got them and brought them to his mother, and his mother prepared a dish such as his father liked.

content: 15 Rebekah then took the best clothes of her older son Esau, which were there in the house, and had her younger son Jacob put them on;
content_old: 15 Rebekah then took the best clothes of her older son Esau, which were there in the house, and had her younger son Jacob put them on;

content: 16 and she covered his hands and the hairless part of his neck with the skins of the kids.
content_old: 16 and she covered his hands and the hairless part of his neck with the skins of the kids.

content: 17 Then she put in the hands of her son Jacob the dish and the bread that she had prepared.
content_old: 17 Then she put in the hands of her son Jacob the dish and the bread that she had prepared.

content: 18 He went to his father and said, “Father.” And he said, “Yes, which of my sons are you?”
content_old: 18 He went to his father and said, “Father.” And he said, “Yes, which of my sons are you?”

content: 19 Jacob said to his father, “I am Esau, your first-born; I have done as you told me. Pray sit up and eat of my game, that you may give me your innermost blessing.”
content_old: 19 Jacob said to his father, “I am Esau, your first-born; I have done as you told me. Pray sit up and eat of my game, that you may give me your innermost blessing.”

content: 20 Isaac said to his son, “How did you succeed so quickly, my son?” And he said, “Because the LORD your God granted me good fortune.”
content_old: 20 Isaac said to his son, “How did you succeed so quickly, my son?” And he said, “Because the LORD your God granted me good fortune.”

content: 21 Isaac said to Jacob, “Come closer that I may feel you, my son—whether you are really my son Esau or not.”
content_old: 21 Isaac said to Jacob, “Come closer that I may feel you, my son—whether you are really my son Esau or not.”

content: 22 So Jacob drew close to his father Isaac, who felt him and wondered. “The voice is the voice of Jacob, yet the hands are the hands of Esau.”
content_old: 22 So Jacob drew close to his father Isaac, who felt him and wondered. “The voice is the voice of Jacob, yet the hands are the hands of Esau.”

content: 23 He did not recognize him, because his hands were hairy like those of his brother Esau; and so he blessed him.
content_old: 23 He did not recognize him, because his hands were hairy like those of his brother Esau; and so he blessed him.

content: 24 He asked, “Are you really my son Esau?” And when he said, “I am,”
content_old: 24 He asked, “Are you really my son Esau?” And when he said, “I am,”

content: 25 he said, “Serve me and let me eat of my son’s game that I may give you my innermost blessing.” So he served him and he ate, and he brought him wine and he drank.
content_old: 25 he said, “Serve me and let me eat of my son’s game that I may give you my innermost blessing.” So he served him and he ate, and he brought him wine and he drank.

content: 26 Then his father Isaac said to him, “Come close and kiss me, my son��;
content_old: 26 Then his father Isaac said to him, “Come close and kiss me, my son��;

content: 27 and he went up and kissed him. And he smelled his clothes and he blessed him, saying, “Ah, the smell of my son is like the smell of the fields that the LORD has blessed.
content_old: 27 and he went up and kissed him. And he smelled his clothes and he blessed him, saying, “Ah, the smell of my son is like the smell of the fields that the LORD has blessed.

content: 28 “May God give you Of the dew of heaven and the fat of the earth, Abundance of new grain and wine.
content_old: 28 “May God give you Of the dew of heaven and the fat of the earth, Abundance of new grain and wine.

content: 29 Let peoples serve you, And nations bow to you; Be master over your brothers, And let your mother’s sons bow to you. Cursed be they who curse you, Blessed they who bless you.”
content_old: 29 Let peoples serve you, And nations bow to you; Be master over your brothers, And let your mother’s sons bow to you. Cursed be they who curse you, Blessed they who bless you.”

content: 30 No sooner had Jacob left the presence of his father Isaac—after Isaac had finished blessing Jacob—than his brother Esau came back from his hunt.
content_old: 30 No sooner had Jacob left the presence of his father Isaac—after Isaac had finished blessing Jacob—than his brother Esau came back from his hunt.

content: 31 He too prepared a dish and brought it to his father. And he said to his father, “Let my father sit up and eat of his son’s game, so that you may give me your innermost blessing.”
content_old: 31 He too prepared a dish and brought it to his father. And he said to his father, “Let my father sit up and eat of his son’s game, so that you may give me your innermost blessing.”

content: 32 His father Isaac said to him, “Who are you?” And he said, “I am your son, Esau, your first-born!”
content_old: 32 His father Isaac said to him, “Who are you?” And he said, “I am your son, Esau, your first-born!”

content: 33 Isaac was seized with very violent trembling. “Who was it then,” he demanded, “that hunted game and brought it to me? Moreover, I ate of it before you came, and I blessed him; now he must remain blessed!”
content_old: 33 Isaac was seized with very violent trembling. “Who was it then,” he demanded, “that hunted game and brought it to me? Moreover, I ate of it before you came, and I blessed him; now he must remain blessed!”

content: 34 When Esau heard his father’s words, he burst into wild and bitter sobbing, and said to his father, “Bless me too, Father!”
content_old: 34 When Esau heard his father’s words, he burst into wild and bitter sobbing, and said to his father, “Bless me too, Father!”

content: 35 But he answered, “Your brother came with guile and took away your blessing.”
content_old: 35 But he answered, “Your brother came with guile and took away your blessing.”

content: 36 Esau said, “Was he, then, named Jacob that he might supplant me these two times? First he took away my birthright and now he has taken away my blessing!” And he added, “Have you not reserved a blessing for me?”
content_old: 36 Esau said, “Was he, then, named Jacob that he might supplant me these two times? First he took away my birthright and now he has taken away my blessing!” And he added, “Have you not reserved a blessing for me?”

content: 37 Isaac answered, saying to Esau, “But I have made him master over you: I have given him all his brothers for servants, and sustained him with grain and wine. What, then, can I still do for you, my son?”
content_old: 37 Isaac answered, saying to Esau, “But I have made him master over you: I have given him all his brothers for servants, and sustained him with grain and wine. What, then, can I still do for you, my son?”

content: 38 And Esau said to his father, “Have you but one blessing, Father? Bless me too, Father!” And Esau wept aloud.
content_old: 38 And Esau said to his father, “Have you but one blessing, Father? Bless me too, Father!” And Esau wept aloud.

content: 39 And his father Isaac answered, saying to him, “See, your abode shall enjoy the fat of the earth And the dew of heaven above.
content_old: 39 And his father Isaac answered, saying to him, “See, your abode shall enjoy the fat of the earth And the dew of heaven above.

content: 40 Yet by your sword you shall live, And you shall serve your brother; But when you grow restive, You shall break his yoke from your neck.”
content_old: 40 Yet by your sword you shall live, And you shall serve your brother; But when you grow restive, You shall break his yoke from your neck.”

content: 41 Now Esau harbored a grudge against Jacob because of the blessing which his father had given him, and Esau said to himself, “Let but the mourning period of my father come, and I will kill my brother Jacob.”
content_old: 41 Now Esau harbored a grudge against Jacob because of the blessing which his father had given him, and Esau said to himself, “Let but the mourning period of my father come, and I will kill my brother Jacob.”

content: 42 When the words of her older son Esau were reported to Rebekah, she sent for her younger son Jacob and said to him, “Your brother Esau is consoling himself by planning to kill you.
content_old: 42 When the words of her older son Esau were reported to Rebekah, she sent for her younger son Jacob and said to him, “Your brother Esau is consoling himself by planning to kill you.

content: 43 Now, my son, listen to me. Flee at once to Haran, to my brother Laban.
content_old: 43 Now, my son, listen to me. Flee at once to Haran, to my brother Laban.

content: 44 Stay with him a while, until your brother’s fury subsides—
content_old: 44 Stay with him a while, until your brother’s fury subsides—

content: 45 until your brother’s anger against you subsides—and he forgets what you have done to him. Then I will fetch you from there. Let me not lose you both in one day!”
content_old: 45 until your brother’s anger against you subsides—and he forgets what you have done to him. Then I will fetch you from there. Let me not lose you both in one day!”

content: 1 So Isaac sent for Jacob and blessed him. He instructed him, saying, “You shall not take a wife from among the Canaanite women.
content_old: 1 So Isaac sent for Jacob and blessed him. He instructed him, saying, “You shall not take a wife from among the Canaanite women.

content: 2 Up, go to Paddan-aram, to the house of Bethuel, your mother’s father, and take a wife there from among the daughters of Laban, your mother’s brother,
content_old: 2 Up, go to Paddan-aram, to the house of Bethuel, your mother’s father, and take a wife there from among the daughters of Laban, your mother’s brother,

content: 3 May El Shaddai bless you, make you fertile and numerous, so that you become an assembly of peoples.
content_old: 3 May El Shaddai bless you, make you fertile and numerous, so that you become an assembly of peoples.

content: 4 May He grant the blessing of Abraham to you and your offspring, that you may possess the land where you are sojourning, which God assigned to Abraham.”
content_old: 4 May He grant the blessing of Abraham to you and your offspring, that you may possess the land where you are sojourning, which God assigned to Abraham.”

content: 5 Then Isaac sent Jacob off, and he went to Paddan-aram, to Laban the son of Bethuel the Aramean, the brother of Rebekah, mother of Jacob and Esau.
content_old: 5 Then Isaac sent Jacob off, and he went to Paddan-aram, to Laban the son of Bethuel the Aramean, the brother of Rebekah, mother of Jacob and Esau.

content: 6 When Esau saw that Isaac had blessed Jacob and sent him off to Paddan-aram to take a wife from there, charging him, as he blessed him, “You shall not take a wife from among the Canaanite women,”
content_old: 6 When Esau saw that Isaac had blessed Jacob and sent him off to Paddan-aram to take a wife from there, charging him, as he blessed him, “You shall not take a wife from among the Canaanite women,”

content: 7 and that Jacob had obeyed his father and mother and gone to Paddan-aram,
content_old: 7 and that Jacob had obeyed his father and mother and gone to Paddan-aram,

content: 8 Esau realized that the Canaanite women displeased his father Isaac.
content_old: 8 Esau realized that the Canaanite women displeased his father Isaac.

content: 9 So Esau went to Ishmael and took to wife, in addition to the wives he had, Mahalath the daughter of Ishmael son of Abraham, sister of Nebaioth.
content_old: 9 So Esau went to Ishmael and took to wife, in addition to the wives he had, Mahalath the daughter of Ishmael son of Abraham, sister of Nebaioth.

content: 10 Jacob left Beer-sheba, and set out for Haran.
content_old: 10 Jacob left Beer-sheba, and set out for Haran.

content: 11 He came upon a certain place and stopped there for the night, for the sun had set. Taking one of the stones of that place, he put it under his head and lay down in that place.
content_old: 11 He came upon a certain place and stopped there for the night, for the sun had set. Taking one of the stones of that place, he put it under his head and lay down in that place.

content: 12 He had a dream; a stairway was set on the ground and its top reached to the sky, and angels of God were going up and down on it.
content_old: 12 He had a dream; a stairway was set on the ground and its top reached to the sky, and angels of God were going up and down on it.

content: 13 And the LORD was standing beside him and He said, “I am the LORD, the God of your father Abraham and the God of Isaac: the ground on which you are lying I will assign to you and to your offspring.
content_old: 13 And the LORD was standing beside him and He said, “I am the LORD, the God of your father Abraham and the God of Isaac: the ground on which you are lying I will assign to you and to your offspring.

content: 14 Your descendants shall be as the dust of the earth; you shall spread out to the west and to the east, to the north and to the south. All the families of the earth shall bless themselves by you and your descendants.
content_old: 14 Your descendants shall be as the dust of the earth; you shall spread out to the west and to the east, to the north and to the south. All the families of the earth shall bless themselves by you and your descendants.

content: 15 Remember, I am with you: I will protect you wherever you go and will bring you back to this land. I will not leave you until I have done what I have promised you.”
content_old: 15 Remember, I am with you: I will protect you wherever you go and will bring you back to this land. I will not leave you until I have done what I have promised you.”

content: 16 Jacob awoke from his sleep and said, “Surely the LORD is present in this place, and I did not know it!”
content_old: 16 Jacob awoke from his sleep and said, “Surely the LORD is present in this place, and I did not know it!”

content: 17 Shaken, he said, “How awesome is this place! This is none other than the abode of God, and that is the gateway to heaven.”
content_old: 17 Shaken, he said, “How awesome is this place! This is none other than the abode of God, and that is the gateway to heaven.”

content: 18 Early in the morning, Jacob took the stone that he had put under his head and set it up as a pillar and poured oil on the top of it.
content_old: 18 Early in the morning, Jacob took the stone that he had put under his head and set it up as a pillar and poured oil on the top of it.

content: 19 He named that site Bethel; but previously the name of the city had been Luz.
content_old: 19 He named that site Bethel; but previously the name of the city had been Luz.

content: 20 Jacob then made a vow, saying, “If God remains with me, if He protects me on this journey that I am making, and gives me bread to eat and clothing to wear,
content_old: 20 Jacob then made a vow, saying, “If God remains with me, if He protects me on this journey that I am making, and gives me bread to eat and clothing to wear,

content: 21 and if I return safe to my father’s house—the LORD shall be my God.
content_old: 21 and if I return safe to my father’s house—the LORD shall be my God.

content: 1 Jacob resumed his journey and came to the land of the Easterners.
content_old: 1 Jacob resumed his journey and came to the land of the Easterners.

content: 2 There before his eyes was a well in the open. Three flocks of sheep were lying there beside it, for the flocks were watered from that well. The stone on the mouth of the well was large.
content_old: 2 There before his eyes was a well in the open. Three flocks of sheep were lying there beside it, for the flocks were watered from that well. The stone on the mouth of the well was large.

content: 3 When all the flocks were gathered there, the stone would be rolled from the mouth of the well and the sheep watered; then the stone would be put back in its place on the mouth of the well.
content_old: 3 When all the flocks were gathered there, the stone would be rolled from the mouth of the well and the sheep watered; then the stone would be put back in its place on the mouth of the well.

content: 4 Jacob said to them, “My friends, where are you from?” And they said, “We are from Haran.”
content_old: 4 Jacob said to them, “My friends, where are you from?” And they said, “We are from Haran.”

content: 5 He said to them, “Do you know Laban the son of Nahor?” And they said, “Yes, we do.”
content_old: 5 He said to them, “Do you know Laban the son of Nahor?” And they said, “Yes, we do.”

content: 6 He continued, “Is he well?” They answered, “Yes, he is; and there is his daughter Rachel, coming with the flock.”
content_old: 6 He continued, “Is he well?” They answered, “Yes, he is; and there is his daughter Rachel, coming with the flock.”

content: 7 He said, “It is still broad daylight, too early to round up the animals; water the flock and take them to pasture.”
content_old: 7 He said, “It is still broad daylight, too early to round up the animals; water the flock and take them to pasture.”

content: 8 But they said, “We cannot, until all the flocks are rounded up; then the stone is rolled off the mouth of the well and we water the sheep.”
content_old: 8 But they said, “We cannot, until all the flocks are rounded up; then the stone is rolled off the mouth of the well and we water the sheep.”

content: 9 While he was still speaking with them, Rachel came with her father’s flock; for she was a shepherdess.
content_old: 9 While he was still speaking with them, Rachel came with her father’s flock; for she was a shepherdess.

content: 10 And when Jacob saw Rachel, the daughter of his uncle Laban, and the flock of his uncle Laban, Jacob went up and rolled the stone off the mouth of the well, and watered the flock of his uncle Laban.
content_old: 10 And when Jacob saw Rachel, the daughter of his uncle Laban, and the flock of his uncle Laban, Jacob went up and rolled the stone off the mouth of the well, and watered the flock of his uncle Laban.

content: 11 Then Jacob kissed Rachel, and broke into tears.
content_old: 11 Then Jacob kissed Rachel, and broke into tears.

content: 12 Jacob told Rachel that he was her father’s kinsman, that he was Rebekah’s son; and she ran and told her father.
content_old: 12 Jacob told Rachel that he was her father’s kinsman, that he was Rebekah’s son; and she ran and told her father.

content: 13 On hearing the news of his sister’s son Jacob, Laban ran to greet him; he embraced him and kissed him, and took him into his house. He told Laban all that had happened,
content_old: 13 On hearing the news of his sister’s son Jacob, Laban ran to greet him; he embraced him and kissed him, and took him into his house. He told Laban all that had happened,

content: 14 and Laban said to him, “You are truly my bone and flesh.” When he had stayed with him a month’s time,
content_old: 14 and Laban said to him, “You are truly my bone and flesh.” When he had stayed with him a month’s time,

content: 15 Laban said to Jacob, “Just because you are a kinsman, should you serve me for nothing? Tell me, what shall your wages be?”
content_old: 15 Laban said to Jacob, “Just because you are a kinsman, should you serve me for nothing? Tell me, what shall your wages be?”

content: 16 Now Laban had two daughters; the name of the older one was Leah, and the name of the younger was Rachel.
content_old: 16 Now Laban had two daughters; the name of the older one was Leah, and the name of the younger was Rachel.

content: 17 Leah had weak eyes; Rachel was shapely and beautiful.
content_old: 17 Leah had weak eyes; Rachel was shapely and beautiful.

content: 18 Jacob loved Rachel; so he answered, “I will serve you seven years for your younger daughter Rachel.”
content_old: 18 Jacob loved Rachel; so he answered, “I will serve you seven years for your younger daughter Rachel.”

content: 19 Laban said, “Better that I give her to you than that I should give her to an outsider. Stay with me.”
content_old: 19 Laban said, “Better that I give her to you than that I should give her to an outsider. Stay with me.”

content: 20 So Jacob served seven years for Rachel and they seemed to him but a few days because of his love for her.
content_old: 20 So Jacob served seven years for Rachel and they seemed to him but a few days because of his love for her.

content: 21 Then Jacob said to Laban, “Give me my wife, for my time is fulfilled, that I may cohabit with her.”
content_old: 21 Then Jacob said to Laban, “Give me my wife, for my time is fulfilled, that I may cohabit with her.”

content: 22 And Laban gathered all the people of the place and made a feast.
content_old: 22 And Laban gathered all the people of the place and made a feast.

content: 23 When evening came, he took his daughter Leah and brought her to him; and he cohabited with her.—
content_old: 23 When evening came, he took his daughter Leah and brought her to him; and he cohabited with her.—

content: 24 Laban had given his maidservant Zilpah to his daughter Leah as her maid.—
content_old: 24 Laban had given his maidservant Zilpah to his daughter Leah as her maid.—

content: 25 When morning came, there was Leah! So he said to Laban, “What is this you have done to me? I was in your service for Rachel! Why did you deceive me?”
content_old: 25 When morning came, there was Leah! So he said to Laban, “What is this you have done to me? I was in your service for Rachel! Why did you deceive me?”

content: 26 Laban said, “It is not the practice in our place to marry off the younger before the older.
content_old: 26 Laban said, “It is not the practice in our place to marry off the younger before the older.

content: 27 Wait until the bridal week of this one is over and we will give you that one too, provided you serve me another seven years.”
content_old: 27 Wait until the bridal week of this one is over and we will give you that one too, provided you serve me another seven years.”

content: 28 Jacob did so; he waited out the bridal week of the one, and then he gave him his daughter Rachel as wife.—
content_old: 28 Jacob did so; he waited out the bridal week of the one, and then he gave him his daughter Rachel as wife.—

content: 29 Laban had given his maidservant Bilhah to his daughter Rachel as her maid.—
content_old: 29 Laban had given his maidservant Bilhah to his daughter Rachel as her maid.—

content: 30 And Jacob cohabited with Rachel also; indeed, he loved Rachel more than Leah. And he served him another seven years.
content_old: 30 And Jacob cohabited with Rachel also; indeed, he loved Rachel more than Leah. And he served him another seven years.

content: 31 The LORD saw that Leah was unloved and he opened her womb; but Rachel was barren.
content_old: 31 The LORD saw that Leah was unloved and he opened her womb; but Rachel was barren.

content: 32 Leah conceived and bore a son, and named him Reuben; for she declared, “It means: ‘The LORD has seen my affliction’; it also means: ‘Now my husband will love me.”‘
content_old: 32 Leah conceived and bore a son, and named him Reuben; for she declared, “It means: ‘The LORD has seen my affliction’; it also means: ‘Now my husband will love me.”‘

content: 33 She conceived again and bore a son, and declared, “This is because the LORD heard that I was unloved and has given me this one also”; so she named him Simeon.
content_old: 33 She conceived again and bore a son, and declared, “This is because the LORD heard that I was unloved and has given me this one also”; so she named him Simeon.

content: 34 Again she conceived and bore a son and declared, “This time my husband will become attached to me, for I have borne him three sons.” Therefore he was named Levi.
content_old: 34 Again she conceived and bore a son and declared, “This time my husband will become attached to me, for I have borne him three sons.” Therefore he was named Levi.

content: 1 When Rachel saw that she had borne Jacob no children, she became envious of her sister; and Rachel said to Jacob, “Give me children, or I shall die.”
content_old: 1 When Rachel saw that she had borne Jacob no children, she became envious of her sister; and Rachel said to Jacob, “Give me children, or I shall die.”

content: 2 Jacob was incensed at Rachel, and said, “Can I take the place of God, who has denied you fruit of the womb?”
content_old: 2 Jacob was incensed at Rachel, and said, “Can I take the place of God, who has denied you fruit of the womb?”

content: 3 She said, “Here is my maid Bilhah. Consort with her, that she may bear on my knees and that through her I too may have children.”
content_old: 3 She said, “Here is my maid Bilhah. Consort with her, that she may bear on my knees and that through her I too may have children.”

content: 4 So she gave him her maid Bilhah as concubine, and Jacob cohabited with her.
content_old: 4 So she gave him her maid Bilhah as concubine, and Jacob cohabited with her.

content: 5 Bilhah conceived and bore Jacob a son.
content_old: 5 Bilhah conceived and bore Jacob a son.

content: 6 And Rachel said, “God has vindicated me; indeed, He has heeded my plea and given me a son.” Therefore she named him Dan.
content_old: 6 And Rachel said, “God has vindicated me; indeed, He has heeded my plea and given me a son.” Therefore she named him Dan.

content: 7 Rachel’s maid Bilhah conceived again and bore Jacob a second son.
content_old: 7 Rachel’s maid Bilhah conceived again and bore Jacob a second son.

content: 8 And Rachel said, “A fateful contest I waged with my sister; yes, and I have prevailed.” So she named him Naphtali.
content_old: 8 And Rachel said, “A fateful contest I waged with my sister; yes, and I have prevailed.” So she named him Naphtali.

content: 9 When Leah saw that she had stopped bearing, she took her maid Zilpah and gave her to Jacob as concubine.
content_old: 9 When Leah saw that she had stopped bearing, she took her maid Zilpah and gave her to Jacob as concubine.

content: 10 And when Leah’s maid Zilpah bore Jacob a son,
content_old: 10 And when Leah’s maid Zilpah bore Jacob a son,

content: 11 Leah said, “What luck!” So she named him Gad.
content_old: 11 Leah said, “What luck!” So she named him Gad.

content: 12 When Leah’s maid Zilpah bore Jacob a second son,
content_old: 12 When Leah’s maid Zilpah bore Jacob a second son,

content: 13 Leah declared, “What fortune!” meaning, “Women will deem me fortunate.” So she named him Asher.
content_old: 13 Leah declared, “What fortune!” meaning, “Women will deem me fortunate.” So she named him Asher.

content: 14 Once, at the time of the wheat harvest, Reuben came upon some mandrakes in the field and brought them to his mother Leah. Rachel said to Leah, “Please give me some of your son’s mandrakes.”
content_old: 14 Once, at the time of the wheat harvest, Reuben came upon some mandrakes in the field and brought them to his mother Leah. Rachel said to Leah, “Please give me some of your son’s mandrakes.”

content: 15 But she said to her, “Was it not enough for you to take away my husband, that you would also take my son’s mandrakes?” Rachel replied, “I promise, he shall lie with you tonight, in return for your son’s mandrakes.”
content_old: 15 But she said to her, “Was it not enough for you to take away my husband, that you would also take my son’s mandrakes?” Rachel replied, “I promise, he shall lie with you tonight, in return for your son’s mandrakes.”

content: 16 When Jacob came home from the field in the evening, Leah went out to meet him and said, “You are to sleep with me, for I have hired you with my son’s mandrakes.” And he lay with her that night.
content_old: 16 When Jacob came home from the field in the evening, Leah went out to meet him and said, “You are to sleep with me, for I have hired you with my son’s mandrakes.” And he lay with her that night.

content: 17 God heeded Leah, and she conceived and bore him a fifth son.
content_old: 17 God heeded Leah, and she conceived and bore him a fifth son.

content: 18 And Leah said, “God has given me my reward for having given my maid to my husband.” So she named him Issachar.
content_old: 18 And Leah said, “God has given me my reward for having given my maid to my husband.” So she named him Issachar.

content: 19 When Leah conceived again and bore Jacob a sixth son,
content_old: 19 When Leah conceived again and bore Jacob a sixth son,

content: 20 Leah said, “God has given me a choice gift; this time my husband will exalt me, for I have borne him six sons.” So she named him Zebulun.
content_old: 20 Leah said, “God has given me a choice gift; this time my husband will exalt me, for I have borne him six sons.” So she named him Zebulun.

content: 21 Last, she bore him a daughter, and named her Dinah.
content_old: 21 Last, she bore him a daughter, and named her Dinah.

content: 22 Now God remembered Rachel; God heeded her and opened her womb.
content_old: 22 Now God remembered Rachel; God heeded her and opened her womb.

content: 23 She conceived and bore a son, and said, “God has taken away my disgrace.”
content_old: 23 She conceived and bore a son, and said, “God has taken away my disgrace.”

content: 24 So she named him Joseph, which is to say, “May the LORD add another son for me.”
content_old: 24 So she named him Joseph, which is to say, “May the LORD add another son for me.”

content: 25 After Rachel had borne Joseph, Jacob said to Laban, “Give me leave to go back to my own homeland.
content_old: 25 After Rachel had borne Joseph, Jacob said to Laban, “Give me leave to go back to my own homeland.

content: 26 Give me my wives and my children, for whom I have served you, that I may go; for well you know what services I have rendered you.”
content_old: 26 Give me my wives and my children, for whom I have served you, that I may go; for well you know what services I have rendered you.”

content: 27 But Laban said to him, “If you will indulge me, I have learned by divination that the LORD has blessed me on your account.”
content_old: 27 But Laban said to him, “If you will indulge me, I have learned by divination that the LORD has blessed me on your account.”

content: 28 And he continued, “Name the wages due from me, and I will pay you.”
content_old: 28 And he continued, “Name the wages due from me, and I will pay you.”

content: 29 But he said, “You know well how I have served you and how your livestock has fared with me.
content_old: 29 But he said, “You know well how I have served you and how your livestock has fared with me.

content: 30 For the little you had before I came has grown to much, since the LORD has blessed you wherever I turned. And now, when shall I make provision for my own household?”
content_old: 30 For the little you had before I came has grown to much, since the LORD has blessed you wherever I turned. And now, when shall I make provision for my own household?”

content: 31 He said, “What shall I pay you?” And Jacob said, “Pay me nothing! If you will do this thing for me, I will again pasture and keep your flocks:
content_old: 31 He said, “What shall I pay you?” And Jacob said, “Pay me nothing! If you will do this thing for me, I will again pasture and keep your flocks:

content: 32 let me pass through your whole flock today, removing from there every speckled and spotted animal—every dark-colored sheep and every spotted and speckled goat. Such shall be my wages.
content_old: 32 let me pass through your whole flock today, removing from there every speckled and spotted animal—every dark-colored sheep and every spotted and speckled goat. Such shall be my wages.

content: 33 In the future when you go over my wages, let my honesty toward you testify for me: if there are among my goats any that are not speckled or spotted or any sheep that are not dark-colored, they got there by theft.”
content_old: 33 In the future when you go over my wages, let my honesty toward you testify for me: if there are among my goats any that are not speckled or spotted or any sheep that are not dark-colored, they got there by theft.”

content: 34 And Laban said, “Very well, let it be as you say.”
content_old: 34 And Laban said, “Very well, let it be as you say.”

content: 35 But that same day he removed the streaked and spotted he-goats and all the speckled and spotted she-goats—every one that had white on it—and all the dark-colored sheep, and left them in the charge of his sons.
content_old: 35 But that same day he removed the streaked and spotted he-goats and all the speckled and spotted she-goats—every one that had white on it—and all the dark-colored sheep, and left them in the charge of his sons.

content: 36 And he put a distance of three days’ journey between himself and Jacob, while Jacob was pasturing the rest of Laban’s flock.
content_old: 36 And he put a distance of three days’ journey between himself and Jacob, while Jacob was pasturing the rest of Laban’s flock.

content: 37 Jacob then got fresh shoots of poplar, and of almond and plane, and peeled white stripes in them, laying bare the white of the shoots.
content_old: 37 Jacob then got fresh shoots of poplar, and of almond and plane, and peeled white stripes in them, laying bare the white of the shoots.

content: 38 The rods that he had peeled he set up in front of the goats in the troughs, the water receptacles, that the goats came to drink from. Their mating occurred when they came to drink,
content_old: 38 The rods that he had peeled he set up in front of the goats in the troughs, the water receptacles, that the goats came to drink from. Their mating occurred when they came to drink,

content: 39 and since the goats mated by the rods, the goats brought forth streaked, speckled, and spotted young.
content_old: 39 and since the goats mated by the rods, the goats brought forth streaked, speckled, and spotted young.

content: 40 But Jacob dealt separately with the sheep; he made these animals face the streaked or wholly dark-colored animals in Laban’s flock. And so he produced special flocks for himself, which he did not put with Laban’s flocks.
content_old: 40 But Jacob dealt separately with the sheep; he made these animals face the streaked or wholly dark-colored animals in Laban’s flock. And so he produced special flocks for himself, which he did not put with Laban’s flocks.

content: 41 Moreover, when the sturdier animals were mating, Jacob would place the rods in the troughs, in full view of the animals, so that they mated by the rods;
content_old: 41 Moreover, when the sturdier animals were mating, Jacob would place the rods in the troughs, in full view of the animals, so that they mated by the rods;

content: 42 but with the feebler animals he would not place them there. Thus the feeble ones went to Laban and the sturdy to Jacob.
content_old: 42 but with the feebler animals he would not place them there. Thus the feeble ones went to Laban and the sturdy to Jacob.

content: 1 Now he heard the things that Laban’s sons were saying: “Jacob has taken all that was our father’s, and from that which was our father’s he has built up all this wealth.”
content_old: 1 Now he heard the things that Laban’s sons were saying: “Jacob has taken all that was our father’s, and from that which was our father’s he has built up all this wealth.”

content: 2 Jacob also saw that Laban’s manner toward him was not as it had been in the past.
content_old: 2 Jacob also saw that Laban’s manner toward him was not as it had been in the past.

content: 3 Then the LORD said to Jacob, “Return to the land of your fathers where you were born, and I will be with you.”
content_old: 3 Then the LORD said to Jacob, “Return to the land of your fathers where you were born, and I will be with you.”

content: 4 Jacob had Rachel and Leah called to the field, where his flock was,
content_old: 4 Jacob had Rachel and Leah called to the field, where his flock was,

content: 5 and said to them, “I see that your father’s manner toward me is not as it has been in the past. But the God of my father has been with me.
content_old: 5 and said to them, “I see that your father’s manner toward me is not as it has been in the past. But the God of my father has been with me.

content: 6 As you know, I have served your father with all my might;
content_old: 6 As you know, I have served your father with all my might;

content: 7 but your father has cheated me, changing my wages time and again. God, however, would not let him do me harm.
content_old: 7 but your father has cheated me, changing my wages time and again. God, however, would not let him do me harm.

content: 8 If he said thus, ‘The speckled shall be your wages,’ then all the flocks would drop speckled young; and if he said thus, ‘The streaked shall be your wages,’ then all the flocks would drop streaked young.
content_old: 8 If he said thus, ‘The speckled shall be your wages,’ then all the flocks would drop speckled young; and if he said thus, ‘The streaked shall be your wages,’ then all the flocks would drop streaked young.

content: 9 God has taken away your father’s livestock and given it to me.
content_old: 9 God has taken away your father’s livestock and given it to me.

content: 10 “Once, at the mating time of the flocks, I had a dream in which I saw that the he-goats mating with the flock were streaked, speckled, and mottled.
content_old: 10 “Once, at the mating time of the flocks, I had a dream in which I saw that the he-goats mating with the flock were streaked, speckled, and mottled.

content: 11 And in the dream an angel of God said to me, ‘Jacob!’ ‘Here,’ I answered.
content_old: 11 And in the dream an angel of God said to me, ‘Jacob!’ ‘Here,’ I answered.

content: 12 And he said, ‘Note well that all the he-goats which are mating with the flock are streaked, speckled, and mottled; for I have noted all that Laban has been doing to you.
content_old: 12 And he said, ‘Note well that all the he-goats which are mating with the flock are streaked, speckled, and mottled; for I have noted all that Laban has been doing to you.

content: 13 I am the God of Beth-el, where you anointed a pillar and where you made a vow to Me. Now, arise and leave this land and return to your native land.’ ”
content_old: 13 I am the God of Beth-el, where you anointed a pillar and where you made a vow to Me. Now, arise and leave this land and return to your native land.’ ”

content: 14 Then Rachel and Leah answered him, saying, “Have we still a share in the inheritance of our father’s house?
content_old: 14 Then Rachel and Leah answered him, saying, “Have we still a share in the inheritance of our father’s house?

content: 15 Surely, he regards us as outsiders, now that he has sold us and has used up our purchase price.
content_old: 15 Surely, he regards us as outsiders, now that he has sold us and has used up our purchase price.

content: 16 Truly, all the wealth that God has taken away from our father belongs to us and to our children. Now then, do just as God has told you.”
content_old: 16 Truly, all the wealth that God has taken away from our father belongs to us and to our children. Now then, do just as God has told you.”

content: 17 Thereupon Jacob put his children and wives on camels;
content_old: 17 Thereupon Jacob put his children and wives on camels;

content: 18 and he drove off all his livestock and all the wealth that he had amassed, the livestock in his possession that he had acquired in Paddan-aram, to go to his father Isaac in the land of Canaan.
content_old: 18 and he drove off all his livestock and all the wealth that he had amassed, the livestock in his possession that he had acquired in Paddan-aram, to go to his father Isaac in the land of Canaan.

content: 19 Meanwhile Laban had gone to shear his sheep, and Rachel stole her father’s household idols.
content_old: 19 Meanwhile Laban had gone to shear his sheep, and Rachel stole her father’s household idols.

content: 20 Jacob kept Laban the Aramean in the dark, not telling him that he was fleeing,
content_old: 20 Jacob kept Laban the Aramean in the dark, not telling him that he was fleeing,

content: 21 and fled with all that he had. Soon he was across the Euphrates and heading toward the hill country of Gilead.
content_old: 21 and fled with all that he had. Soon he was across the Euphrates and heading toward the hill country of Gilead.

content: 22 On the third day, Laban was told that Jacob had fled.
content_old: 22 On the third day, Laban was told that Jacob had fled.

content: 23 So he took his kinsmen with him and pursued him a distance of seven days, catching up with him in the hill country of Gilead.
content_old: 23 So he took his kinsmen with him and pursued him a distance of seven days, catching up with him in the hill country of Gilead.

content: 24 But God appeared to Laban the Aramean in a dream by night and said to him, “Beware of attempting anything with Jacob, good or bad.”
content_old: 24 But God appeared to Laban the Aramean in a dream by night and said to him, “Beware of attempting anything with Jacob, good or bad.”

content: 25 Laban overtook Jacob. Jacob had pitched his tent on the Height, and Laban with his kinsmen encamped in the hill country of Gilead.
content_old: 25 Laban overtook Jacob. Jacob had pitched his tent on the Height, and Laban with his kinsmen encamped in the hill country of Gilead.

content: 26 And Laban said to Jacob, “What did you mean by keeping me in the dark and carrying off my daughters like captives of the sword?
content_old: 26 And Laban said to Jacob, “What did you mean by keeping me in the dark and carrying off my daughters like captives of the sword?

content: 27 Why did you flee in secrecy and mislead me and not tell me? I would have sent you off with festive music, with timbrel and lyre.
content_old: 27 Why did you flee in secrecy and mislead me and not tell me? I would have sent you off with festive music, with timbrel and lyre.

content: 28 You did not even let me kiss my sons and daughters good-by! It was a foolish thing for you to do.
content_old: 28 You did not even let me kiss my sons and daughters good-by! It was a foolish thing for you to do.

content: 29 I have it in my power to do you harm; but the God of your father said to me last night, ‘Beware of attempting anything with Jacob, good or bad.’
content_old: 29 I have it in my power to do you harm; but the God of your father said to me last night, ‘Beware of attempting anything with Jacob, good or bad.’

content: 30 Very well, you had to leave because you were longing for your father’s house; but why did you steal my gods?
content_old: 30 Very well, you had to leave because you were longing for your father’s house; but why did you steal my gods?

content: 31 Jacob answered Laban, saying, “I was afraid because I thought you would take your daughters from me by force.
content_old: 31 Jacob answered Laban, saying, “I was afraid because I thought you would take your daughters from me by force.

content: 32 But anyone with whom you find your gods shall not remain alive! In the presence of our kinsmen, point out what I have of yours and take it.” Jacob, of course, did not know that Rachel had stolen them.
content_old: 32 But anyone with whom you find your gods shall not remain alive! In the presence of our kinsmen, point out what I have of yours and take it.” Jacob, of course, did not know that Rachel had stolen them.

content: 33 So Laban went into Jacob’s tent and Leah’s tent and the tents of the two maidservants; but he did not find them. Leaving Leah’s tent, he entered Rachel’s tent.
content_old: 33 So Laban went into Jacob’s tent and Leah’s tent and the tents of the two maidservants; but he did not find them. Leaving Leah’s tent, he entered Rachel’s tent.

content: 34 Rachel, meanwhile, had taken the idols and placed them in the camel cushion and sat on them; and Laban rummaged through the tent without finding them.
content_old: 34 Rachel, meanwhile, had taken the idols and placed them in the camel cushion and sat on them; and Laban rummaged through the tent without finding them.

content: 35 For she said to her father, “Let not my lord take it amiss that I cannot rise before you, for the period of women is upon me.” Thus he searched, but could not find the household idols.
content_old: 35 For she said to her father, “Let not my lord take it amiss that I cannot rise before you, for the period of women is upon me.” Thus he searched, but could not find the household idols.

content: 36 Now Jacob became incensed and took up his grievance with Laban. Jacob spoke up and said to Laban, “What is my crime, what is my guilt that you should pursue me?
content_old: 36 Now Jacob became incensed and took up his grievance with Laban. Jacob spoke up and said to Laban, “What is my crime, what is my guilt that you should pursue me?

content: 37 You rummaged through all my things; what have you found of all your household objects? Set it here, before my kinsmen and yours, and let them decide between us two.
content_old: 37 You rummaged through all my things; what have you found of all your household objects? Set it here, before my kinsmen and yours, and let them decide between us two.

content: 38 “These twenty years I have spent in your service, your ewes and she-goats never miscarried, nor did I feast on rams from your flock.
content_old: 38 “These twenty years I have spent in your service, your ewes and she-goats never miscarried, nor did I feast on rams from your flock.

content: 39 That which was torn by beasts I never brought to you; I myself made good the loss; you exacted it of me, whether snatched by day or snatched by night.
content_old: 39 That which was torn by beasts I never brought to you; I myself made good the loss; you exacted it of me, whether snatched by day or snatched by night.

content: 40 Often, scorching heat ravaged me by day and frost by night; and sleep fled from my eyes.
content_old: 40 Often, scorching heat ravaged me by day and frost by night; and sleep fled from my eyes.

content: 41 Of the twenty years that I spent in your household, I served you fourteen years for your two daughters, and six years for your flocks; and you changed my wages time and again.
content_old: 41 Of the twenty years that I spent in your household, I served you fourteen years for your two daughters, and six years for your flocks; and you changed my wages time and again.

content: 42 Had not the God of my father, the God of Abraham and the Fear of Isaac, been with me, you would have sent me away empty-handed. But God took notice of my plight and the toil of my hands, and He gave judgment last night.”
content_old: 42 Had not the God of my father, the God of Abraham and the Fear of Isaac, been with me, you would have sent me away empty-handed. But God took notice of my plight and the toil of my hands, and He gave judgment last night.”

content: 43 Then Laban spoke up and said to Jacob, “The daughters are my daughters, the children are my children, and the flocks are my flocks; all that you see is mine. Yet what can I do now about my daughters or the children they have borne?
content_old: 43 Then Laban spoke up and said to Jacob, “The daughters are my daughters, the children are my children, and the flocks are my flocks; all that you see is mine. Yet what can I do now about my daughters or the children they have borne?

content: 44 Come, then, let us make a pact, you and I, that there may be a witness between you and me.”
content_old: 44 Come, then, let us make a pact, you and I, that there may be a witness between you and me.”

content: 45 Thereupon Jacob took a stone and set it up as a pillar.
content_old: 45 Thereupon Jacob took a stone and set it up as a pillar.

content: 46 And Jacob said to his kinsmen, “Gather stones.” So they took stones and made a mound; and they partook of a meal there by the mound.
content_old: 46 And Jacob said to his kinsmen, “Gather stones.” So they took stones and made a mound; and they partook of a meal there by the mound.

content: 47 Laban named it Yegar-sahadutha, but Jacob named it Gal-ed.
content_old: 47 Laban named it Yegar-sahadutha, but Jacob named it Gal-ed.

content: 48 And Laban declared, “This mound is a witness between you and me this day.” That is why it was named Gal-ed;
content_old: 48 And Laban declared, “This mound is a witness between you and me this day.” That is why it was named Gal-ed;

content: 49 And Mizpah, because he said, “May the LORD watch between you and me, when we are out of sight of each other.
content_old: 49 And Mizpah, because he said, “May the LORD watch between you and me, when we are out of sight of each other.

content: 50 If you ill-treat my daughters or take other wives besides my daughters—though no one else be about, remember, God Himself will be witness between you and me.”
content_old: 50 If you ill-treat my daughters or take other wives besides my daughters—though no one else be about, remember, God Himself will be witness between you and me.”

content: 51 And Laban said to Jacob, “Here is this mound and here the pillar which I have set up between you and me:
content_old: 51 And Laban said to Jacob, “Here is this mound and here the pillar which I have set up between you and me:

content: 52 this mound shall be witness and this pillar shall be witness that I am not to cross to you past this mound, and that you are not to cross to me past this mound and this pillar, with hostile intent.
content_old: 52 this mound shall be witness and this pillar shall be witness that I am not to cross to you past this mound, and that you are not to cross to me past this mound and this pillar, with hostile intent.

content: 53 May the God of Abraham and the god of Nahor”—their ancestral deities—“judge between us.” And Jacob swore by the Fear of his father Isaac.
content_old: 53 May the God of Abraham and the god of Nahor”—their ancestral deities—“judge between us.” And Jacob swore by the Fear of his father Isaac.

content: 1 Early in the morning, Laban kissed his sons and daughters and bade them good-by; then Laban left on his journey homeward.
content_old: 1 Early in the morning, Laban kissed his sons and daughters and bade them good-by; then Laban left on his journey homeward.

content: 2 Jacob went on his way, and angels of God encountered him.
content_old: 2 Jacob went on his way, and angels of God encountered him.

content: 3 When he saw them, Jacob said, “This is God’s camp.” So he named that place Mahanaim.
content_old: 3 When he saw them, Jacob said, “This is God’s camp.” So he named that place Mahanaim.

content: 4 Jacob sent messengers ahead to his brother Esau in the land of Seir, the country of Edom,
content_old: 4 Jacob sent messengers ahead to his brother Esau in the land of Seir, the country of Edom,

content: 5 and instructed them as follows, “Thus shall you say, ‘To my lord Esau, thus says your servant Jacob: I stayed with Laban and remained until now;
content_old: 5 and instructed them as follows, “Thus shall you say, ‘To my lord Esau, thus says your servant Jacob: I stayed with Laban and remained until now;

content: 6 I have acquired cattle, asses, sheep, and male and female slaves; and I send this message to my lord in the hope of gaining your favor.’ ”
content_old: 6 I have acquired cattle, asses, sheep, and male and female slaves; and I send this message to my lord in the hope of gaining your favor.’ ”

content: 7 The messengers returned to Jacob, saying, “We came to your brother Esau; he himself is coming to meet you, and there are four hundred men with him.”
content_old: 7 The messengers returned to Jacob, saying, “We came to your brother Esau; he himself is coming to meet you, and there are four hundred men with him.”

content: 8 Jacob was greatly frightened; in his anxiety, he divided the people with him, and the flocks and herds and camels, into two camps,
content_old: 8 Jacob was greatly frightened; in his anxiety, he divided the people with him, and the flocks and herds and camels, into two camps,

content: 9 thinking, “If Esau comes to the one camp and attacks it, the other camp may yet escape.”
content_old: 9 thinking, “If Esau comes to the one camp and attacks it, the other camp may yet escape.”

content: 10 Then Jacob said, “O God of my father Abraham and God of my father Isaac, O LORD, who said to me, ‘Return to your native land and I will deal bountifully with you’!
content_old: 10 Then Jacob said, “O God of my father Abraham and God of my father Isaac, O LORD, who said to me, ‘Return to your native land and I will deal bountifully with you’!

content: 11 I am unworthy of all the kindness that You have so steadfastly shown Your servant: with my staff alone I crossed this Jordan, and now I have become two camps.
content_old: 11 I am unworthy of all the kindness that You have so steadfastly shown Your servant: with my staff alone I crossed this Jordan, and now I have become two camps.

content: 12 Deliver me, I pray, from the hand of my brother, from the hand of Esau; else, I fear, he may come and strike me down, mothers and children alike.
content_old: 12 Deliver me, I pray, from the hand of my brother, from the hand of Esau; else, I fear, he may come and strike me down, mothers and children alike.

content: 13 Yet You have said, ‘I will deal bountifully with you and make your offspring as the sands of the sea, which are too numerous to count.’ ”
content_old: 13 Yet You have said, ‘I will deal bountifully with you and make your offspring as the sands of the sea, which are too numerous to count.’ ”

content: 14 After spending the night there, he selected from what was at hand these presents for his brother Esau:
content_old: 14 After spending the night there, he selected from what was at hand these presents for his brother Esau:

content: 15 200 she-goats and 20 he-goats; 200 ewes and 20 rams;
content_old: 15 200 she-goats and 20 he-goats; 200 ewes and 20 rams;

content: 16 30 milch camels with their colts; 40 cows and 10 bulls; 20 she-asses and 10 he-asses.
content_old: 16 30 milch camels with their colts; 40 cows and 10 bulls; 20 she-asses and 10 he-asses.

content: 17 These he put in the charge of his servants, drove by drove, and he told his servants, “Go on ahead, and keep a distance between droves.”
content_old: 17 These he put in the charge of his servants, drove by drove, and he told his servants, “Go on ahead, and keep a distance between droves.”

content: 18 He instructed the one in front as follows, “When my brother Esau meets you and asks you, ‘Whose man are you? Where are you going? And whose are these ahead of you?’
content_old: 18 He instructed the one in front as follows, “When my brother Esau meets you and asks you, ‘Whose man are you? Where are you going? And whose are these ahead of you?’

content: 19 you shall answer, ‘Your servant Jacob’s; they are a gift sent to my lord Esau; andJacob himself is right behind us.’ ”
content_old: 19 you shall answer, ‘Your servant Jacob’s; they are a gift sent to my lord Esau; andJacob himself is right behind us.’ ”

content: 20 He gave similar instructions to the second one, and the third, and all the others who followed the droves, namely, “Thus and so shall you say to Esau when you reach him.
