content_old: 20 He gave similar instructions to the second one, and the third, and all the others who followed the droves, namely, “Thus and so shall you say to Esau when you reach him.

content: 21 And you shall add, ‘And your servant Jacob himself is right behind us.’ ” For he reasoned, “If I propitiate him with presents in advance, and then face him, perhaps he will show me favor.”
content_old: 21 And you shall add, ‘And your servant Jacob himself is right behind us.’ ” For he reasoned, “If I propitiate him with presents in advance, and then face him, perhaps he will show me favor.”

content: 22 And so the gift went on ahead, while he remained in camp that night.
content_old: 22 And so the gift went on ahead, while he remained in camp that night.

content: 23 That same night he arose, and taking his two wives, his two maidservants, and his eleven children, he crossed the ford of the Jabbok.
content_old: 23 That same night he arose, and taking his two wives, his two maidservants, and his eleven children, he crossed the ford of the Jabbok.

content: 24 After taking them across the stream, he sent across all his possessions.
content_old: 24 After taking them across the stream, he sent across all his possessions.

content: 25 Jacob was left alone. And a man wrestled with him until the break of dawn.
content_old: 25 Jacob was left alone. And a man wrestled with him until the break of dawn.

content: 26 When he saw that he had not prevailed against him, he wrenched Jacob’s hip at its socket, so that the socket of his hip was strained as he wrestled with him.
content_old: 26 When he saw that he had not prevailed against him, he wrenched Jacob’s hip at its socket, so that the socket of his hip was strained as he wrestled with him.

content: 27 Then he said, “Let me go, for dawn is breaking.” But he answered, “I will not let you go, unless you bless me.”
content_old: 27 Then he said, “Let me go, for dawn is breaking.” But he answered, “I will not let you go, unless you bless me.”

content: 28 Said the other, “What is your name?” He replied, “Jacob.”
content_old: 28 Said the other, “What is your name?” He replied, “Jacob.”

content: 29 Said he, “Your name shall no longer be Jacob, but Israel, for you have striven with beings divine and human, and have prevailed.”
content_old: 29 Said he, “Your name shall no longer be Jacob, but Israel, for you have striven with beings divine and human, and have prevailed.”

content: 30 Jacob asked, “Pray tell me your name.” But he said, “You must not ask my name!” And he took leave of him there.
content_old: 30 Jacob asked, “Pray tell me your name.” But he said, “You must not ask my name!” And he took leave of him there.

content: 31 So Jacob named the place Peniel, meaning, “I have seen a divine being face to face, yet my life has been preserved.”
content_old: 31 So Jacob named the place Peniel, meaning, “I have seen a divine being face to face, yet my life has been preserved.”

content: 32 The sun rose upon him as he passed Penuel, limping on his hip.
content_old: 32 The sun rose upon him as he passed Penuel, limping on his hip.

content: 1 Looking up, Jacob saw Esau coming, accompanied by four hundred men. He divided the children among Leah, Rachel, and the two maids,
content_old: 1 Looking up, Jacob saw Esau coming, accompanied by four hundred men. He divided the children among Leah, Rachel, and the two maids,

content: 2 putting the maids and their children first, Leah and her children next, and Rachel and Joseph last.
content_old: 2 putting the maids and their children first, Leah and her children next, and Rachel and Joseph last.

content: 3 He himself went on ahead and bowed low to the ground seven times until he was near his brother.
content_old: 3 He himself went on ahead and bowed low to the ground seven times until he was near his brother.

content: 4 Esau ran to greet him. He embraced him and, falling on his neck, he kissed him; and they wept.
content_old: 4 Esau ran to greet him. He embraced him and, falling on his neck, he kissed him; and they wept.

content: 5 Looking about, he saw the women and the children. “Who,” he asked, “are these with you?” He answered, “The children with whom God has favored your servant.”
content_old: 5 Looking about, he saw the women and the children. “Who,” he asked, “are these with you?” He answered, “The children with whom God has favored your servant.”

content: 6 Then the maids, with their children, came forward and bowed low;
content_old: 6 Then the maids, with their children, came forward and bowed low;

content: 7 next Leah, with her children, came forward and bowed low; and last, Joseph and Rachel came forward and bowed low;
content_old: 7 next Leah, with her children, came forward and bowed low; and last, Joseph and Rachel came forward and bowed low;

content: 8 And he asked, “What do you mean by all this company which I have met?” He answered, “To gain my lord’s favor.”
content_old: 8 And he asked, “What do you mean by all this company which I have met?” He answered, “To gain my lord’s favor.”

content: 9 Esau said, “I have enough, my brother; let what you have remain yours.”
content_old: 9 Esau said, “I have enough, my brother; let what you have remain yours.”

content: 10 But Jacob said, “No, I pray you; if you would do me this favor, accept from me this gift; for to see your face is like seeing the face of God, and you have received me favorably.
content_old: 10 But Jacob said, “No, I pray you; if you would do me this favor, accept from me this gift; for to see your face is like seeing the face of God, and you have received me favorably.

content: 11 Please accept my present which has been brought to you, for God has favored me and I have plenty.” And when he urged him, he accepted.
content_old: 11 Please accept my present which has been brought to you, for God has favored me and I have plenty.” And when he urged him, he accepted.

content: 12 And Esau said, “Let us start on our journey, and I will proceed at your pace.”
content_old: 12 And Esau said, “Let us start on our journey, and I will proceed at your pace.”

content: 13 But he said to him, “My lord knows that the children are frail and that the flocks and herds, which are nursing, are a care to me; if they are driven hard a single day, all the flocks will die.
content_old: 13 But he said to him, “My lord knows that the children are frail and that the flocks and herds, which are nursing, are a care to me; if they are driven hard a single day, all the flocks will die.

content: 14 Let my lord go on ahead of his servant, while I travel slowly, at the pace of the cattle before me and at the pace of the children, until I come to my lord in Seir.”
content_old: 14 Let my lord go on ahead of his servant, while I travel slowly, at the pace of the cattle before me and at the pace of the children, until I come to my lord in Seir.”

content: 15 Then Esau said, “Let me assign to you some of the men who are with me.” But he said, “Oh no, my lord is too kind to me!”
content_old: 15 Then Esau said, “Let me assign to you some of the men who are with me.” But he said, “Oh no, my lord is too kind to me!”

content: 16 So Esau started back that day on his way to Seir.
content_old: 16 So Esau started back that day on his way to Seir.

content: 17 But Jacob journeyed on to Succoth, and built a house for himself and made stalls for his cattle; that is why the place was called Succoth.
content_old: 17 But Jacob journeyed on to Succoth, and built a house for himself and made stalls for his cattle; that is why the place was called Succoth.

content: 18 Jacob arrived safe in the city of Shechem which is in the land of Canaan—having come thus from Paddan-aram—and he encamped before the city.
content_old: 18 Jacob arrived safe in the city of Shechem which is in the land of Canaan—having come thus from Paddan-aram—and he encamped before the city.

content: 19 The parcel of land where he pitched his tent he purchased from the children of Hamor, Shechem’s father, for a hundred kesitahs.
content_old: 19 The parcel of land where he pitched his tent he purchased from the children of Hamor, Shechem’s father, for a hundred kesitahs.

content: 1 Now Dinah, the daughter whom Leah had borne to Jacob, went out to visit the daughters of the land.
content_old: 1 Now Dinah, the daughter whom Leah had borne to Jacob, went out to visit the daughters of the land.

content: 2 Shechem son of Hamor the Hivite, chief of the country, saw her, and took her and lay with her by force.
content_old: 2 Shechem son of Hamor the Hivite, chief of the country, saw her, and took her and lay with her by force.

content: 3 Being strongly drawn to Dinah daughter of Jacob, and in love with the maiden, he spoke to the maiden tenderly.
content_old: 3 Being strongly drawn to Dinah daughter of Jacob, and in love with the maiden, he spoke to the maiden tenderly.

content: 4 So Shechem said to his father Hamor, “Get me this girl as a wife.”
content_old: 4 So Shechem said to his father Hamor, “Get me this girl as a wife.”

content: 5 Jacob heard that he had defiled his daughter Dinah; but since his sons were in the field with his cattle, Jacob kept silent until they came home.
content_old: 5 Jacob heard that he had defiled his daughter Dinah; but since his sons were in the field with his cattle, Jacob kept silent until they came home.

content: 6 Then Shechem’s father Hamor came out to Jacob to speak to him.
content_old: 6 Then Shechem’s father Hamor came out to Jacob to speak to him.

content: 7 Meanwhile Jacob’s sons, having heard the news, came in from the field. The men were distressed and very angry, because he had committed an outrage in Israel by lying with Jacob’s daughter—a thing not to be done.
content_old: 7 Meanwhile Jacob’s sons, having heard the news, came in from the field. The men were distressed and very angry, because he had committed an outrage in Israel by lying with Jacob’s daughter—a thing not to be done.

content: 8 And Hamor spoke with them, saying, “My son Shechem longs for your daughter. Please give her to him in marriage.
content_old: 8 And Hamor spoke with them, saying, “My son Shechem longs for your daughter. Please give her to him in marriage.

content: 9 Intermarry with us: give your daughters to us, and take our daughters for yourselves:
content_old: 9 Intermarry with us: give your daughters to us, and take our daughters for yourselves:

content: 10 You will dwell among us, and the land will be open before you; settle, move about, and acquire holdings in it.”
content_old: 10 You will dwell among us, and the land will be open before you; settle, move about, and acquire holdings in it.”

content: 11 Then Shechem said to her father and brothers, “Do me this favor, and I will pay whatever you tell me.
content_old: 11 Then Shechem said to her father and brothers, “Do me this favor, and I will pay whatever you tell me.

content: 12 Ask of me a bride-price ever so high, as well as gifts, and I will pay what you tell me; only give me the maiden for a wife.”
content_old: 12 Ask of me a bride-price ever so high, as well as gifts, and I will pay what you tell me; only give me the maiden for a wife.”

content: 13 Jacob’s sons answered Shechem and his father Hamor—speaking with guile because he had defiled their sister Dinah—
content_old: 13 Jacob’s sons answered Shechem and his father Hamor—speaking with guile because he had defiled their sister Dinah—

content: 14 and said to them, “We cannot do this thing, to give our sister to a man who is uncircumcised, for that is a disgrace among us.
content_old: 14 and said to them, “We cannot do this thing, to give our sister to a man who is uncircumcised, for that is a disgrace among us.

content: 15 Only on this condition will we agree with you; that you will become like us in that every male among you is circumcised.
content_old: 15 Only on this condition will we agree with you; that you will become like us in that every male among you is circumcised.

content: 16 Then we will give our daughters to you and take your daughters to ourselves; and we will dwell among you and become as one kindred.
content_old: 16 Then we will give our daughters to you and take your daughters to ourselves; and we will dwell among you and become as one kindred.

content: 17 But if you will not listen to us and become circumcised, we will take our daughter and go.”
content_old: 17 But if you will not listen to us and become circumcised, we will take our daughter and go.”

content: 18 Their words pleased Hamor and Hamor’s son Shechem.
content_old: 18 Their words pleased Hamor and Hamor’s son Shechem.

content: 19 And the youth lost no time in doing the thing, for he wanted Jacob’s daughter. Now he was the most respected in his father’s house.
content_old: 19 And the youth lost no time in doing the thing, for he wanted Jacob’s daughter. Now he was the most respected in his father’s house.

content: 20 So Hamor and his son Shechem went to the public place of their town and spoke to their fellow townsmen, saying,
content_old: 20 So Hamor and his son Shechem went to the public place of their town and spoke to their fellow townsmen, saying,

content: 21 “These people are our friends; let them settle in the land and move about in it, for the land is large enough for them; we will take their daughters to ourselves as wives and give our daughters to them.
content_old: 21 “These people are our friends; let them settle in the land and move about in it, for the land is large enough for them; we will take their daughters to ourselves as wives and give our daughters to them.

content: 22 But only on this condition will the men agree with us to dwell among us and be as one kindred: that all our males become circumcised as they are circumcised.
content_old: 22 But only on this condition will the men agree with us to dwell among us and be as one kindred: that all our males become circumcised as they are circumcised.

content: 23 Their cattle and substance and all their beasts will be ours, if we only agree to their terms, so that they will settle among us.”
content_old: 23 Their cattle and substance and all their beasts will be ours, if we only agree to their terms, so that they will settle among us.”

content: 24 All who went out of the gate of his town heeded Hamor and his son Shechem, and all males, all those who went out of the gate of his town, were circumcised.
content_old: 24 All who went out of the gate of his town heeded Hamor and his son Shechem, and all males, all those who went out of the gate of his town, were circumcised.

content: 25 On the third day, when they were in pain, Simeon and Levi, two of Jacob’s sons, brothers of Dinah, took each his sword, came upon the city unmolested, and slew all the males.
content_old: 25 On the third day, when they were in pain, Simeon and Levi, two of Jacob’s sons, brothers of Dinah, took each his sword, came upon the city unmolested, and slew all the males.

content: 26 They put Hamor and his son Shechem to the sword, took Dinah out of Shechem’s house, and went away.
content_old: 26 They put Hamor and his son Shechem to the sword, took Dinah out of Shechem’s house, and went away.

content: 27 The other sons of Jacob came upon the slain and plundered the town, because their sister had been defiled.
content_old: 27 The other sons of Jacob came upon the slain and plundered the town, because their sister had been defiled.

content: 28 They seized their flocks and herds and asses, all that was inside the town and outside;
content_old: 28 They seized their flocks and herds and asses, all that was inside the town and outside;

content: 29 all their wealth, all their children, and their wives, all that was in the houses, they took as captives and booty.
content_old: 29 all their wealth, all their children, and their wives, all that was in the houses, they took as captives and booty.

content: 30 Jacob said to Simeon and Levi, “You have brought trouble on me, making me odious among the inhabitants of the land, the Canaanites and the Perizzites; my men are few in number, so that if they unite against me and attack me, I and my house will be destroyed.”
content_old: 30 Jacob said to Simeon and Levi, “You have brought trouble on me, making me odious among the inhabitants of the land, the Canaanites and the Perizzites; my men are few in number, so that if they unite against me and attack me, I and my house will be destroyed.”

content: 1 God said to Jacob, “Arise, go up to Bethel and remain there; and build an altar there to the God who appeared to you when you were fleeing from your brother Esau.”
content_old: 1 God said to Jacob, “Arise, go up to Bethel and remain there; and build an altar there to the God who appeared to you when you were fleeing from your brother Esau.”

content: 2 So Jacob said to his household and to all who were with him, “Rid yourselves of the alien gods in your midst, purify yourselves, and change your clothes.
content_old: 2 So Jacob said to his household and to all who were with him, “Rid yourselves of the alien gods in your midst, purify yourselves, and change your clothes.

content: 3 Come, let us go up to Bethel, and I will build an altar there to the God who answered me when I was in distress and who has been with me wherever I have gone.”
content_old: 3 Come, let us go up to Bethel, and I will build an altar there to the God who answered me when I was in distress and who has been with me wherever I have gone.”

content: 4 They gave to Jacob all the alien gods that they had, and the rings that were in their ears, and Jacob buried them under the terebinth that was near Shechem.
content_old: 4 They gave to Jacob all the alien gods that they had, and the rings that were in their ears, and Jacob buried them under the terebinth that was near Shechem.

content: 5 As they set out, a terror from God fell on the cities round about, so that they did not pursue the sons of Jacob.
content_old: 5 As they set out, a terror from God fell on the cities round about, so that they did not pursue the sons of Jacob.

content: 6 Thus Jacob came to Luz—that is, Bethel—in the land of Canaan, he and all the people who were with him.
content_old: 6 Thus Jacob came to Luz—that is, Bethel—in the land of Canaan, he and all the people who were with him.

content: 7 There he built an altar and named the site El-bethel, for it was there that God had revealed Himself to him when he was fleeing from his brother.
content_old: 7 There he built an altar and named the site El-bethel, for it was there that God had revealed Himself to him when he was fleeing from his brother.

content: 8 Deborah, Rebekah’s nurse, died, and was buried under the oak below Bethel; so it was named Allon-bacuth.
content_old: 8 Deborah, Rebekah’s nurse, died, and was buried under the oak below Bethel; so it was named Allon-bacuth.

content: 9 God appeared again to Jacob on his arrival from Paddan-aram, and He blessed him.
content_old: 9 God appeared again to Jacob on his arrival from Paddan-aram, and He blessed him.

content: 10 God said to him, “You whose name is Jacob, You shall be called Jacob no more, But Israel shall be your name.” Thus He named him Israel.
content_old: 10 God said to him, “You whose name is Jacob, You shall be called Jacob no more, But Israel shall be your name.” Thus He named him Israel.

content: 11 And God said to him, “I am El Shaddai. Be fertile and increase; A nation, yea an assembly of nations, Shall descend from you. Kings shall issue from your loins.
content_old: 11 And God said to him, “I am El Shaddai. Be fertile and increase; A nation, yea an assembly of nations, Shall descend from you. Kings shall issue from your loins.

content: 12 The land that I assigned to Abraham and Isaac I assign to you; And to your offspring to come Will I assign the land.”
content_old: 12 The land that I assigned to Abraham and Isaac I assign to you; And to your offspring to come Will I assign the land.”

content: 13 God parted from him at the spot where He had spoken to him;
content_old: 13 God parted from him at the spot where He had spoken to him;

content: 14 and Jacob set up a pillar at the site where He had spoken to him, a pillar of stone, and he offered a libation on it and poured oil upon it.
content_old: 14 and Jacob set up a pillar at the site where He had spoken to him, a pillar of stone, and he offered a libation on it and poured oil upon it.

content: 15 Jacob gave the site, where God had spoken to him, the name of Bethel.
content_old: 15 Jacob gave the site, where God had spoken to him, the name of Bethel.

content: 16 They set out from Bethel; but when they were still some distance short of Ephrath, Rachel was in childbirth, and she had hard labor.
content_old: 16 They set out from Bethel; but when they were still some distance short of Ephrath, Rachel was in childbirth, and she had hard labor.

content: 17 When her labor was at its hardest, the midwife said to her, “Have no fear, for it is another boy for you.”
content_old: 17 When her labor was at its hardest, the midwife said to her, “Have no fear, for it is another boy for you.”

content: 18 But as she breathed her last—for she was dying—she named him Ben-oni; but his father called him Benjamin.
content_old: 18 But as she breathed her last—for she was dying—she named him Ben-oni; but his father called him Benjamin.

content: 19 Thus Rachel died. She was buried on the road to Ephrath—now Bethlehem.
content_old: 19 Thus Rachel died. She was buried on the road to Ephrath—now Bethlehem.

content: 20 Over her grave Jacob set up a pillar; it is the pillar at Rachel’s grave to this day.
content_old: 20 Over her grave Jacob set up a pillar; it is the pillar at Rachel’s grave to this day.

content: 21 Israel journeyed on, and pitched his tent beyond Migdal-eder.
content_old: 21 Israel journeyed on, and pitched his tent beyond Migdal-eder.

content: 22 While Israel stayed in that land, Reuben went and lay with Bilhah, his father’s concubine; and Israel found out. Now the sons of Jacob were twelve in number.
content_old: 22 While Israel stayed in that land, Reuben went and lay with Bilhah, his father’s concubine; and Israel found out. Now the sons of Jacob were twelve in number.

content: 23 The sons of Leah: Reuben—Jacob’s first-born—Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, and Zebulun.
content_old: 23 The sons of Leah: Reuben—Jacob’s first-born—Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, and Zebulun.

content: 24 The sons of Rachel: Joseph and Benjamin.
content_old: 24 The sons of Rachel: Joseph and Benjamin.

content: 25 The sons of Bilhah, Rachel’s maid: Dan and Naphtali.
content_old: 25 The sons of Bilhah, Rachel’s maid: Dan and Naphtali.

content: 26 And the sons of Zilpah, Leah’s maid: Gad and Asher. These are the sons of Jacob who were born to him in Paddan-aram.
content_old: 26 And the sons of Zilpah, Leah’s maid: Gad and Asher. These are the sons of Jacob who were born to him in Paddan-aram.

content: 27 And Jacob came to his father Isaac at Mamre, at Kiriath-arba—now Hebron—where Abraham and Isaac had sojourned.
content_old: 27 And Jacob came to his father Isaac at Mamre, at Kiriath-arba—now Hebron—where Abraham and Isaac had sojourned.

content: 28 Isaac was a hundred and eighty years old
content_old: 28 Isaac was a hundred and eighty years old

content: 1 This is the line of Esau—that is, Edom.
content_old: 1 This is the line of Esau—that is, Edom.

content: 2 Esau took his wives from among the Canaanite women—Adah daughter of Elon the Hittite, and Oholibamah daughter of Anah daughter of Zibeon the Hivite—
content_old: 2 Esau took his wives from among the Canaanite women—Adah daughter of Elon the Hittite, and Oholibamah daughter of Anah daughter of Zibeon the Hivite—

content: 3 and also Basemath daughter of Ishmael and sister of Nebaioth.
content_old: 3 and also Basemath daughter of Ishmael and sister of Nebaioth.

content: 4 Adah bore to Esau Eliphaz; Basemath bore Reuel;
content_old: 4 Adah bore to Esau Eliphaz; Basemath bore Reuel;

content: 5 and Oholibamah bore Jeush, Jalam, and Korah. Those were the sons of Esau, who were born to him in the land of Canaan.
content_old: 5 and Oholibamah bore Jeush, Jalam, and Korah. Those were the sons of Esau, who were born to him in the land of Canaan.

content: 6 Esau took his wives, his sons and daughters, and all the members of his household, his cattle and all his livestock, and all the property that he had acquired in the land of Canaan, and went to another land because of his brother Jacob.
content_old: 6 Esau took his wives, his sons and daughters, and all the members of his household, his cattle and all his livestock, and all the property that he had acquired in the land of Canaan, and went to another land because of his brother Jacob.

content: 7 For their possessions were too many for them to dwell together, and the land where they sojourned could not support them because of their livestock.
content_old: 7 For their possessions were too many for them to dwell together, and the land where they sojourned could not support them because of their livestock.

content: 8 So Esau settled in the hill country of Seir—Esau being Edom.
content_old: 8 So Esau settled in the hill country of Seir—Esau being Edom.

content: 9 This, then, is the line of Esau, the ancestor of the Edomites, in the hill country of Seir.
content_old: 9 This, then, is the line of Esau, the ancestor of the Edomites, in the hill country of Seir.

content: 10 These are the names of Esau’s sons: Eliphaz, the son of Esau’s wife Adah; Reuel, the son of Esau’s wife Basemath.
content_old: 10 These are the names of Esau’s sons: Eliphaz, the son of Esau’s wife Adah; Reuel, the son of Esau’s wife Basemath.

content: 11 The sons of Eliphaz were Teman, Omar, Zepho, Gatam, and Kenaz.
content_old: 11 The sons of Eliphaz were Teman, Omar, Zepho, Gatam, and Kenaz.

content: 12 Timna was a concubine of Esau’s son Eliphaz; she bore Amalek to Eliphaz. Those were the descendants of Esau’s wife Adah.
content_old: 12 Timna was a concubine of Esau’s son Eliphaz; she bore Amalek to Eliphaz. Those were the descendants of Esau’s wife Adah.

content: 13 And these were the sons of Reuel: Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah. Those were the descendants of Esau’s wife Basemath.
content_old: 13 And these were the sons of Reuel: Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah. Those were the descendants of Esau’s wife Basemath.

content: 14 And these were the sons of Esau’s wife Oholibamah, daughter of Anah daughter of Zibeon: she bore to Esau Jeush, Jalam, and Korah.
content_old: 14 And these were the sons of Esau’s wife Oholibamah, daughter of Anah daughter of Zibeon: she bore to Esau Jeush, Jalam, and Korah.

content: 15 These are the clans of the children of Esau. The descendants of Esau’s first-born Eliphaz: the clans Teman, Omar, Zepho, Kenaz,
content_old: 15 These are the clans of the children of Esau. The descendants of Esau’s first-born Eliphaz: the clans Teman, Omar, Zepho, Kenaz,

content: 16 Korah, Gatam, and Amalek; these are the clans of Eliphaz in the land of Edom. Those are the descendants of Adah.
content_old: 16 Korah, Gatam, and Amalek; these are the clans of Eliphaz in the land of Edom. Those are the descendants of Adah.

content: 17 And these are the descendants of Esau’s son Reuel: the clans Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah; these are the clans of Reuel in the land of Edom. Those are the descendants of Esau’s wife Basemath.
content_old: 17 And these are the descendants of Esau’s son Reuel: the clans Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah; these are the clans of Reuel in the land of Edom. Those are the descendants of Esau’s wife Basemath.

content: 18 And these are the descendants of Esau’s wife Oholibamah: the clans Jeush, Jalam, and Korah; these are the clans of Esau’s wife Oholibamah, the daughter of Anah.
content_old: 18 And these are the descendants of Esau’s wife Oholibamah: the clans Jeush, Jalam, and Korah; these are the clans of Esau’s wife Oholibamah, the daughter of Anah.

content: 19 Those were the sons of Esau—that is, Edom—and those are their clans.
content_old: 19 Those were the sons of Esau—that is, Edom—and those are their clans.

content: 20 These were the sons of Seir the Horite, who were settled in the land: Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Anah,
content_old: 20 These were the sons of Seir the Horite, who were settled in the land: Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Anah,

content: 21 Dishon, Ezer, and Dishan. Those are the clans of the Horites, the descendants of Seir, in the land of Edom.
content_old: 21 Dishon, Ezer, and Dishan. Those are the clans of the Horites, the descendants of Seir, in the land of Edom.

content: 22 The sons of Lotan were Hori and Hemam; and Lotan’s sister was Timna.
content_old: 22 The sons of Lotan were Hori and Hemam; and Lotan’s sister was Timna.

content: 23 The sons of Shobal were these: Alvan, Manahath, Ebal, Shepho, and Onam.
content_old: 23 The sons of Shobal were these: Alvan, Manahath, Ebal, Shepho, and Onam.

content: 24 The sons of Zibeon were these: Aiah and Anah—that was the Anah who discovered the hot springs in the wilderness while pasturing the asses of his father Zibeon.
content_old: 24 The sons of Zibeon were these: Aiah and Anah—that was the Anah who discovered the hot springs in the wilderness while pasturing the asses of his father Zibeon.

content: 25 The children of Anah were these: Dishon and Anah’s daughter Oholibamah.
content_old: 25 The children of Anah were these: Dishon and Anah’s daughter Oholibamah.

content: 26 The sons of Dishon were these: Hemdan, Eshban, Ithran, and Cheran.
content_old: 26 The sons of Dishon were these: Hemdan, Eshban, Ithran, and Cheran.

content: 27 The sons of Ezer were these: Bilhan, Zaavan, and Akan.
content_old: 27 The sons of Ezer were these: Bilhan, Zaavan, and Akan.

content: 28 And the sons of Dishan were these: Uz and Aran.
content_old: 28 And the sons of Dishan were these: Uz and Aran.

content: 29 These are the clans of the Horites: the clans Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Anah,
content_old: 29 These are the clans of the Horites: the clans Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Anah,

content: 30 Dishon, Ezer, and Dishan. Those are the clans of the Horites, clan by clan, in the land of Seir.
content_old: 30 Dishon, Ezer, and Dishan. Those are the clans of the Horites, clan by clan, in the land of Seir.

content: 31 These are the kings who reigned in the land of Edom before any king reigned over the Israelites.
content_old: 31 These are the kings who reigned in the land of Edom before any king reigned over the Israelites.

content: 32 Bela son of Beor reigned in Edom, and the name of his city was Dinhabah.
content_old: 32 Bela son of Beor reigned in Edom, and the name of his city was Dinhabah.

content: 33 When Bela died, Jobab son of Zerah, from Bozrah, succeeded him as king.
content_old: 33 When Bela died, Jobab son of Zerah, from Bozrah, succeeded him as king.

content: 34 When Jobab died, Husham of the land of the Temanites succeeded him as king.
content_old: 34 When Jobab died, Husham of the land of the Temanites succeeded him as king.

content: 35 When Husham died, Hadad son of Bedad, who defeated the Midianites in the country of Moab, succeeded him as king; the name of his city was Avith.
content_old: 35 When Husham died, Hadad son of Bedad, who defeated the Midianites in the country of Moab, succeeded him as king; the name of his city was Avith.

content: 36 When Hadad died, Samlah of Masrekah succeeded him as king.
content_old: 36 When Hadad died, Samlah of Masrekah succeeded him as king.

content: 37 When Samlah died, Saul of Rehoboth-on-the-river succeeded him as king.
content_old: 37 When Samlah died, Saul of Rehoboth-on-the-river succeeded him as king.

content: 38 When Saul died, Baal-hanan son of Achbor succeeded him as king.
content_old: 38 When Saul died, Baal-hanan son of Achbor succeeded him as king.

content: 39 And when Baal-hanan son of Achbor died, Hadar succeeded him as king; the name of his city was Pau, and his wife’s name was Mehetabel daughter of Matred daughter of Me-zahab.
content_old: 39 And when Baal-hanan son of Achbor died, Hadar succeeded him as king; the name of his city was Pau, and his wife’s name was Mehetabel daughter of Matred daughter of Me-zahab.

content: 40 These are the names of the clans of Esau, each with its families and locality, name by name: the clans Timna, Alvah, Jetheth,
content_old: 40 These are the names of the clans of Esau, each with its families and locality, name by name: the clans Timna, Alvah, Jetheth,

content: 41 Oholibamah, Elah, Pinon,
content_old: 41 Oholibamah, Elah, Pinon,

content: 42 Kenaz, Teman, Mibzar,

content: 1 Now Jacob was settled in the land where his father had sojourned, the land of Canaan.
content_old: 1 Now Jacob was settled in the land where his father had sojourned, the land of Canaan.

content: 2 This, then, is the line of Jacob: At seventeen years of age, Joseph tended the flocks with his brothers, as a helper to the sons of his father’s wives Bilhah and Zilpah. And Joseph brought bad reports of them to their father.
content_old: 2 This, then, is the line of Jacob: At seventeen years of age, Joseph tended the flocks with his brothers, as a helper to the sons of his father’s wives Bilhah and Zilpah. And Joseph brought bad reports of them to their father.

content: 3 Now Israel loved Joseph best of all his sons, for he was the child of his old age; and he had made him an ornamented tunic.
content_old: 3 Now Israel loved Joseph best of all his sons, for he was the child of his old age; and he had made him an ornamented tunic.

content: 4 And when his brothers saw that their father loved him more than any of his brothers, they hated him so that they could not speak a friendly word to him.
content_old: 4 And when his brothers saw that their father loved him more than any of his brothers, they hated him so that they could not speak a friendly word to him.

content: 5 Once Joseph had a dream which he told to his brothers; and they hated him even more.
content_old: 5 Once Joseph had a dream which he told to his brothers; and they hated him even more.

content: 6 He said to them, “Hear this dream which I have dreamed:
content_old: 6 He said to them, “Hear this dream which I have dreamed:

content: 7 There we were binding sheaves in the field, when suddenly my sheaf stood up and remained upright; then your sheaves gathered around and bowed low to my sheaf.”
content_old: 7 There we were binding sheaves in the field, when suddenly my sheaf stood up and remained upright; then your sheaves gathered around and bowed low to my sheaf.”

content: 8 His brothers answered, “Do you mean to reign over us? Do you mean to rule over us?” And they hated him even more for his talk about his dreams.
content_old: 8 His brothers answered, “Do you mean to reign over us? Do you mean to rule over us?” And they hated him even more for his talk about his dreams.

content: 9 He dreamed another dream and told it to his brothers, saying, “Look, I have had another dream: And this time, the sun, the moon, and eleven stars were bowing down to me.”
content_old: 9 He dreamed another dream and told it to his brothers, saying, “Look, I have had another dream: And this time, the sun, the moon, and eleven stars were bowing down to me.”

content: 10 And when he told it to his father and brothers, his father berated him. “What,” he said to him, “is this dream you have dreamed? Are we to come, I and your mother and your brothers, and bow low to you to the ground?
content_old: 10 And when he told it to his father and brothers, his father berated him. “What,” he said to him, “is this dream you have dreamed? Are we to come, I and your mother and your brothers, and bow low to you to the ground?

content: 11 So his brothers were wrought up at him, and his father kept the matter in mind.
content_old: 11 So his brothers were wrought up at him, and his father kept the matter in mind.

content: 12 One time, when his brothers had gone to pasture their father’s flock at Shechem,
content_old: 12 One time, when his brothers had gone to pasture their father’s flock at Shechem,

content: 13 Israel said to Joseph, “Your brothers are pasturing at Shechem. Come, I will send you to them.” He answered, “I am ready.”
content_old: 13 Israel said to Joseph, “Your brothers are pasturing at Shechem. Come, I will send you to them.” He answered, “I am ready.”

content: 14 And he said to him, “Go and see how your brothers are and how the flocks are faring, and bring me back word.” So he sent him from the valley of Hebron. When he reached Shechem,
content_old: 14 And he said to him, “Go and see how your brothers are and how the flocks are faring, and bring me back word.” So he sent him from the valley of Hebron. When he reached Shechem,

content: 15 a man came upon him wandering in the fields. The man asked him, “What are you looking for?”
content_old: 15 a man came upon him wandering in the fields. The man asked him, “What are you looking for?”

content: 16 He answered, “I am looking for my brothers. Could you tell me where they are pasturing?”
content_old: 16 He answered, “I am looking for my brothers. Could you tell me where they are pasturing?”

content: 17 The man said, “They have gone from here, for I heard them say: Let us go to Dothan.” So Joseph followed his brothers and found them at Dothan.
content_old: 17 The man said, “They have gone from here, for I heard them say: Let us go to Dothan.” So Joseph followed his brothers and found them at Dothan.

content: 18 They saw him from afar, and before he came close to them they conspired to kill him.
content_old: 18 They saw him from afar, and before he came close to them they conspired to kill him.

content: 19 They said to one another, “Here comes that dreamer!
content_old: 19 They said to one another, “Here comes that dreamer!

content: 20 Come now, let us kill him and throw him into one of the pits; and we can say, ‘A savage beast devoured him.’ We shall see what comes of his dreams!”
content_old: 20 Come now, let us kill him and throw him into one of the pits; and we can say, ‘A savage beast devoured him.’ We shall see what comes of his dreams!”

content: 21 But when Reuben heard it, he tried to save him from them. He said, “Let us not take his life.”
content_old: 21 But when Reuben heard it, he tried to save him from them. He said, “Let us not take his life.”

content: 22 And Reuben went on, “Shed no blood! Cast him into that pit out in the wilderness, but do not touch him yourselves”—intending to save him from them and restore him to his father.
content_old: 22 And Reuben went on, “Shed no blood! Cast him into that pit out in the wilderness, but do not touch him yourselves”—intending to save him from them and restore him to his father.

content: 23 When Joseph came up to his brothers, they stripped Joseph of his tunic, the ornamented tunic that he was wearing,
content_old: 23 When Joseph came up to his brothers, they stripped Joseph of his tunic, the ornamented tunic that he was wearing,

content: 24 and took him and cast him into the pit. The pit was empty; there was no water in it.
content_old: 24 and took him and cast him into the pit. The pit was empty; there was no water in it.

content: 25 Then they sat down to a meal. Looking up, they saw a caravan of Ishmaelites coming from Gilead, their camels bearing gum, balm, and ladanum to be taken to Egypt.
content_old: 25 Then they sat down to a meal. Looking up, they saw a caravan of Ishmaelites coming from Gilead, their camels bearing gum, balm, and ladanum to be taken to Egypt.

content: 26 Then Judah said to his brothers, “What do we gain by killing our brother and covering up his blood?
content_old: 26 Then Judah said to his brothers, “What do we gain by killing our brother and covering up his blood?

content: 27 Come, let us sell him to the Ishmaelites, but let us not do away with him ourselves. After all, he is our brother, our own flesh.” His brothers agreed.
content_old: 27 Come, let us sell him to the Ishmaelites, but let us not do away with him ourselves. After all, he is our brother, our own flesh.” His brothers agreed.

content: 28 When Midianite traders passed by, they pulled Joseph up out of the pit. They sold Joseph for twenty pieces of silver to the Ishmaelites, who brought Joseph to Egypt.
content_old: 28 When Midianite traders passed by, they pulled Joseph up out of the pit. They sold Joseph for twenty pieces of silver to the Ishmaelites, who brought Joseph to Egypt.

content: 29 When Reuben returned to the pit and saw that Joseph was not in the pit, he rent his clothes.
content_old: 29 When Reuben returned to the pit and saw that Joseph was not in the pit, he rent his clothes.

content: 30 Returning to his brothers, he said, “The boy is gone! Now, what am I to do?”
content_old: 30 Returning to his brothers, he said, “The boy is gone! Now, what am I to do?”

content: 31 Then they took Joseph’s tunic, slaughtered a kid, and dipped the tunic in the blood.
content_old: 31 Then they took Joseph’s tunic, slaughtered a kid, and dipped the tunic in the blood.

content: 32 They had the ornamented tunic taken to their father, and they said, “We found this. Please examine it; is it your son’s tunic or not?”
content_old: 32 They had the ornamented tunic taken to their father, and they said, “We found this. Please examine it; is it your son’s tunic or not?”

content: 33 He recognized it, and said, “My son’s tunic! A savage beast devoured him! Joseph was torn by a beast!”
content_old: 33 He recognized it, and said, “My son’s tunic! A savage beast devoured him! Joseph was torn by a beast!”

content: 34 Jacob rent his clothes, put sackcloth on his loins, and observed mourning for his son many days.
content_old: 34 Jacob rent his clothes, put sackcloth on his loins, and observed mourning for his son many days.

content: 35 All his sons and daughters sought to comfort him; but he refused to be comforted, saying, “No, I will go down mourning to my son in Sheol.” Thus his father bewailed him.
content_old: 35 All his sons and daughters sought to comfort him; but he refused to be comforted, saying, “No, I will go down mourning to my son in Sheol.” Thus his father bewailed him.

content: 1 About that time Judah left his brothers and camped near a certain Adullamite whose name was Hirah.
content_old: 1 About that time Judah left his brothers and camped near a certain Adullamite whose name was Hirah.

content: 2 There Judah saw the daughter of a certain Canaanite whose name was Shua, and he married her and cohabited with her.
content_old: 2 There Judah saw the daughter of a certain Canaanite whose name was Shua, and he married her and cohabited with her.

content: 3 She conceived and bore a son, and he named him Er.
content_old: 3 She conceived and bore a son, and he named him Er.

content: 4 She conceived again and bore a son, and named him Onan.
content_old: 4 She conceived again and bore a son, and named him Onan.

content: 5 Once again she bore a son, and named him Shelah; he was at Chezib when she bore him.
content_old: 5 Once again she bore a son, and named him Shelah; he was at Chezib when she bore him.

content: 6 Judah got a wife for Er his first-born; her name was Tamar.
content_old: 6 Judah got a wife for Er his first-born; her name was Tamar.

content: 7 But Er, Judah’s first-born, was displeasing to the LORD, and the LORD took his life.
content_old: 7 But Er, Judah’s first-born, was displeasing to the LORD, and the LORD took his life.

content: 8 Then Judah said to Onan, “Join with your brother’s wife and do your duty by her as a brother-in-law, and provide offspring for your brother.”
content_old: 8 Then Judah said to Onan, “Join with your brother’s wife and do your duty by her as a brother-in-law, and provide offspring for your brother.”

content: 9 But Onan, knowing that the seed would not count as his, let it go to waste whenever he joined with his brother’s wife, so as not to provide offspring for his brother.
content_old: 9 But Onan, knowing that the seed would not count as his, let it go to waste whenever he joined with his brother’s wife, so as not to provide offspring for his brother.

content: 10 What he did was displeasing to the LORD, and He took his life also.
content_old: 10 What he did was displeasing to the LORD, and He took his life also.

content: 11 Then Judah said to his daughter-in-law Tamar, “Stay as a widow in your father’s house until my son Shelah grows up”—for he thought, “He too might die like his brothers.” So Tamar went to live in her father’s house.
content_old: 11 Then Judah said to his daughter-in-law Tamar, “Stay as a widow in your father’s house until my son Shelah grows up”—for he thought, “He too might die like his brothers.” So Tamar went to live in her father’s house.

content: 12 A long time afterward, Shua’s daughter, the wife of Judah, died. When his period of mourning was over, Judah went up to Timnah to his sheepshearers, together with his friend Hirah the Adullamite.
content_old: 12 A long time afterward, Shua’s daughter, the wife of Judah, died. When his period of mourning was over, Judah went up to Timnah to his sheepshearers, together with his friend Hirah the Adullamite.

content: 13 And Tamar was told, “Your father-in-law is coming up to Timnah for the sheepshearing.”
content_old: 13 And Tamar was told, “Your father-in-law is coming up to Timnah for the sheepshearing.”

content: 14 So she took off her widow’s garb, covered her face with a veil, and, wrapping herself up, sat down at the entrance to Enaim, which is on the road to Timnah; for she saw that Shelah was grown up, yet she had not been given to him as wife.
content_old: 14 So she took off her widow’s garb, covered her face with a veil, and, wrapping herself up, sat down at the entrance to Enaim, which is on the road to Timnah; for she saw that Shelah was grown up, yet she had not been given to him as wife.

content: 15 When Judah saw her, he took her for a harlot; for she had covered her face.
content_old: 15 When Judah saw her, he took her for a harlot; for she had covered her face.

content: 16 So he turned aside to her by the road and said, “Here, let me sleep with you”—for he did not know that she was his daughter-in-law. “What,” she asked, “will you pay for sleeping with me?”
content_old: 16 So he turned aside to her by the road and said, “Here, let me sleep with you”—for he did not know that she was his daughter-in-law. “What,” she asked, “will you pay for sleeping with me?”

content: 17 He replied, “I will send a kid from my flock.” But she said, “You must leave a pledge until you have sent it.”
content_old: 17 He replied, “I will send a kid from my flock.” But she said, “You must leave a pledge until you have sent it.”

content: 18 And he said, “What pledge shall I give you?” She replied, “Your seal and cord, and the staff which you carry.” So he gave them to her and slept with her, and she conceived by him.
content_old: 18 And he said, “What pledge shall I give you?” She replied, “Your seal and cord, and the staff which you carry.” So he gave them to her and slept with her, and she conceived by him.

content: 19 Then she went on her way. She took off her veil and again put on her widow’s garb.
content_old: 19 Then she went on her way. She took off her veil and again put on her widow’s garb.

content: 20 Judah sent the kid by his friend the Adullamite, to redeem the pledge from the woman; but he could not find her.
content_old: 20 Judah sent the kid by his friend the Adullamite, to redeem the pledge from the woman; but he could not find her.

content: 21 He inquired of the people of that town, “Where is the cult prostitute, the one at Enaim, by the road?” But they said, “There has been no prostitute here.”
content_old: 21 He inquired of the people of that town, “Where is the cult prostitute, the one at Enaim, by the road?” But they said, “There has been no prostitute here.”

content: 22 So he returned to Judah and said, “I could not find her; moreover, the townspeople said: There has been no prostitute here.”
content_old: 22 So he returned to Judah and said, “I could not find her; moreover, the townspeople said: There has been no prostitute here.”

content: 23 Judah said, “Let her keep them, lest we become a laughingstock. I did send her this kid, but you did not find her.”
content_old: 23 Judah said, “Let her keep them, lest we become a laughingstock. I did send her this kid, but you did not find her.”

content: 24 About three months later, Judah was told, “Your daughter-in-law Tamar has played the harlot; in fact, she is with child by harlotry.” “Bring her out,” said Judah, “and let her be burned.”
content_old: 24 About three months later, Judah was told, “Your daughter-in-law Tamar has played the harlot; in fact, she is with child by harlotry.” “Bring her out,” said Judah, “and let her be burned.”

content: 25 As she was being brought out, she sent this message to her father-in-law, “I am with child by the man to whom these belong.” And she added, “Examine these: whose seal and cord and staff are these?”
content_old: 25 As she was being brought out, she sent this message to her father-in-law, “I am with child by the man to whom these belong.” And she added, “Examine these: whose seal and cord and staff are these?”

content: 26 Judah recognized them, and said, “She is more in the right than I, inasmuch as I did not give her to my son Shelah.” And he was not intimate with her again.
content_old: 26 Judah recognized them, and said, “She is more in the right than I, inasmuch as I did not give her to my son Shelah.” And he was not intimate with her again.

content: 27 When the time came for her to give birth, there were twins in her womb!
content_old: 27 When the time came for her to give birth, there were twins in her womb!

content: 28 While she was in labor, one of them put out his hand, and the midwife tied a crimson thread on that hand, to signify: This one came out first.
content_old: 28 While she was in labor, one of them put out his hand, and the midwife tied a crimson thread on that hand, to signify: This one came out first.

content: 29 But just then he drew back his hand, and out came his brother; and she said, “What a breach you have made for yourself!” So he was named Perez.
content_old: 29 But just then he drew back his hand, and out came his brother; and she said, “What a breach you have made for yourself!” So he was named Perez.

content: 1 When Joseph was taken down to Egypt, a certain Egyptian, Potiphar, a courtier of Pharaoh and his chief steward, bought him from the Ishmaelites who had brought him there.
content_old: 1 When Joseph was taken down to Egypt, a certain Egyptian, Potiphar, a courtier of Pharaoh and his chief steward, bought him from the Ishmaelites who had brought him there.

content: 2 The LORD was with Joseph, and he was a successful man; and he stayed in the house of his Egyptian master.
content_old: 2 The LORD was with Joseph, and he was a successful man; and he stayed in the house of his Egyptian master.

content: 3 And when his master saw that the LORD was with him and that the LORD lent success to everything he undertook,
content_old: 3 And when his master saw that the LORD was with him and that the LORD lent success to everything he undertook,

content: 4 he took a liking to Joseph. He made him his personal attendant and put him in charge of his household, placing in his hands all that he owned.
content_old: 4 he took a liking to Joseph. He made him his personal attendant and put him in charge of his household, placing in his hands all that he owned.

content: 5 And from the time that the Egyptian put him in charge of his household and of all that he owned, the LORD blessed his house for Joseph’s sake, so that the blessing of the LORD was upon everything that he owned, in the house and outside.
content_old: 5 And from the time that the Egyptian put him in charge of his household and of all that he owned, the LORD blessed his house for Joseph’s sake, so that the blessing of the LORD was upon everything that he owned, in the house and outside.

content: 6 He left all that he had in Joseph’s hands and, with him there, he paid attention to nothing save the food that he ate. Now Joseph was well built and handsome.
content_old: 6 He left all that he had in Joseph’s hands and, with him there, he paid attention to nothing save the food that he ate. Now Joseph was well built and handsome.

content: 7 After a time, his master’s wife cast her eyes upon Joseph and said, “Lie with me.”
content_old: 7 After a time, his master’s wife cast her eyes upon Joseph and said, “Lie with me.”

content: 8 But he refused. He said to his master’s wife, “Look, with me here, my master gives no thought to anything in this house, and all that he owns he has placed in my hands.
content_old: 8 But he refused. He said to his master’s wife, “Look, with me here, my master gives no thought to anything in this house, and all that he owns he has placed in my hands.

content: 9 He wields no more authority in this house than I, and he has withheld nothing from me except yourself, since you are his wife. How then could I do this most wicked thing, and sin before God?”
content_old: 9 He wields no more authority in this house than I, and he has withheld nothing from me except yourself, since you are his wife. How then could I do this most wicked thing, and sin before God?”

content: 10 And much as she coaxed Joseph day after day, he did not yield to her request to lie beside her, to be with her.
content_old: 10 And much as she coaxed Joseph day after day, he did not yield to her request to lie beside her, to be with her.

content: 11 One such day, he came into the house to do his work. None of the household being there inside,
content_old: 11 One such day, he came into the house to do his work. None of the household being there inside,

content: 12 she caught hold of him by his garment and said, “Lie with me!” But he left his garment in her hand and got away and fled outside.
content_old: 12 she caught hold of him by his garment and said, “Lie with me!” But he left his garment in her hand and got away and fled outside.

content: 13 When she saw that he had left it in her hand and had fled outside,
content_old: 13 When she saw that he had left it in her hand and had fled outside,

content: 14 she called out to her servants and said to them, “Look, he had to bring us a Hebrew to dally with us! This one came to lie with me; but I screamed loud.
content_old: 14 she called out to her servants and said to them, “Look, he had to bring us a Hebrew to dally with us! This one came to lie with me; but I screamed loud.

content: 15 And when he heard me screaming at the top of my voice, he left his garment with me and got away and fled outside.”
content_old: 15 And when he heard me screaming at the top of my voice, he left his garment with me and got away and fled outside.”

content: 16 She kept his garment beside her, until his master came home.
content_old: 16 She kept his garment beside her, until his master came home.

content: 17 Then she told him the same story, saying, “The Hebrew slave whom you brought into our house came to me to dally with me;
content_old: 17 Then she told him the same story, saying, “The Hebrew slave whom you brought into our house came to me to dally with me;

content: 18 but when I screamed at the top of my voice, he left his garment with me and fled outside.”
content_old: 18 but when I screamed at the top of my voice, he left his garment with me and fled outside.”

content: 19 When his master heard the story that his wife told him, namely, “Thus and so your slave did to me,” he was furious.
content_old: 19 When his master heard the story that his wife told him, namely, “Thus and so your slave did to me,” he was furious.

content: 20 So Joseph’s master had him put in prison, where the king’s prisoners were confined. But even while he was there in prison,
content_old: 20 So Joseph’s master had him put in prison, where the king’s prisoners were confined. But even while he was there in prison,

content: 21 the LORD was with Joseph: He extended kindness to him and disposed the chief jailer favorably toward him.
content_old: 21 the LORD was with Joseph: He extended kindness to him and disposed the chief jailer favorably toward him.

content: 22 The chief jailer put in Joseph’s charge all the prisoners who were in that prison, and he was the one to carry out everything that was done there.
content_old: 22 The chief jailer put in Joseph’s charge all the prisoners who were in that prison, and he was the one to carry out everything that was done there.

content: 1 Some time later, the cupbearer and the baker of the king of Egypt gave offense to their lord the king of Egypt.
content_old: 1 Some time later, the cupbearer and the baker of the king of Egypt gave offense to their lord the king of Egypt.

content: 2 Pharaoh was angry with his two courtiers, the chief cupbearer and the chief baker,
content_old: 2 Pharaoh was angry with his two courtiers, the chief cupbearer and the chief baker,

content: 3 and put them in custody, in the house of the chief steward, in the same prison house where Joseph was confined.
content_old: 3 and put them in custody, in the house of the chief steward, in the same prison house where Joseph was confined.

content: 4 The chief steward assigned Joseph to them, and he attended them. When they had been in custody for some time,
content_old: 4 The chief steward assigned Joseph to them, and he attended them. When they had been in custody for some time,

content: 5 both of them—the cupbearer and the baker of the king of Egypt, who were confined in the prison—dreamed in the same night, each his own dream and each dream with its own meaning.
content_old: 5 both of them—the cupbearer and the baker of the king of Egypt, who were confined in the prison—dreamed in the same night, each his own dream and each dream with its own meaning.

content: 6 When Joseph came to them in the morning, he saw that they were distraught.
content_old: 6 When Joseph came to them in the morning, he saw that they were distraught.

content: 7 He asked Pharaoh’s courtiers, who were with him in custody in his master’s house, saying, “Why do you appear downcast today?”
content_old: 7 He asked Pharaoh’s courtiers, who were with him in custody in his master’s house, saying, “Why do you appear downcast today?”

content: 8 And they said to him, “We had dreams, and there is no one to interpret them.” So Joseph said to them, “Surely God can interpret! Tell me your dreams.”
content_old: 8 And they said to him, “We had dreams, and there is no one to interpret them.” So Joseph said to them, “Surely God can interpret! Tell me your dreams.”

content: 9 Then the chief cupbearer told his dream to Joseph. He said to him, “In my dream, there was a vine in front of me.
content_old: 9 Then the chief cupbearer told his dream to Joseph. He said to him, “In my dream, there was a vine in front of me.

content: 10 On the vine were three branches. It had barely budded, when out came its blossoms and its clusters ripened into grapes.
content_old: 10 On the vine were three branches. It had barely budded, when out came its blossoms and its clusters ripened into grapes.

content: 11 Pharaoh’s cup was in my hand, and I took the grapes, pressed them into Pharaoh’s cup, and placed the cup in Pharaoh’s hand.”
content_old: 11 Pharaoh’s cup was in my hand, and I took the grapes, pressed them into Pharaoh’s cup, and placed the cup in Pharaoh’s hand.”

content: 12 Joseph said to him, “This is its interpretation: The three branches are three days.
content_old: 12 Joseph said to him, “This is its interpretation: The three branches are three days.

content: 13 In three days Pharaoh will pardon you and restore you to your post; you will place Pharaoh’s cup in his hand, as was your custom formerly when you were his cupbearer.
content_old: 13 In three days Pharaoh will pardon you and restore you to your post; you will place Pharaoh’s cup in his hand, as was your custom formerly when you were his cupbearer.

content: 14 But think of me when all is well with you again, and do me the kindness of mentioning me to Pharaoh, so as to free me from this place.
content_old: 14 But think of me when all is well with you again, and do me the kindness of mentioning me to Pharaoh, so as to free me from this place.

content: 15 For in truth, I was kidnapped from the land of the Hebrews; nor have I done anything here that they should have put me in the dungeon.”
content_old: 15 For in truth, I was kidnapped from the land of the Hebrews; nor have I done anything here that they should have put me in the dungeon.”

content: 16 When the chief baker saw how favorably he had interpreted, he said to Joseph, “In my dream, similarly, there were three openwork baskets on my head.
content_old: 16 When the chief baker saw how favorably he had interpreted, he said to Joseph, “In my dream, similarly, there were three openwork baskets on my head.

content: 17 In the uppermost basket were all kinds of food for Pharaoh that a baker prepares; and the birds were eating it out of the basket above my head.”
content_old: 17 In the uppermost basket were all kinds of food for Pharaoh that a baker prepares; and the birds were eating it out of the basket above my head.”

content: 18 Joseph answered, “This is its interpretation: The three baskets are three days.
content_old: 18 Joseph answered, “This is its interpretation: The three baskets are three days.

content: 19 In three days Pharaoh will lift off your head and impale you upon a pole; and the birds will pick off your flesh.”
content_old: 19 In three days Pharaoh will lift off your head and impale you upon a pole; and the birds will pick off your flesh.”

content: 20 On the third day—his birthday—Pharaoh made a banquet for all his officials, and he singled out his chief cupbearer and his chief baker from among his officials.
content_old: 20 On the third day—his birthday—Pharaoh made a banquet for all his officials, and he singled out his chief cupbearer and his chief baker from among his officials.

content: 21 He restored the chief cupbearer to his cupbearing, and he placed the cup in Pharaoh’s hand;
content_old: 21 He restored the chief cupbearer to his cupbearing, and he placed the cup in Pharaoh’s hand;

content: 22 but the chief baker he impaled—just as Joseph had interpreted to them.
content_old: 22 but the chief baker he impaled—just as Joseph had interpreted to them.

content: 1 After two years’ time, Pharaoh dreamed that he was standing by the Nile,
content_old: 1 After two years’ time, Pharaoh dreamed that he was standing by the Nile,

content: 2 when out of the Nile there came up seven cows, handsome and sturdy, and they grazed in the reed grass.
content_old: 2 when out of the Nile there came up seven cows, handsome and sturdy, and they grazed in the reed grass.

content: 3 But presently, seven other cows came up from the Nile close behind them, ugly and gaunt, and stood beside the cows on the bank of the Nile;
content_old: 3 But presently, seven other cows came up from the Nile close behind them, ugly and gaunt, and stood beside the cows on the bank of the Nile;

content: 4 and the ugly gaunt cows ate up the seven handsome sturdy cows. And Pharaoh awoke.
content_old: 4 and the ugly gaunt cows ate up the seven handsome sturdy cows. And Pharaoh awoke.

content: 5 He fell asleep and dreamed a second time: Seven ears of grain, solid and healthy, grew on a single stalk.
content_old: 5 He fell asleep and dreamed a second time: Seven ears of grain, solid and healthy, grew on a single stalk.

content: 6 But close behind them sprouted seven ears, thin and scorched by the east wind.
content_old: 6 But close behind them sprouted seven ears, thin and scorched by the east wind.

content: 7 And the thin ears swallowed up the seven solid and full ears. Then Pharaoh awoke: it was a dream!
content_old: 7 And the thin ears swallowed up the seven solid and full ears. Then Pharaoh awoke: it was a dream!

content: 8 Next morning, his spirit was agitated, and he sent for all the magicians of Egypt, and all its wise men; and Pharaoh told them his dreams, but none could interpret them for Pharaoh.
content_old: 8 Next morning, his spirit was agitated, and he sent for all the magicians of Egypt, and all its wise men; and Pharaoh told them his dreams, but none could interpret them for Pharaoh.

content: 9 The chief cupbearer then spoke up and said to Pharaoh, “I must make mention today of my offenses.
content_old: 9 The chief cupbearer then spoke up and said to Pharaoh, “I must make mention today of my offenses.

content: 10 Once Pharaoh was angry with his servants, and placed me in custody in the house of the chief steward, together with the chief baker.
content_old: 10 Once Pharaoh was angry with his servants, and placed me in custody in the house of the chief steward, together with the chief baker.

content: 11 We had dreams the same night, he and I, each of us a dream with a meaning of its own.
content_old: 11 We had dreams the same night, he and I, each of us a dream with a meaning of its own.

content: 12 A Hebrew youth was there with us, a servant of the chief steward; and when we told him our dreams, he interpreted them for us, telling each of the meaning of his dream.
content_old: 12 A Hebrew youth was there with us, a servant of the chief steward; and when we told him our dreams, he interpreted them for us, telling each of the meaning of his dream.

content: 13 And as he interpreted for us, so it came to pass: I was restored to my post, and the other was impaled.”
content_old: 13 And as he interpreted for us, so it came to pass: I was restored to my post, and the other was impaled.”

content: 14 Thereupon Pharaoh sent for Joseph, and he was rushed from the dungeon. He had his hair cut and changed his clothes, and he appeared before Pharaoh.
content_old: 14 Thereupon Pharaoh sent for Joseph, and he was rushed from the dungeon. He had his hair cut and changed his clothes, and he appeared before Pharaoh.

content: 15 And Pharaoh said to Joseph, “I have had a dream, but no one can interpret it. Now I have heard it said of you that for you to hear a dream is to tell its meaning.”
content_old: 15 And Pharaoh said to Joseph, “I have had a dream, but no one can interpret it. Now I have heard it said of you that for you to hear a dream is to tell its meaning.”

content: 16 Joseph answered Pharaoh, saying, “Not I! God will see to Pharaoh’s welfare.”
content_old: 16 Joseph answered Pharaoh, saying, “Not I! God will see to Pharaoh’s welfare.”

content: 17 Then Pharaoh said to Joseph, “In my dream, I was standing on the bank of the Nile,
content_old: 17 Then Pharaoh said to Joseph, “In my dream, I was standing on the bank of the Nile,

content: 18 when out of the Nile came up seven sturdy and well-formed cows and grazed in the reed grass.
content_old: 18 when out of the Nile came up seven sturdy and well-formed cows and grazed in the reed grass.

content: 19 Presently there followed them seven other cows, scrawny, ill-formed, and emaciated—never had I seen their likes for ugliness in all the land of Egypt!
content_old: 19 Presently there followed them seven other cows, scrawny, ill-formed, and emaciated—never had I seen their likes for ugliness in all the land of Egypt!

content: 20 And the seven lean and ugly cows ate up the first seven cows, the sturdy ones;
content_old: 20 And the seven lean and ugly cows ate up the first seven cows, the sturdy ones;

content: 21 but when they had consumed them, one could not tell that they had consumed them, for they looked just as bad as before. And I awoke.
content_old: 21 but when they had consumed them, one could not tell that they had consumed them, for they looked just as bad as before. And I awoke.

content: 22 In my other dream, I saw seven ears of grain, full and healthy, growing on a single stalk;
content_old: 22 In my other dream, I saw seven ears of grain, full and healthy, growing on a single stalk;

content: 23 but right behind them sprouted seven ears, shriveled, thin, and scorched by the east wind.
content_old: 23 but right behind them sprouted seven ears, shriveled, thin, and scorched by the east wind.

content: 24 And the thin ears swallowed the seven healthy ears. I have told my magicians, but none has an explanation for me.”
content_old: 24 And the thin ears swallowed the seven healthy ears. I have told my magicians, but none has an explanation for me.”

content: 25 And Joseph said to Pharaoh, “Pharaoh’s dreams are one and the same: God has told Pharaoh what He is about to do.
content_old: 25 And Joseph said to Pharaoh, “Pharaoh’s dreams are one and the same: God has told Pharaoh what He is about to do.

content: 26 The seven healthy cows are seven years, and the seven healthy ears are seven years; it is the same dream.
content_old: 26 The seven healthy cows are seven years, and the seven healthy ears are seven years; it is the same dream.

content: 27 The seven lean and ugly cows that followed are seven years, as are also the seven empty ears scorched by the east wind; they are seven years of famine.
content_old: 27 The seven lean and ugly cows that followed are seven years, as are also the seven empty ears scorched by the east wind; they are seven years of famine.

content: 28 It is just as I have told Pharaoh: God has revealed to Pharaoh what He is about to do.
content_old: 28 It is just as I have told Pharaoh: God has revealed to Pharaoh what He is about to do.

content: 29 Immediately ahead are seven years of great abundance in all the land of Egypt.
content_old: 29 Immediately ahead are seven years of great abundance in all the land of Egypt.

content: 30 After them will come seven years of famine, and all the abundance in the land of Egypt will be forgotten. As the land is ravaged by famine,
content_old: 30 After them will come seven years of famine, and all the abundance in the land of Egypt will be forgotten. As the land is ravaged by famine,

content: 31 no trace of the abundance will be left in the land because of the famine thereafter, for it will be very severe.
content_old: 31 no trace of the abundance will be left in the land because of the famine thereafter, for it will be very severe.

content: 32 As for Pharaoh having had the same dream twice, it means that the matter has been determined by God, and that God will soon carry it out.
content_old: 32 As for Pharaoh having had the same dream twice, it means that the matter has been determined by God, and that God will soon carry it out.

content: 33 “Accordingly, let Pharaoh find a man of discernment and wisdom, and set him over the land of Egypt.
content_old: 33 “Accordingly, let Pharaoh find a man of discernment and wisdom, and set him over the land of Egypt.

content: 34 And let Pharaoh take steps to appoint overseers over the land, and organize the land of Egypt in the seven years of plenty.
content_old: 34 And let Pharaoh take steps to appoint overseers over the land, and organize the land of Egypt in the seven years of plenty.

content: 35 Let all the food of these good years that are coming be gathered, and let the grain be collected under Pharaoh’s authority as food to be stored in the cities.
content_old: 35 Let all the food of these good years that are coming be gathered, and let the grain be collected under Pharaoh’s authority as food to be stored in the cities.

content: 36 Let that food be a reserve for the land for the seven years of famine which will come upon the land of Egypt, so that the land may not perish in the famine.”
content_old: 36 Let that food be a reserve for the land for the seven years of famine which will come upon the land of Egypt, so that the land may not perish in the famine.”

content: 37 The plan pleased Pharaoh and all his courtiers.
content_old: 37 The plan pleased Pharaoh and all his courtiers.

content: 38 And Pharaoh said to his courtiers, “Could we find another like him, a man in whom is the spirit of God?”
content_old: 38 And Pharaoh said to his courtiers, “Could we find another like him, a man in whom is the spirit of God?”

content: 39 So Pharaoh said to Joseph, “Since God has made all this known to you, there is none so discerning and wise as you.
content_old: 39 So Pharaoh said to Joseph, “Since God has made all this known to you, there is none so discerning and wise as you.

content: 40 You shall be in charge of my court, and by your command shall all my people be directed; only with respect to the throne shall I be superior to you.”
content_old: 40 You shall be in charge of my court, and by your command shall all my people be directed; only with respect to the throne shall I be superior to you.”

content: 41 Pharaoh further said to Joseph, “See, I put you in charge of all the land of Egypt.”
content_old: 41 Pharaoh further said to Joseph, “See, I put you in charge of all the land of Egypt.”

content: 42 And removing his signet ring from his hand, Pharaoh put it on Joseph’s hand; and he had him dressed in robes of fine linen, and put a gold chain about his neck.
content_old: 42 And removing his signet ring from his hand, Pharaoh put it on Joseph’s hand; and he had him dressed in robes of fine linen, and put a gold chain about his neck.

content: 43 He had him ride in the chariot of his second-in-command, and they cried before him, “Abrek!” Thus he placed him over all the land of Egypt.
content_old: 43 He had him ride in the chariot of his second-in-command, and they cried before him, “Abrek!” Thus he placed him over all the land of Egypt.

content: 44 Pharaoh said to Joseph, “I am Pharaoh; yet without you, no one shall lift up hand or foot in all the land of Egypt.”
content_old: 44 Pharaoh said to Joseph, “I am Pharaoh; yet without you, no one shall lift up hand or foot in all the land of Egypt.”

content: 45 Pharaoh then gave Joseph the name Zaphenath-paneah; and he gave him for a wife Asenath daughter of Poti-phera, priest of On. Thus Joseph emerged in charge of the land of Egypt.—
content_old: 45 Pharaoh then gave Joseph the name Zaphenath-paneah; and he gave him for a wife Asenath daughter of Poti-phera, priest of On. Thus Joseph emerged in charge of the land of Egypt.—

content: 46 Joseph was thirty years old when he entered the service of Pharaoh king of Egypt.—Leaving Pharaoh’s presence, Joseph traveled through all the land of Egypt.
content_old: 46 Joseph was thirty years old when he entered the service of Pharaoh king of Egypt.—Leaving Pharaoh’s presence, Joseph traveled through all the land of Egypt.

content: 47 During the seven years of plenty, the land produced in abundance.
content_old: 47 During the seven years of plenty, the land produced in abundance.

content: 48 And he gathered all the grain of the seven years that the land of Egypt was enjoying, and stored the grain in the cities; he put in each city the grain of the fields around it.
content_old: 48 And he gathered all the grain of the seven years that the land of Egypt was enjoying, and stored the grain in the cities; he put in each city the grain of the fields around it.

content: 49 So Joseph collected produce in very large quantity, like the sands of the sea, until he ceased to measure it, for it could not be measured.
content_old: 49 So Joseph collected produce in very large quantity, like the sands of the sea, until he ceased to measure it, for it could not be measured.

content: 50 Before the years of famine came, Joseph became the father of two sons, whom Asenath daughter of Poti-phera, priest of On, bore to him.
content_old: 50 Before the years of famine came, Joseph became the father of two sons, whom Asenath daughter of Poti-phera, priest of On, bore to him.

content: 51 Joseph named the first-born Manasseh, meaning, “God has made me forget completely my hardship and my parental home.”
content_old: 51 Joseph named the first-born Manasseh, meaning, “God has made me forget completely my hardship and my parental home.”

content: 52 And the second he named Ephraim, meaning, “God has made me fertile in the land of my affliction.”
content_old: 52 And the second he named Ephraim, meaning, “God has made me fertile in the land of my affliction.”

content: 53 The seven years of abundance that the land of Egypt enjoyed came to an end,
content_old: 53 The seven years of abundance that the land of Egypt enjoyed came to an end,

content: 54 and the seven years of famine set in, just as Joseph had foretold. There was famine in all lands, but throughout the land of Egypt there was bread.
content_old: 54 and the seven years of famine set in, just as Joseph had foretold. There was famine in all lands, but throughout the land of Egypt there was bread.

content: 55 And when all the land of Egypt felt the hunger, the people cried out to Pharaoh for bread; and Pharaoh said to all the Egyptians, “Go to Joseph; whatever he tells you, you shall do.”—
content_old: 55 And when all the land of Egypt felt the hunger, the people cried out to Pharaoh for bread; and Pharaoh said to all the Egyptians, “Go to Joseph; whatever he tells you, you shall do.”—

content: 56 Accordingly, when the famine became severe in the land of Egypt, Joseph laid open all that was within, and rationed out grain to the Egyptians. The famine, however, spread over the whole world.
content_old: 56 Accordingly, when the famine became severe in the land of Egypt, Joseph laid open all that was within, and rationed out grain to the Egyptians. The famine, however, spread over the whole world.

content: 1 When Jacob saw that there were food rations to be had in Egypt, he said to his sons, “Why do you keep looking at one another?
content_old: 1 When Jacob saw that there were food rations to be had in Egypt, he said to his sons, “Why do you keep looking at one another?

content: 2 Now I hear,” he went on, “that there are rations to be had in Egypt. Go down and procure rations for us there, that we may live and not die.”
content_old: 2 Now I hear,” he went on, “that there are rations to be had in Egypt. Go down and procure rations for us there, that we may live and not die.”

content: 3 So ten of Joseph’s brothers went down to get grain rations in Egypt;
content_old: 3 So ten of Joseph’s brothers went down to get grain rations in Egypt;

content: 4 for Jacob did not send Joseph’s brother Benjamin with his brothers, since he feared that he might meet with disaster.
content_old: 4 for Jacob did not send Joseph’s brother Benjamin with his brothers, since he feared that he might meet with disaster.

content: 5 Thus the sons of Israel were among those who came to procure rations, for the famine extended to the land of Canaan.
content_old: 5 Thus the sons of Israel were among those who came to procure rations, for the famine extended to the land of Canaan.

content: 6 Now Joseph was the vizier of the land; it was he who dispensed rations to all the people of the land. And Joseph’s brothers came and bowed low to him, with their faces to the ground.
content_old: 6 Now Joseph was the vizier of the land; it was he who dispensed rations to all the people of the land. And Joseph’s brothers came and bowed low to him, with their faces to the ground.

content: 7 When Joseph saw his brothers, he recognized them; but he acted like a stranger toward them and spoke harshly to them. He asked them, “Where do you come from?” And they said, “From the land of Canaan, to procure food.”
content_old: 7 When Joseph saw his brothers, he recognized them; but he acted like a stranger toward them and spoke harshly to them. He asked them, “Where do you come from?” And they said, “From the land of Canaan, to procure food.”
