content: 8 For though Joseph recognized his brothers, they did not recognize him.
content_old: 8 For though Joseph recognized his brothers, they did not recognize him.

content: 9 Recalling the dreams that he had dreamed about them, Joseph said to them, “You are spies, you have come to see the land in its nakedness.”
content_old: 9 Recalling the dreams that he had dreamed about them, Joseph said to them, “You are spies, you have come to see the land in its nakedness.”

content: 10 But they said to him, “No, my lord! Truly, your servants have come to procure food.
content_old: 10 But they said to him, “No, my lord! Truly, your servants have come to procure food.

content: 11 We are all of us sons of the same man; we are honest men; your servants have never been spies!”
content_old: 11 We are all of us sons of the same man; we are honest men; your servants have never been spies!”

content: 12 And he said to them, “No, you have come to see the land in its nakedness!”
content_old: 12 And he said to them, “No, you have come to see the land in its nakedness!”

content: 13 And they replied, “We your servants were twelve brothers, sons of a certain man in the land of Canaan; the youngest, however, is now with our father, and one is no more.”
content_old: 13 And they replied, “We your servants were twelve brothers, sons of a certain man in the land of Canaan; the youngest, however, is now with our father, and one is no more.”

content: 14 But Joseph said to them, “It is just as I have told you: You are spies!
content_old: 14 But Joseph said to them, “It is just as I have told you: You are spies!

content: 15 By this you shall be put to the test: unless your youngest brother comes here, by Pharaoh, you shall not depart from this place!
content_old: 15 By this you shall be put to the test: unless your youngest brother comes here, by Pharaoh, you shall not depart from this place!

content: 16 Let one of you go and bring your brother, while the rest of you remain confined, that your words may be put to the test whether there is truth in you. Else, by Pharaoh, you are nothing but spies!”
content_old: 16 Let one of you go and bring your brother, while the rest of you remain confined, that your words may be put to the test whether there is truth in you. Else, by Pharaoh, you are nothing but spies!”

content: 17 And he confined them in the guardhouse for three days.
content_old: 17 And he confined them in the guardhouse for three days.

content: 18 On the third day Joseph said to them, “Do this and you shall live, for I am a God-fearing man.
content_old: 18 On the third day Joseph said to them, “Do this and you shall live, for I am a God-fearing man.

content: 19 If you are honest men, let one of you brothers be held in your place of detention, while the rest of you go and take home rations for your starving households;
content_old: 19 If you are honest men, let one of you brothers be held in your place of detention, while the rest of you go and take home rations for your starving households;

content: 20 but you must bring me your youngest brother, that your words may be verified and that you may not die.” And they did accordingly.
content_old: 20 but you must bring me your youngest brother, that your words may be verified and that you may not die.” And they did accordingly.

content: 21 They said to one another, “Alas, we are being punished on account of our brother, because we looked on at his anguish, yet paid no heed as he pleaded with us. That is why this distress has come upon us.”
content_old: 21 They said to one another, “Alas, we are being punished on account of our brother, because we looked on at his anguish, yet paid no heed as he pleaded with us. That is why this distress has come upon us.”

content: 22 Then Reuben spoke up and said to them, “Did I not tell you, ‘Do no wrong to the boy’? But you paid no heed. Now comes the reckoning for his blood.��
content_old: 22 Then Reuben spoke up and said to them, “Did I not tell you, ‘Do no wrong to the boy’? But you paid no heed. Now comes the reckoning for his blood.��

content: 23 They did not know that Joseph understood, for there was an interpreter between him and them.
content_old: 23 They did not know that Joseph understood, for there was an interpreter between him and them.

content: 24 He turned away from them and wept. But he came back to them and spoke to them; and he took Simeon from among them and had him bound before their eyes.
content_old: 24 He turned away from them and wept. But he came back to them and spoke to them; and he took Simeon from among them and had him bound before their eyes.

content: 25 Then Joseph gave orders to fill their bags with grain, return each one’s money to his sack, and give them provisions for the journey; and this was done for them.
content_old: 25 Then Joseph gave orders to fill their bags with grain, return each one’s money to his sack, and give them provisions for the journey; and this was done for them.

content: 26 So they loaded their asses with the rations and departed from there.
content_old: 26 So they loaded their asses with the rations and departed from there.

content: 27 As one of them was opening his sack to give feed to his ass at the night encampment, he saw his money right there at the mouth of his bag.
content_old: 27 As one of them was opening his sack to give feed to his ass at the night encampment, he saw his money right there at the mouth of his bag.

content: 28 And he said to his brothers, “My money has been returned! It is here in my bag!” Their hearts sank; and, trembling, they turned to one another, saying, “What is this that God has done to us?”
content_old: 28 And he said to his brothers, “My money has been returned! It is here in my bag!” Their hearts sank; and, trembling, they turned to one another, saying, “What is this that God has done to us?”

content: 29 When they came to their father Jacob in the land of Canaan, they told him all that had befallen them, saying,
content_old: 29 When they came to their father Jacob in the land of Canaan, they told him all that had befallen them, saying,

content: 30 “The man who is lord of the land spoke harshly to us and accused us of spying on the land.
content_old: 30 “The man who is lord of the land spoke harshly to us and accused us of spying on the land.

content: 31 We said to him, ‘We are honest men; we have never been spies!
content_old: 31 We said to him, ‘We are honest men; we have never been spies!

content: 32 There were twelve of us brothers, sons by the same father; but one is no more, and the youngest is now with our father in the land of Canaan.’
content_old: 32 There were twelve of us brothers, sons by the same father; but one is no more, and the youngest is now with our father in the land of Canaan.’

content: 33 But the man who is lord of the land said to us, ‘By this I shall know that you are honest men: leave one of your brothers with me, and take something for your starving households and be off.
content_old: 33 But the man who is lord of the land said to us, ‘By this I shall know that you are honest men: leave one of your brothers with me, and take something for your starving households and be off.

content: 34 And bring your youngest brother to me, that I may know that you are not spies but honest men. I will then restore your brother to you, and you shall be free to move about in the land.’ ”
content_old: 34 And bring your youngest brother to me, that I may know that you are not spies but honest men. I will then restore your brother to you, and you shall be free to move about in the land.’ ”

content: 35 As they were emptying their sacks, there, in each one’s sack, was his money-bag! When they and their father saw their money-bags, they were dismayed.
content_old: 35 As they were emptying their sacks, there, in each one’s sack, was his money-bag! When they and their father saw their money-bags, they were dismayed.

content: 36 Their father Jacob said to them, “It is always me that you bereave: Joseph is no more and Simeon is no more, and now you would take away Benjamin. These things always happen to me!���
content_old: 36 Their father Jacob said to them, “It is always me that you bereave: Joseph is no more and Simeon is no more, and now you would take away Benjamin. These things always happen to me!���

content: 37 Then Reuben said to his father, “You may kill my two sons if I do not bring him back to you. Put him in my care, and I will return him to you.”
content_old: 37 Then Reuben said to his father, “You may kill my two sons if I do not bring him back to you. Put him in my care, and I will return him to you.”

content: 1 But the famine in the land was severe.
content_old: 1 But the famine in the land was severe.

content: 2 And when they had eaten up the rations which they had brought from Egypt, their father said to them, “Go again and procure some food for us.”
content_old: 2 And when they had eaten up the rations which they had brought from Egypt, their father said to them, “Go again and procure some food for us.”

content: 3 But Judah said to him, “The man warned us, ‘Do not let me see your faces unless your brother is with you.’
content_old: 3 But Judah said to him, “The man warned us, ‘Do not let me see your faces unless your brother is with you.’

content: 4 If you will let our brother go with us, we will go down and procure food for you;
content_old: 4 If you will let our brother go with us, we will go down and procure food for you;

content: 5 but if you will not let him go, we will not go down, for the man said to us, ‘Do not let me see your faces unless your brother is with you.’ ”
content_old: 5 but if you will not let him go, we will not go down, for the man said to us, ‘Do not let me see your faces unless your brother is with you.’ ”

content: 6 And Israel said, “Why did you serve me so ill as to tell the man that you had another brother?”
content_old: 6 And Israel said, “Why did you serve me so ill as to tell the man that you had another brother?”

content: 7 They replied, “But the man kept asking about us and our family, saying, ‘Is your father still living? Have you another brother?’ And we answered him accordingly. How were we to know that he would say, ‘Bring your brother here’?”
content_old: 7 They replied, “But the man kept asking about us and our family, saying, ‘Is your father still living? Have you another brother?’ And we answered him accordingly. How were we to know that he would say, ‘Bring your brother here’?”

content: 8 Then Judah said to his father Israel, “Send the boy in my care, and let us be on our way, that we may live and not die—you and we and our children.
content_old: 8 Then Judah said to his father Israel, “Send the boy in my care, and let us be on our way, that we may live and not die—you and we and our children.

content: 9 I myself will be surety for him; you may hold me responsible: if I do not bring him back to you and set him before you, I shall stand guilty before you forever.
content_old: 9 I myself will be surety for him; you may hold me responsible: if I do not bring him back to you and set him before you, I shall stand guilty before you forever.

content: 10 For we could have been there and back twice if we had not dawdled.”
content_old: 10 For we could have been there and back twice if we had not dawdled.”

content: 11 Then their father Israel said to them, “If it must be so, do this: take some of the choice products of the land in your baggage, and carry them down as a gift for the man—some balm and some honey, gum, ladanum, pistachio nuts, and almonds.
content_old: 11 Then their father Israel said to them, “If it must be so, do this: take some of the choice products of the land in your baggage, and carry them down as a gift for the man—some balm and some honey, gum, ladanum, pistachio nuts, and almonds.

content: 12 And take with you double the money, carrying back with you the money that was replaced in the mouths of your bags; perhaps it was a mistake.
content_old: 12 And take with you double the money, carrying back with you the money that was replaced in the mouths of your bags; perhaps it was a mistake.

content: 13 Take your brother too; and go back at once to the man.
content_old: 13 Take your brother too; and go back at once to the man.

content: 14 And may El Shaddai dispose the man to mercy toward you, that he may release to you your other brother, as well as Benjamin. As for me, if I am to be bereaved, I shall be bereaved.”
content_old: 14 And may El Shaddai dispose the man to mercy toward you, that he may release to you your other brother, as well as Benjamin. As for me, if I am to be bereaved, I shall be bereaved.”

content: 15 So the men took that gift, and they took with them double the money, as well as Benjamin. They made their way down to Egypt, where they presented themselves to Joseph.
content_old: 15 So the men took that gift, and they took with them double the money, as well as Benjamin. They made their way down to Egypt, where they presented themselves to Joseph.

content: 16 When Joseph saw Benjamin with them, he said to his house steward, “Take the men into the house; slaughter and prepare an animal, for the men will dine with me at noon.”
content_old: 16 When Joseph saw Benjamin with them, he said to his house steward, “Take the men into the house; slaughter and prepare an animal, for the men will dine with me at noon.”

content: 17 The man did as Joseph said, and he brought the men into Joseph’s house.
content_old: 17 The man did as Joseph said, and he brought the men into Joseph’s house.

content: 18 But the men were frightened at being brought into Joseph’s house. “It must be,” they thought, “because of the money replaced in our bags the first time that we have been brought inside, as a pretext to attack us and seize us as slaves, with our pack animals.”
content_old: 18 But the men were frightened at being brought into Joseph’s house. “It must be,” they thought, “because of the money replaced in our bags the first time that we have been brought inside, as a pretext to attack us and seize us as slaves, with our pack animals.”

content: 19 So they went up to Joseph’s house steward and spoke to him at the entrance of the house.
content_old: 19 So they went up to Joseph’s house steward and spoke to him at the entrance of the house.

content: 20 “If you please, my lord,” they said, “we came down once before to procure food.
content_old: 20 “If you please, my lord,” they said, “we came down once before to procure food.

content: 21 But when we arrived at the night encampment and opened our bags, there was each one’s money in the mouth of his bag, our money in full. So we have brought it back with us.
content_old: 21 But when we arrived at the night encampment and opened our bags, there was each one’s money in the mouth of his bag, our money in full. So we have brought it back with us.

content: 22 And we have brought down with us other money to procure food. We do not know who put the money in our bags.”
content_old: 22 And we have brought down with us other money to procure food. We do not know who put the money in our bags.”

content: 23 He replied, “All is well with you; do not be afraid. Your God, the God of your father, must have put treasure in your bags for you. I got your payment.” And he brought out Simeon to them.
content_old: 23 He replied, “All is well with you; do not be afraid. Your God, the God of your father, must have put treasure in your bags for you. I got your payment.” And he brought out Simeon to them.

content: 24 Then the man brought the men into Joseph’s house; he gave them water to bathe their feet, and he provided feed for their asses.
content_old: 24 Then the man brought the men into Joseph’s house; he gave them water to bathe their feet, and he provided feed for their asses.

content: 25 They laid out their gifts to await Joseph’s arrival at noon, for they had heard that they were to dine there.
content_old: 25 They laid out their gifts to await Joseph’s arrival at noon, for they had heard that they were to dine there.

content: 26 When Joseph came home, they presented to him the gifts that they had brought with them into the house, bowing low before him to the ground.
content_old: 26 When Joseph came home, they presented to him the gifts that they had brought with them into the house, bowing low before him to the ground.

content: 27 He greeted them, and he said, “How is your aged father of whom you spoke? Is he still in good health?”
content_old: 27 He greeted them, and he said, “How is your aged father of whom you spoke? Is he still in good health?”

content: 28 They replied, “It is well with your servant our father; he is still in good health.” And they bowed and made obeisance.
content_old: 28 They replied, “It is well with your servant our father; he is still in good health.” And they bowed and made obeisance.

content: 29 Looking about, he saw his brother Benjamin, his mother’s son, and asked, “Is this your youngest brother of whom you spoke to me?” And he went on, “May God be gracious to you, my boy.”
content_old: 29 Looking about, he saw his brother Benjamin, his mother’s son, and asked, “Is this your youngest brother of whom you spoke to me?” And he went on, “May God be gracious to you, my boy.”

content: 30 With that, Joseph hurried out, for he was overcome with feeling toward his brother and was on the verge of tears; he went into a room and wept there.
content_old: 30 With that, Joseph hurried out, for he was overcome with feeling toward his brother and was on the verge of tears; he went into a room and wept there.

content: 31 Then he washed his face, reappeared, and—now in control of himself—gave the order, “Serve the meal.”
content_old: 31 Then he washed his face, reappeared, and—now in control of himself—gave the order, “Serve the meal.”

content: 32 They served him by himself, and them by themselves, and the Egyptians who ate with him by themselves; for the Egyptians could not dine with the Hebrews, since that would be abhorrent to the Egyptians.
content_old: 32 They served him by himself, and them by themselves, and the Egyptians who ate with him by themselves; for the Egyptians could not dine with the Hebrews, since that would be abhorrent to the Egyptians.

content: 33 As they were seated by his direction, from the oldest in the order of his seniority to the youngest in the order of his youth, the men looked at one another in astonishment.
content_old: 33 As they were seated by his direction, from the oldest in the order of his seniority to the youngest in the order of his youth, the men looked at one another in astonishment.

content: 1 Then he instructed his house steward as follows, “Fill the men’s bags with food, as much as they can carry, and put each one’s money in the mouth of his bag.
content_old: 1 Then he instructed his house steward as follows, “Fill the men’s bags with food, as much as they can carry, and put each one’s money in the mouth of his bag.

content: 2 Put my silver goblet in the mouth of the bag of the youngest one, together with his money for the rations.” And he did as Joseph told him.
content_old: 2 Put my silver goblet in the mouth of the bag of the youngest one, together with his money for the rations.” And he did as Joseph told him.

content: 3 With the first light of morning, the men were sent off with their pack animals.
content_old: 3 With the first light of morning, the men were sent off with their pack animals.

content: 4 They had just left the city and had not gone far, when Joseph said to his steward, “Up, go after the men! And when you overtake them, say to them, ‘Why did you repay good with evil?
content_old: 4 They had just left the city and had not gone far, when Joseph said to his steward, “Up, go after the men! And when you overtake them, say to them, ‘Why did you repay good with evil?

content: 5 It is the very one from which my master drinks and which he uses for divination. It was a wicked thing for you to do!’ ”
content_old: 5 It is the very one from which my master drinks and which he uses for divination. It was a wicked thing for you to do!’ ”

content: 6 He overtook them and spoke those words to them.
content_old: 6 He overtook them and spoke those words to them.

content: 7 And they said to him, “Why does my lord say such things? Far be it from your servants to do anything of the kind!
content_old: 7 And they said to him, “Why does my lord say such things? Far be it from your servants to do anything of the kind!

content: 8 Here we brought back to you from the land of Canaan the money that we found in the mouths of our bags. How then could we have stolen any silver or gold from your master’s house!
content_old: 8 Here we brought back to you from the land of Canaan the money that we found in the mouths of our bags. How then could we have stolen any silver or gold from your master’s house!

content: 9 Whichever of your servants it is found with shall die; the rest of us, moreover, shall become slaves to my lord.”
content_old: 9 Whichever of your servants it is found with shall die; the rest of us, moreover, shall become slaves to my lord.”

content: 10 He replied, “Although what you are proposing is right, only the one with whom it is found shall be my slave; but the rest of you shall go free.”
content_old: 10 He replied, “Although what you are proposing is right, only the one with whom it is found shall be my slave; but the rest of you shall go free.”

content: 11 So each one hastened to lower his bag to the ground, and each one opened his bag.
content_old: 11 So each one hastened to lower his bag to the ground, and each one opened his bag.

content: 12 He searched, beginning with the oldest and ending with the youngest; and the goblet turned up in Benjamin’s bag.
content_old: 12 He searched, beginning with the oldest and ending with the youngest; and the goblet turned up in Benjamin’s bag.

content: 13 At this they rent their clothes. Each reloaded his pack animal, and they returned to the city.
content_old: 13 At this they rent their clothes. Each reloaded his pack animal, and they returned to the city.

content: 14 When Judah and his brothers reentered the house of Joseph, who was still there, they threw themselves on the ground before him.
content_old: 14 When Judah and his brothers reentered the house of Joseph, who was still there, they threw themselves on the ground before him.

content: 15 Joseph said to them, “What is this deed that you have done? Do you not know that a man like me practices divination?”
content_old: 15 Joseph said to them, “What is this deed that you have done? Do you not know that a man like me practices divination?”

content: 16 Judah replied, “What can we say to my lord? How can we plead, how can we prove our innocence? God has uncovered the crime of your servants. Here we are, then, slaves of my lord, the rest of us as much as he in whose possession the goblet was found.”
content_old: 16 Judah replied, “What can we say to my lord? How can we plead, how can we prove our innocence? God has uncovered the crime of your servants. Here we are, then, slaves of my lord, the rest of us as much as he in whose possession the goblet was found.”

content: 17 But he replied, “Far be it from me to act thus! Only he in whose possession the goblet was found shall be my slave; the rest of you go back in peace to your father.”
content_old: 17 But he replied, “Far be it from me to act thus! Only he in whose possession the goblet was found shall be my slave; the rest of you go back in peace to your father.”

content: 18 Then Judah went up to him and said, “Please, my lord, let your servant appeal to my lord, and do not be impatient with your servant, you who are the equal of Pharaoh.
content_old: 18 Then Judah went up to him and said, “Please, my lord, let your servant appeal to my lord, and do not be impatient with your servant, you who are the equal of Pharaoh.

content: 19 My lord asked his servants, ‘Have you a father or another brother?’
content_old: 19 My lord asked his servants, ‘Have you a father or another brother?’

content: 20 We told my lord, ‘We have an old father, and there is a child of his old age, the youngest; his full brother is dead, so that he alone is left of his mother, and his father dotes on him.’
content_old: 20 We told my lord, ‘We have an old father, and there is a child of his old age, the youngest; his full brother is dead, so that he alone is left of his mother, and his father dotes on him.’

content: 21 Then you said to your servants, ‘Bring him down to me, that I may set eyes on him.’
content_old: 21 Then you said to your servants, ‘Bring him down to me, that I may set eyes on him.’

content: 22 We said to my lord, ‘The boy cannot leave his father; if he were to leave him, his father would die.’
content_old: 22 We said to my lord, ‘The boy cannot leave his father; if he were to leave him, his father would die.’

content: 23 But you said to your servants, ‘Unless your youngest brother comes down with you, do not let me see your faces.’
content_old: 23 But you said to your servants, ‘Unless your youngest brother comes down with you, do not let me see your faces.’

content: 24 When we came back to your servant my father, we reported my lord’s words to him.
content_old: 24 When we came back to your servant my father, we reported my lord’s words to him.

content: 25 “Later our father said, ‘Go back and procure some food for us.’
content_old: 25 “Later our father said, ‘Go back and procure some food for us.’

content: 26 We answered, ‘We cannot go down; only if our youngest brother is with us can we go down, for we may not show our faces to the man unless our youngest brother is with us.’
content_old: 26 We answered, ‘We cannot go down; only if our youngest brother is with us can we go down, for we may not show our faces to the man unless our youngest brother is with us.’

content: 27 Your servant my father said to us, ‘As you know, my wife bore me two sons.
content_old: 27 Your servant my father said to us, ‘As you know, my wife bore me two sons.

content: 28 But one is gone from me, and I said: Alas, he was torn by a beast! And I have not seen him since.
content_old: 28 But one is gone from me, and I said: Alas, he was torn by a beast! And I have not seen him since.

content: 29 If you take this one from me, too, and he meets with disaster, you will send my white head down to Sheol in sorrow.’
content_old: 29 If you take this one from me, too, and he meets with disaster, you will send my white head down to Sheol in sorrow.’

content: 30 “Now, if I come to your servant my father and the boy is not with us—since his own life is so bound up with his—
content_old: 30 “Now, if I come to your servant my father and the boy is not with us—since his own life is so bound up with his—

content: 31 when he sees that the boy is not with us, he will die, and your servants will send the white head of your servant our father down to Sheol in grief.
content_old: 31 when he sees that the boy is not with us, he will die, and your servants will send the white head of your servant our father down to Sheol in grief.

content: 32 Now your servant has pledged himself for the boy to my father, saying, ‘If I do not bring him back to you, I shall stand guilty before my father forever.’
content_old: 32 Now your servant has pledged himself for the boy to my father, saying, ‘If I do not bring him back to you, I shall stand guilty before my father forever.’

content: 33 Therefore, please let your servant remain as a slave to my lord instead of the boy, and let the boy go back with his brothers.
content_old: 33 Therefore, please let your servant remain as a slave to my lord instead of the boy, and let the boy go back with his brothers.

content: 1 Joseph could no longer control himself before all his attendants, and he cried out, “Have everyone withdraw from me!” So there was no one else about when Joseph made himself known to his brothers.
content_old: 1 Joseph could no longer control himself before all his attendants, and he cried out, “Have everyone withdraw from me!” So there was no one else about when Joseph made himself known to his brothers.

content: 2 His sobs were so loud that the Egyptians could hear, and so the news reached Pharaoh’s palace.
content_old: 2 His sobs were so loud that the Egyptians could hear, and so the news reached Pharaoh’s palace.

content: 3 Joseph said to his brothers, “I am Joseph. Is my father still well?” But his brothers could not answer him, so dumfounded were they on account of him.
content_old: 3 Joseph said to his brothers, “I am Joseph. Is my father still well?” But his brothers could not answer him, so dumfounded were they on account of him.

content: 4 Then Joseph said to his brothers, “Come forward to me.” And when they came forward, he said, “I am your brother Joseph, he whom you sold into Egypt.
content_old: 4 Then Joseph said to his brothers, “Come forward to me.” And when they came forward, he said, “I am your brother Joseph, he whom you sold into Egypt.

content: 5 Now, do not be distressed or reproach yourselves because you sold me hither; it was to save life that God sent me ahead of you.
content_old: 5 Now, do not be distressed or reproach yourselves because you sold me hither; it was to save life that God sent me ahead of you.

content: 6 It is now two years that there has been famine in the land, and there are still five years to come in which there shall be no yield from tilling.
content_old: 6 It is now two years that there has been famine in the land, and there are still five years to come in which there shall be no yield from tilling.

content: 7 God has sent me ahead of you to ensure your survival on earth, and to save your lives in an extraordinary deliverance.
content_old: 7 God has sent me ahead of you to ensure your survival on earth, and to save your lives in an extraordinary deliverance.

content: 8 So, it was not you who sent me here, but God; and He has made me a father to Pharaoh, lord of all his household, and ruler over the whole land of Egypt.
content_old: 8 So, it was not you who sent me here, but God; and He has made me a father to Pharaoh, lord of all his household, and ruler over the whole land of Egypt.

content: 9 “Now, hurry back to my father and say to him: Thus says your son Joseph, ‘God has made me lord of all Egypt; come down to me without delay.
content_old: 9 “Now, hurry back to my father and say to him: Thus says your son Joseph, ‘God has made me lord of all Egypt; come down to me without delay.

content: 10 You will dwell in the region of Goshen, where you will be near me—you and your children and your grandchildren, your flocks and herds, and all that is yours.
content_old: 10 You will dwell in the region of Goshen, where you will be near me—you and your children and your grandchildren, your flocks and herds, and all that is yours.

content: 11 There I will provide for you—for there are yet five years of famine to come—that you and your household and all that is yours may not suffer want.’
content_old: 11 There I will provide for you—for there are yet five years of famine to come—that you and your household and all that is yours may not suffer want.’

content: 12 You can see for yourselves, and my brother Benjamin for himself, that it is indeed I who am speaking to you.
content_old: 12 You can see for yourselves, and my brother Benjamin for himself, that it is indeed I who am speaking to you.

content: 13 And you must tell my father everything about my high station in Egypt and all that you have seen; and bring my father here with all speed.”
content_old: 13 And you must tell my father everything about my high station in Egypt and all that you have seen; and bring my father here with all speed.”

content: 14 With that he embraced his brother Benjamin around the neck and wept, and Benjamin wept on his neck.
content_old: 14 With that he embraced his brother Benjamin around the neck and wept, and Benjamin wept on his neck.

content: 15 He kissed all his brothers and wept upon them; only then were his brothers able to talk to him.
content_old: 15 He kissed all his brothers and wept upon them; only then were his brothers able to talk to him.

content: 16 The news reached Pharaoh’s palace: “Joseph’s brothers have come.” Pharaoh and his courtiers were pleased.
content_old: 16 The news reached Pharaoh’s palace: “Joseph’s brothers have come.” Pharaoh and his courtiers were pleased.

content: 17 And Pharaoh said to Joseph, “Say to your brothers, ‘Do as follows: load up your beasts and go at once to the land of Canaan.
content_old: 17 And Pharaoh said to Joseph, “Say to your brothers, ‘Do as follows: load up your beasts and go at once to the land of Canaan.

content: 18 Take your father and your households and come to me; I will give you the best of the land of Egypt and you shall live off the fat of the land.’
content_old: 18 Take your father and your households and come to me; I will give you the best of the land of Egypt and you shall live off the fat of the land.’

content: 19 And you are bidden to add, ‘Do as follows: take from the land of Egypt wagons for your children and your wives, and bring your father here.
content_old: 19 And you are bidden to add, ‘Do as follows: take from the land of Egypt wagons for your children and your wives, and bring your father here.

content: 20 And never mind your belongings, for the best of all the land of Egypt shall be yours.’ ”
content_old: 20 And never mind your belongings, for the best of all the land of Egypt shall be yours.’ ”

content: 21 The sons of Israel did so; Joseph gave them wagons as Pharaoh had commanded, and he supplied them with provisions for the journey.
content_old: 21 The sons of Israel did so; Joseph gave them wagons as Pharaoh had commanded, and he supplied them with provisions for the journey.

content: 22 To each of them, moreover, he gave a change of clothing; but to Benjamin he gave three hundred pieces of silver and several changes of clothing.
content_old: 22 To each of them, moreover, he gave a change of clothing; but to Benjamin he gave three hundred pieces of silver and several changes of clothing.

content: 23 And to his father he sent the following: ten he-asses laden with the best things of Egypt, and ten she-asses laden with grain, bread, and provisions for his father on the journey.
content_old: 23 And to his father he sent the following: ten he-asses laden with the best things of Egypt, and ten she-asses laden with grain, bread, and provisions for his father on the journey.

content: 24 As he sent his brothers off on their way, he told them, “Do not be quarrelsome on the way.”
content_old: 24 As he sent his brothers off on their way, he told them, “Do not be quarrelsome on the way.”

content: 25 They went up from Egypt and came to their father Jacob in the land of Canaan.
content_old: 25 They went up from Egypt and came to their father Jacob in the land of Canaan.

content: 26 And they told him, “Joseph is still alive; yes, he is ruler over the whole land of Egypt.” His heart went numb, for he did not believe them.
content_old: 26 And they told him, “Joseph is still alive; yes, he is ruler over the whole land of Egypt.” His heart went numb, for he did not believe them.

content: 27 But when they recounted all that Joseph had said to them, and when he saw the wagons that Joseph had sent to transport him, the spirit of their father Jacob revived.
content_old: 27 But when they recounted all that Joseph had said to them, and when he saw the wagons that Joseph had sent to transport him, the spirit of their father Jacob revived.

content: 1 So Israel set out with all that was his, and he came to Beer-sheba, where he offered sacrifices to the God of his father Isaac.
content_old: 1 So Israel set out with all that was his, and he came to Beer-sheba, where he offered sacrifices to the God of his father Isaac.

content: 2 God called to Israel in a vision by night: “Jacob! Jacob!” He answered, “Here.”
content_old: 2 God called to Israel in a vision by night: “Jacob! Jacob!” He answered, “Here.”

content: 3 And He said, “I am God, the God of your father. Fear not to go down to Egypt, for I will make you there into a great nation.
content_old: 3 And He said, “I am God, the God of your father. Fear not to go down to Egypt, for I will make you there into a great nation.

content: 4 I Myself will go down with you to Egypt, and I Myself will also bring you back; and Joseph’s hand shall close your eyes.”
content_old: 4 I Myself will go down with you to Egypt, and I Myself will also bring you back; and Joseph’s hand shall close your eyes.”

content: 5 So Jacob set out from Beer-sheba. The sons of Israel put their father Jacob and their children and their wives in the wagons that Pharaoh had sent to transport him;
content_old: 5 So Jacob set out from Beer-sheba. The sons of Israel put their father Jacob and their children and their wives in the wagons that Pharaoh had sent to transport him;

content: 6 and they took along their livestock and the wealth that they had amassed in the land of Canaan. Thus Jacob and all his offspring with him came to Egypt:
content_old: 6 and they took along their livestock and the wealth that they had amassed in the land of Canaan. Thus Jacob and all his offspring with him came to Egypt:

content: 7 he brought with him to Egypt his sons and grandsons, his daughters and granddaughters—all his offspring.
content_old: 7 he brought with him to Egypt his sons and grandsons, his daughters and granddaughters—all his offspring.

content: 8 These are the names of the Israelites, Jacob and his descendants, who came to Egypt. Jacob’s first-born Reuben;
content_old: 8 These are the names of the Israelites, Jacob and his descendants, who came to Egypt. Jacob’s first-born Reuben;

content: 9 Reuben’s sons: Enoch, Pallu, Hezron, and Carmi.
content_old: 9 Reuben’s sons: Enoch, Pallu, Hezron, and Carmi.

content: 10 Simeon’s sons: Jemuel, Jamin, Ohad, Jachin, Zohar, and Saul the son of a Canaanite woman.
content_old: 10 Simeon’s sons: Jemuel, Jamin, Ohad, Jachin, Zohar, and Saul the son of a Canaanite woman.

content: 11 Levi’s sons: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.
content_old: 11 Levi’s sons: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.

content: 12 Judah’s sons: Er, Onan, Shelah, Perez, and Zerah—but Er and Onan had died in the land of Canaan; and Perez’s sons were Hezron and Hamul.
content_old: 12 Judah’s sons: Er, Onan, Shelah, Perez, and Zerah—but Er and Onan had died in the land of Canaan; and Perez’s sons were Hezron and Hamul.

content: 13 Issachar’s sons: Tola, Puvah, Iob, and Shimron.
content_old: 13 Issachar’s sons: Tola, Puvah, Iob, and Shimron.

content: 14 Zebulun’s sons: Sered, Elon, and Jahleel.
content_old: 14 Zebulun’s sons: Sered, Elon, and Jahleel.

content: 15 Those were the sons whom Leah bore to Jacob in Paddan-aram, in addition to his daughter Dinah. Persons in all, male and female: 33.
content_old: 15 Those were the sons whom Leah bore to Jacob in Paddan-aram, in addition to his daughter Dinah. Persons in all, male and female: 33.

content: 16 Gad’s sons: Ziphion, Haggi, Shuni, Ezbon, Eri, Arodi, and Areli.
content_old: 16 Gad’s sons: Ziphion, Haggi, Shuni, Ezbon, Eri, Arodi, and Areli.

content: 17 Asher’s sons: Imnah, Ishvah, Ishvi, and Beriah, and their sister Serah. Beriah’s sons: Heber and Malchiel.
content_old: 17 Asher’s sons: Imnah, Ishvah, Ishvi, and Beriah, and their sister Serah. Beriah’s sons: Heber and Malchiel.

content: 18 These were the descendants of Zilpah, whom Laban had given to his daughter Leah. These she bore to Jacob—16 persons.
content_old: 18 These were the descendants of Zilpah, whom Laban had given to his daughter Leah. These she bore to Jacob—16 persons.

content: 19 The sons of Jacob’s wife Rachel were Joseph and Benjamin.
content_old: 19 The sons of Jacob’s wife Rachel were Joseph and Benjamin.

content: 20 To Joseph were born in the land of Egypt Manasseh and Ephraim, whom Asenath daughter of Poti-phera priest of On bore to him.
content_old: 20 To Joseph were born in the land of Egypt Manasseh and Ephraim, whom Asenath daughter of Poti-phera priest of On bore to him.

content: 21 Benjamin’s sons: Bela, Becher, Ashbel, Gera, Naaman, Ehi, Rosh, Muppim, Huppim, and Ard.
content_old: 21 Benjamin’s sons: Bela, Becher, Ashbel, Gera, Naaman, Ehi, Rosh, Muppim, Huppim, and Ard.

content: 22 These were the descendants of Rachel who were born to Jacob—14 persons in all.
content_old: 22 These were the descendants of Rachel who were born to Jacob—14 persons in all.

content: 23 Dan’s son: Hushim.
content_old: 23 Dan’s son: Hushim.

content: 24 Naphtali’s sons: Jahzeel, Guni, Jezer, and Shillem.
content_old: 24 Naphtali’s sons: Jahzeel, Guni, Jezer, and Shillem.

content: 25 These were the descendants of Bilhah, whom Laban had given to his daughter Rachel. These she bore to Jacob—7 persons in all.
content_old: 25 These were the descendants of Bilhah, whom Laban had given to his daughter Rachel. These she bore to Jacob—7 persons in all.

content: 26 All the persons belonging to Jacob who came to Egypt—his own issue, aside from the wives of Jacob’s sons—all these persons numbered 66.
content_old: 26 All the persons belonging to Jacob who came to Egypt—his own issue, aside from the wives of Jacob’s sons—all these persons numbered 66.

content: 27 And Joseph’s sons who were born to him in Egypt were two in number. Thus the total of Jacob’s household who came to Egypt was seventy persons.
content_old: 27 And Joseph’s sons who were born to him in Egypt were two in number. Thus the total of Jacob’s household who came to Egypt was seventy persons.

content: 28 He had sent Judah ahead of him to Joseph, to point the way before him to Goshen. So when they came to the region of Goshen,
content_old: 28 He had sent Judah ahead of him to Joseph, to point the way before him to Goshen. So when they came to the region of Goshen,

content: 29 Joseph ordered his chariot and went to Goshen to meet his father Israel; he presented himself to him and, embracing him around the neck, he wept on his neck a good while.
content_old: 29 Joseph ordered his chariot and went to Goshen to meet his father Israel; he presented himself to him and, embracing him around the neck, he wept on his neck a good while.

content: 30 Then Israel said to Joseph, “Now I can die, having seen for myself that you are still alive.”
content_old: 30 Then Israel said to Joseph, “Now I can die, having seen for myself that you are still alive.”

content: 31 Then Joseph said to his brothers and to his father’s household, “I will go up and tell the news to Pharaoh, and say to him, ‘My brothers and my father’s household, who were in the land of Canaan, have come to me.
content_old: 31 Then Joseph said to his brothers and to his father’s household, “I will go up and tell the news to Pharaoh, and say to him, ‘My brothers and my father’s household, who were in the land of Canaan, have come to me.

content: 32 The men are shepherds; they have always been breeders of livestock, and they have brought with them their flocks and herds and all that is theirs.’
content_old: 32 The men are shepherds; they have always been breeders of livestock, and they have brought with them their flocks and herds and all that is theirs.’

content: 33 So when Pharaoh summons you and asks, ‘What is your occupation?’
content_old: 33 So when Pharaoh summons you and asks, ‘What is your occupation?’

content: 1 Then Joseph came and reported to Pharaoh, saying, “My father and my brothers, with their flocks and herds and all that is theirs, have come from the land of Canaan and are now in the region of Goshen.”
content_old: 1 Then Joseph came and reported to Pharaoh, saying, “My father and my brothers, with their flocks and herds and all that is theirs, have come from the land of Canaan and are now in the region of Goshen.”

content: 2 And selecting a few of his brothers, he presented them to Pharaoh.
content_old: 2 And selecting a few of his brothers, he presented them to Pharaoh.

content: 3 Pharaoh said to his brothers, “What is your occupation?” They answered Pharaoh, “We your servants are shepherds, as were also our fathers.
content_old: 3 Pharaoh said to his brothers, “What is your occupation?” They answered Pharaoh, “We your servants are shepherds, as were also our fathers.

content: 4 We have come,” they told Pharaoh, “to sojourn in this land, for there is no pasture for your servants’ flocks, the famine being severe in the land of Canaan. Pray, then, let your servants stay in the region of Goshen.”
content_old: 4 We have come,” they told Pharaoh, “to sojourn in this land, for there is no pasture for your servants’ flocks, the famine being severe in the land of Canaan. Pray, then, let your servants stay in the region of Goshen.”

content: 5 Then Pharaoh said to Joseph, “As regards your father and your brothers who have come to you,
content_old: 5 Then Pharaoh said to Joseph, “As regards your father and your brothers who have come to you,

content: 6 the land of Egypt is open before you: settle your father and your brothers in the best part of the land; let them stay in the region of Goshen. And if you know any capable men among them, put them in charge of my livestock.”
content_old: 6 the land of Egypt is open before you: settle your father and your brothers in the best part of the land; let them stay in the region of Goshen. And if you know any capable men among them, put them in charge of my livestock.”

content: 7 Joseph then brought his father Jacob and presented him to Pharaoh; and Jacob greeted Pharaoh.
content_old: 7 Joseph then brought his father Jacob and presented him to Pharaoh; and Jacob greeted Pharaoh.

content: 8 Pharaoh asked Jacob, “How many are the years of your life?”
content_old: 8 Pharaoh asked Jacob, “How many are the years of your life?”

content: 9 And Jacob answered Pharaoh, “The years of my sojourn on earth are one hundred and thirty. Few and hard have been the years of my life, nor do they come up to the life spans of my fathers during their sojourns.”
content_old: 9 And Jacob answered Pharaoh, “The years of my sojourn on earth are one hundred and thirty. Few and hard have been the years of my life, nor do they come up to the life spans of my fathers during their sojourns.”

content: 10 Then Jacob bade Pharaoh farewell, and left Pharaoh’s presence.
content_old: 10 Then Jacob bade Pharaoh farewell, and left Pharaoh’s presence.

content: 11 So Joseph settled his father and his brothers, giving them holdings in the choicest part of the land of Egypt, in the region of Rameses, as Pharaoh had commanded.
content_old: 11 So Joseph settled his father and his brothers, giving them holdings in the choicest part of the land of Egypt, in the region of Rameses, as Pharaoh had commanded.

content: 12 Joseph sustained his father, and his brothers, and all his father’s household with bread, down to the little ones.
content_old: 12 Joseph sustained his father, and his brothers, and all his father’s household with bread, down to the little ones.

content: 13 Now there was no bread in all the world, for the famine was very severe; both the land of Egypt and the land of Canaan languished because of the famine.
content_old: 13 Now there was no bread in all the world, for the famine was very severe; both the land of Egypt and the land of Canaan languished because of the famine.

content: 14 Joseph gathered in all the money that was to be found in the land of Egypt and in the land of Canaan, as payment for the rations that were being procured, and Joseph brought the money into Pharaoh’s palace.
content_old: 14 Joseph gathered in all the money that was to be found in the land of Egypt and in the land of Canaan, as payment for the rations that were being procured, and Joseph brought the money into Pharaoh’s palace.

content: 15 And when the money gave out in the land of Egypt and in the land of Canaan, all the Egyptians came to Joseph and said, “Give us bread, lest we die before your very eyes; for the money is gone!”
content_old: 15 And when the money gave out in the land of Egypt and in the land of Canaan, all the Egyptians came to Joseph and said, “Give us bread, lest we die before your very eyes; for the money is gone!”

content: 16 And Joseph said, “Bring your livestock, and I will sell to you against your livestock, if the money is gone.”
content_old: 16 And Joseph said, “Bring your livestock, and I will sell to you against your livestock, if the money is gone.”

content: 17 So they brought their livestock to Joseph, and Joseph gave them bread in exchange for the horses, for the stocks of sheep and cattle, and the asses; thus he provided them with bread that year in exchange for all their livestock.
content_old: 17 So they brought their livestock to Joseph, and Joseph gave them bread in exchange for the horses, for the stocks of sheep and cattle, and the asses; thus he provided them with bread that year in exchange for all their livestock.

content: 18 And when that year was ended, they came to him the next year and said to him, “We cannot hide from my lord that, with all the money and animal stocks consigned to my lord, nothing is left at my lord’s disposal save our persons and our farmland.
content_old: 18 And when that year was ended, they came to him the next year and said to him, “We cannot hide from my lord that, with all the money and animal stocks consigned to my lord, nothing is left at my lord’s disposal save our persons and our farmland.

content: 19 Let us not perish before your eyes, both we and our land. Take us and our land in exchange for bread, and we with our land will be serfs to Pharaoh; provide the seed, that we may live and not die, and that the land may not become a waste.”
content_old: 19 Let us not perish before your eyes, both we and our land. Take us and our land in exchange for bread, and we with our land will be serfs to Pharaoh; provide the seed, that we may live and not die, and that the land may not become a waste.”

content: 20 So Joseph gained possession of all the farm land of Egypt for Pharaoh, every Egyptian having sold his field because the famine was too much for them; thus the land passed over to Pharaoh.
content_old: 20 So Joseph gained possession of all the farm land of Egypt for Pharaoh, every Egyptian having sold his field because the famine was too much for them; thus the land passed over to Pharaoh.

content: 21 And he removed the population town by town, from one end of Egypt’s border to the other.
content_old: 21 And he removed the population town by town, from one end of Egypt’s border to the other.

content: 22 Only the land of the priests he did not take over, for the priests had an allotment from Pharaoh, and they lived off the allotment which Pharaoh had made to them; therefore they did not sell their land.
content_old: 22 Only the land of the priests he did not take over, for the priests had an allotment from Pharaoh, and they lived off the allotment which Pharaoh had made to them; therefore they did not sell their land.

content: 23 Then Joseph said to the people, “Whereas I have this day acquired you and your land for Pharaoh, here is seed for you to sow the land.
content_old: 23 Then Joseph said to the people, “Whereas I have this day acquired you and your land for Pharaoh, here is seed for you to sow the land.

content: 24 And when harvest comes, you shall give one-fifth to Pharaoh, and four-fifths shall be yours as seed for the fields and as food for you and those in your households, and as nourishment for your children.”
content_old: 24 And when harvest comes, you shall give one-fifth to Pharaoh, and four-fifths shall be yours as seed for the fields and as food for you and those in your households, and as nourishment for your children.”

content: 25 And they said, “You have saved our lives! We are grateful to my lord, and we shall be serfs to Pharaoh.”
content_old: 25 And they said, “You have saved our lives! We are grateful to my lord, and we shall be serfs to Pharaoh.”

content: 26 And Joseph made it into a land law in Egypt, which is still valid, that a fifth should be Pharaoh’s; only the land of the priests did not become Pharaoh’s.
content_old: 26 And Joseph made it into a land law in Egypt, which is still valid, that a fifth should be Pharaoh’s; only the land of the priests did not become Pharaoh’s.

content: 27 Thus Israel settled in the country of Egypt, in the region of Goshen; they acquired holdings in it, and were fertile and increased greatly.
content_old: 27 Thus Israel settled in the country of Egypt, in the region of Goshen; they acquired holdings in it, and were fertile and increased greatly.

content: 28 Jacob lived seventeen years in the land of Egypt, so that the span of Jacob’s life came to one hundred and forty-seven years.
content_old: 28 Jacob lived seventeen years in the land of Egypt, so that the span of Jacob’s life came to one hundred and forty-seven years.

content: 29 And when the time approached for Israel to die, he summoned his son Joseph and said to him, “Do me this favor, place your hand under my thigh as a pledge of your steadfast loyalty: please do not bury me in Egypt.
content_old: 29 And when the time approached for Israel to die, he summoned his son Joseph and said to him, “Do me this favor, place your hand under my thigh as a pledge of your steadfast loyalty: please do not bury me in Egypt.

content: 30 When I lie down with my fathers, take me up from Egypt and bury me in their burial-place.” He replied, “I will do as you have spoken.”
content_old: 30 When I lie down with my fathers, take me up from Egypt and bury me in their burial-place.” He replied, “I will do as you have spoken.”

content: 1 Some time afterward, Joseph was told, “Your father is ill.” So he took with him his two sons, Manasseh and Ephraim.
content_old: 1 Some time afterward, Joseph was told, “Your father is ill.” So he took with him his two sons, Manasseh and Ephraim.

content: 2 When Jacob was told, “Your son Joseph has come to see you,” Israel summoned his strength and sat up in bed.
content_old: 2 When Jacob was told, “Your son Joseph has come to see you,” Israel summoned his strength and sat up in bed.

content: 3 And Jacob said to Joseph, “El Shaddai appeared to me at Luz in the land of Canaan, and He blessed me,
content_old: 3 And Jacob said to Joseph, “El Shaddai appeared to me at Luz in the land of Canaan, and He blessed me,

content: 4 and said to me, ‘I will make you fertile and numerous, making of you a community of peoples; and I will assign this land to your offspring to come for an everlasting possession.’
content_old: 4 and said to me, ‘I will make you fertile and numerous, making of you a community of peoples; and I will assign this land to your offspring to come for an everlasting possession.’

content: 5 Now, your two sons, who were born to you in the land of Egypt before I came to you in Egypt, shall be mine; Ephraim and Manasseh shall be mine no less than Reuben and Simeon.
content_old: 5 Now, your two sons, who were born to you in the land of Egypt before I came to you in Egypt, shall be mine; Ephraim and Manasseh shall be mine no less than Reuben and Simeon.

content: 6 But progeny born to you after them shall be yours; they shall be recorded instead of their brothers in their inheritance.
content_old: 6 But progeny born to you after them shall be yours; they shall be recorded instead of their brothers in their inheritance.

content: 7 I do this because, when I was returning from Paddan, Rachel died, to my sorrow, while I was journeying in the land of Canaan, when still some distance short of Ephrath; and I buried her there on the road to Ephrath”—now Bethlehem.
content_old: 7 I do this because, when I was returning from Paddan, Rachel died, to my sorrow, while I was journeying in the land of Canaan, when still some distance short of Ephrath; and I buried her there on the road to Ephrath”—now Bethlehem.

content: 8 Noticing Joseph’s sons, Israel asked, “Who are these?”
content_old: 8 Noticing Joseph’s sons, Israel asked, “Who are these?”

content: 9 And Joseph said to his father, “They are my sons, whom God has given me here.” “Bring them up to me,” he said, “that I may bless them.”
content_old: 9 And Joseph said to his father, “They are my sons, whom God has given me here.” “Bring them up to me,” he said, “that I may bless them.”

content: 10 Now Israel’s eyes were dim with age; he could not see. So Joseph brought them close to him, and he kissed them and embraced them.
content_old: 10 Now Israel’s eyes were dim with age; he could not see. So Joseph brought them close to him, and he kissed them and embraced them.

content: 11 And Israel said to Joseph, “I never expected to see you again, and here God has let me see your children as well.”
content_old: 11 And Israel said to Joseph, “I never expected to see you again, and here God has let me see your children as well.”

content: 12 Joseph then removed them from his knees, and bowed low with his face to the ground.
content_old: 12 Joseph then removed them from his knees, and bowed low with his face to the ground.

content: 13 Joseph took the two of them, Ephraim with his right hand—to Israel’s left—and Manasseh with his left hand—to Israel’s right—and brought them close to him.
content_old: 13 Joseph took the two of them, Ephraim with his right hand—to Israel’s left—and Manasseh with his left hand—to Israel’s right—and brought them close to him.

content: 14 But Israel stretched out his right hand and laid it on Ephraim’s head, though he was the younger, and his left hand on Manasseh’s head—thus crossing his hands—although Manasseh was the first-born.
content_old: 14 But Israel stretched out his right hand and laid it on Ephraim’s head, though he was the younger, and his left hand on Manasseh’s head—thus crossing his hands—although Manasseh was the first-born.

content: 15 And he blessed Joseph, saying, “The God in whose ways my fathers Abraham and Isaac walked, The God who has been my shepherd from my birth to this day—
content_old: 15 And he blessed Joseph, saying, “The God in whose ways my fathers Abraham and Isaac walked, The God who has been my shepherd from my birth to this day—

content: 16 The Angel who has redeemed me from all harm— Bless the lads. In them may my name be recalled, And the names of my fathers Abraham and Isaac, And may they be teeming multitudes upon the earth.”
content_old: 16 The Angel who has redeemed me from all harm— Bless the lads. In them may my name be recalled, And the names of my fathers Abraham and Isaac, And may they be teeming multitudes upon the earth.”

content: 17 When Joseph saw that his father was placing his right hand on Ephraim’s head, he thought it wrong; so he took hold of his father’s hand to move it from Ephraim’s head to Manasseh’s.
content_old: 17 When Joseph saw that his father was placing his right hand on Ephraim’s head, he thought it wrong; so he took hold of his father’s hand to move it from Ephraim’s head to Manasseh’s.

content: 18 “Not so, Father,” Joseph said to his father, “for the other is the first-born; place your right hand on his head.”
content_old: 18 “Not so, Father,” Joseph said to his father, “for the other is the first-born; place your right hand on his head.”

content: 19 But his father objected, saying, “I know, my son, I know. He too shall become a people, and he too shall be great. Yet his younger brother shall be greater than he, and his offspring shall be plentiful enough for nations.”
content_old: 19 But his father objected, saying, “I know, my son, I know. He too shall become a people, and he too shall be great. Yet his younger brother shall be greater than he, and his offspring shall be plentiful enough for nations.”

content: 20 So he blessed them that day, saying, “By you shall Israel invoke blessings, saying: God make you like Ephraim and Manasseh.” Thus he put Ephraim before Manasseh.
content_old: 20 So he blessed them that day, saying, “By you shall Israel invoke blessings, saying: God make you like Ephraim and Manasseh.” Thus he put Ephraim before Manasseh.

content: 21 Then Israel said to Joseph, “I am about to die; but God will be with you and bring you back to the land of your fathers.
content_old: 21 Then Israel said to Joseph, “I am about to die; but God will be with you and bring you back to the land of your fathers.

content: 1 And Jacob called his sons and said, “Come together that I may tell you what is to befall you in days to come.
content_old: 1 And Jacob called his sons and said, “Come together that I may tell you what is to befall you in days to come.

content: 2 Assemble and hearken, O sons of Jacob; Hearken to Israel your father:
content_old: 2 Assemble and hearken, O sons of Jacob; Hearken to Israel your father:

content: 3 Reuben, you are my first-born, My might and first fruit of my vigor, Exceeding in rank And exceeding in honor.
content_old: 3 Reuben, you are my first-born, My might and first fruit of my vigor, Exceeding in rank And exceeding in honor.

content: 4 Unstable as water, you shall excel no longer; For when you mounted your father’s bed, You brought disgrace—my couch he mounted!
content_old: 4 Unstable as water, you shall excel no longer; For when you mounted your father’s bed, You brought disgrace—my couch he mounted!

content: 5 Simeon and Levi are a pair; Their weapons are tools of lawlessness.
content_old: 5 Simeon and Levi are a pair; Their weapons are tools of lawlessness.

content: 6 Let not my person be included in their council, Let not my being be counted in their assembly. For when angry they slay men, And when pleased they maim oxen.
content_old: 6 Let not my person be included in their council, Let not my being be counted in their assembly. For when angry they slay men, And when pleased they maim oxen.

content: 7 Cursed be their anger so fierce, And their wrath so relentless. I will divide them in Jacob, Scatter them in Israel.
content_old: 7 Cursed be their anger so fierce, And their wrath so relentless. I will divide them in Jacob, Scatter them in Israel.

content: 8 You, O Judah, your brothers shall praise; Your hand shall be on the nape of your foes; Your father’s sons shall bow low to you.
content_old: 8 You, O Judah, your brothers shall praise; Your hand shall be on the nape of your foes; Your father’s sons shall bow low to you.

content: 9 Judah is a lion’s whelp; On prey, my son, have you grown. He crouches, lies down like a lion, Like the king of beasts—who dare rouse him?
content_old: 9 Judah is a lion’s whelp; On prey, my son, have you grown. He crouches, lies down like a lion, Like the king of beasts—who dare rouse him?

content: 10 The scepter shall not depart from Judah, Nor the ruler’s staff from between his feet; So that tribute shall come to him And the homage of peoples be his.
content_old: 10 The scepter shall not depart from Judah, Nor the ruler’s staff from between his feet; So that tribute shall come to him And the homage of peoples be his.

content: 11 He tethers his ass to a vine, His ass’s foal to a choice vine; He washes his garment in wine, His robe in blood of grapes.
content_old: 11 He tethers his ass to a vine, His ass’s foal to a choice vine; He washes his garment in wine, His robe in blood of grapes.

content: 12 His eyes are darker than wine; His teeth are whiter than milk.
content_old: 12 His eyes are darker than wine; His teeth are whiter than milk.

content: 13 Zebulun shall dwell by the seashore; He shall be a haven for ships, And his flank shall rest on Sidon.
content_old: 13 Zebulun shall dwell by the seashore; He shall be a haven for ships, And his flank shall rest on Sidon.

content: 14 Issachar is a strong-boned ass, Crouching among the sheepfolds.
content_old: 14 Issachar is a strong-boned ass, Crouching among the sheepfolds.

content: 15 When he saw how good was security, And how pleasant was the country, He bent his shoulder to the burden, And became a toiling serf.
content_old: 15 When he saw how good was security, And how pleasant was the country, He bent his shoulder to the burden, And became a toiling serf.

content: 16 Dan shall govern his people, As one of the tribes of Israel.
content_old: 16 Dan shall govern his people, As one of the tribes of Israel.

content: 17 Dan shall be a serpent by the road, A viper by the path, That bites the horse’s heels So that his rider is thrown backward.
content_old: 17 Dan shall be a serpent by the road, A viper by the path, That bites the horse’s heels So that his rider is thrown backward.

content: 18 I wait for Your deliverance, O LORD!
content_old: 18 I wait for Your deliverance, O LORD!

content: 19 Gad shall be raided by raiders, But he shall raid at their heels.
content_old: 19 Gad shall be raided by raiders, But he shall raid at their heels.

content: 20 Asher’s bread shall be rich, And he shall yield royal dainties.
content_old: 20 Asher’s bread shall be rich, And he shall yield royal dainties.

content: 21 Naphtali is a hind let loose, Which yields lovely fawns.
content_old: 21 Naphtali is a hind let loose, Which yields lovely fawns.

content: 22 Joseph is a wild ass, A wild ass by a spring —Wild colts on a hillside.
content_old: 22 Joseph is a wild ass, A wild ass by a spring —Wild colts on a hillside.

content: 23 Archers bitterly assailed him; They shot at him and harried him.
content_old: 23 Archers bitterly assailed him; They shot at him and harried him.

content: 24 Yet his bow stayed taut, And his arms were made firm By the hands of the Mighty One of Jacob— There, the Shepherd, the Rock of Israel—
content_old: 24 Yet his bow stayed taut, And his arms were made firm By the hands of the Mighty One of Jacob— There, the Shepherd, the Rock of Israel—

content: 25 The God of your father who helps you, And Shaddai who blesses you With blessings of heaven above, Blessings of the deep that couches below, Blessings of the breast and womb.
content_old: 25 The God of your father who helps you, And Shaddai who blesses you With blessings of heaven above, Blessings of the deep that couches below, Blessings of the breast and womb.

content: 26 The blessings of your father Surpass the blessings of my ancestors, To the utmost bounds of the eternal hills. May they rest on the head of Joseph, On the brow of the elect of his brothers.
content_old: 26 The blessings of your father Surpass the blessings of my ancestors, To the utmost bounds of the eternal hills. May they rest on the head of Joseph, On the brow of the elect of his brothers.

content: 27 Benjamin is a ravenous wolf; In the morning he consumes the foe, And in the evening he divides the spoil.”
content_old: 27 Benjamin is a ravenous wolf; In the morning he consumes the foe, And in the evening he divides the spoil.”

content: 28 All these were the tribes of Israel, twelve in number, and this is what their father said to them as he bade them farewell, addressing to each a parting word appropriate to him.
content_old: 28 All these were the tribes of Israel, twelve in number, and this is what their father said to them as he bade them farewell, addressing to each a parting word appropriate to him.

content: 29 Then he instructed them, saying to them, “I am about to be gathered to my kin. Bury me with my fathers in the cave which is in the field of Ephron the Hittite,
content_old: 29 Then he instructed them, saying to them, “I am about to be gathered to my kin. Bury me with my fathers in the cave which is in the field of Ephron the Hittite,

content: 30 the cave which is in the field of Machpelah, facing Mamre, in the land of Canaan, the field that Abraham bought from Ephron the Hittite for a burial site—
content_old: 30 the cave which is in the field of Machpelah, facing Mamre, in the land of Canaan, the field that Abraham bought from Ephron the Hittite for a burial site—

content: 31 there Abraham and his wife Sarah were buried; there Isaac and his wife Rebekah were buried; and there I buried Leah—

content: 32 the field and the cave in it, bought from the Hittites.”

content: 1  Joseph flung himself upon his father’s face and wept over him and kissed him.
content_old: 1  Joseph flung himself upon his father’s face and wept over him and kissed him.

content: 2 Then Joseph ordered the physicians in his service to embalm his father, and the physicians embalmed Israel.
content_old: 2 Then Joseph ordered the physicians in his service to embalm his father, and the physicians embalmed Israel.

content: 3 It required forty days, for such is the full period of embalming. The Egyptians bewailed him seventy days;
content_old: 3 It required forty days, for such is the full period of embalming. The Egyptians bewailed him seventy days;

content: 4 and when the wailing period was over, Joseph spoke to Pharaoh’s court, saying, “Do me this favor, and lay this appeal before Pharaoh:
content_old: 4 and when the wailing period was over, Joseph spoke to Pharaoh’s court, saying, “Do me this favor, and lay this appeal before Pharaoh:

content: 5 ‘My father made me swear, saying, “I am about to die. Be sure to bury me in the grave which I made ready for myself in the land of Canaan.” Now, therefore, let me go up and bury my father; then I shall return.’ ”
content_old: 5 ‘My father made me swear, saying, “I am about to die. Be sure to bury me in the grave which I made ready for myself in the land of Canaan.” Now, therefore, let me go up and bury my father; then I shall return.’ ”

content: 6 And Pharaoh said, “Go up and bury your father, as he made you promise on oath.”
content_old: 6 And Pharaoh said, “Go up and bury your father, as he made you promise on oath.”

content: 7 So Joseph went up to bury his father; and with him went up all the officials of Pharaoh, the senior members of his court, and all of Egypt’s dignitaries,
content_old: 7 So Joseph went up to bury his father; and with him went up all the officials of Pharaoh, the senior members of his court, and all of Egypt’s dignitaries,

content: 8 together with all of Joseph’s household, his brothers, and his father’s household; only their children, their flocks, and their herds were left in the region of Goshen.
content_old: 8 together with all of Joseph’s household, his brothers, and his father’s household; only their children, their flocks, and their herds were left in the region of Goshen.

content: 9 Chariots, too, and horsemen went up with him; it was a very large troop.
content_old: 9 Chariots, too, and horsemen went up with him; it was a very large troop.

content: 10 When they came to Goren ha-Atad, which is beyond the Jordan, they held there a very great and solemn lamentation; and he observed a mourning period of seven days for his father.
content_old: 10 When they came to Goren ha-Atad, which is beyond the Jordan, they held there a very great and solemn lamentation; and he observed a mourning period of seven days for his father.

content: 11 And when the Canaanite inhabitants of the land saw the mourning at Goren ha-Atad, they said, “This is a solemn mourning on the part of the Egyptians.” That is why it was named Abel-mizraim, which is beyond the Jordan.
content_old: 11 And when the Canaanite inhabitants of the land saw the mourning at Goren ha-Atad, they said, “This is a solemn mourning on the part of the Egyptians.” That is why it was named Abel-mizraim, which is beyond the Jordan.

content: 12 Thus his sons did for him as he had instructed them.

content: 13 His sons carried him to the land of Canaan, and buried him in the cave of the field of Machpelah, the field near Mamre, which Abraham had bought for a burial site from Ephron the Hittite.
content_old: 13 His sons carried him to the land of Canaan, and buried him in the cave of the field of Machpelah, the field near Mamre, which Abraham had bought for a burial site from Ephron the Hittite.

content: 14 After burying his father, Joseph returned to Egypt, he and his brothers and all who had gone up with him to bury his father.
content_old: 14 After burying his father, Joseph returned to Egypt, he and his brothers and all who had gone up with him to bury his father.

content: 15 When Joseph’s brothers saw that their father was dead, they said, “What if Joseph still bears a grudge against us and pays us back for all the wrong that we did him!”
content_old: 15 When Joseph’s brothers saw that their father was dead, they said, “What if Joseph still bears a grudge against us and pays us back for all the wrong that we did him!”

content: 16 So they sent this message to Joseph, “Before his death your father left this instruction:
content_old: 16 So they sent this message to Joseph, “Before his death your father left this instruction:

content: 17 So shall you say to Joseph, ‘Forgive, I urge you, the offense and guilt of your brothers who treated you so harshly.’ Therefore, please forgive the offense of the servants of the God of your father.” And Joseph was in tears as they spoke to him.
content_old: 17 So shall you say to Joseph, ‘Forgive, I urge you, the offense and guilt of your brothers who treated you so harshly.’ Therefore, please forgive the offense of the servants of the God of your father.” And Joseph was in tears as they spoke to him.

content: 18 His brothers went to him themselves, flung themselves before him, and said, “We are prepared to be your slaves.”
content_old: 18 His brothers went to him themselves, flung themselves before him, and said, “We are prepared to be your slaves.”

content: 19 But Joseph said to them, “Have no fear! Am I a substitute for God?
content_old: 19 But Joseph said to them, “Have no fear! Am I a substitute for God?

content: 20 Besides, although you intended me harm, God intended it for good, so as to bring about the present result—the survival of many people.
content_old: 20 Besides, although you intended me harm, God intended it for good, so as to bring about the present result—the survival of many people.

content: 21 And so, fear not. I will sustain you and your children.” Thus he reassured them, speaking kindly to them.
content_old: 21 And so, fear not. I will sustain you and your children.” Thus he reassured them, speaking kindly to them.

content: 22 So Joseph and his father’s household remained in Egypt. Joseph lived one hundred and ten years.
content_old: 22 So Joseph and his father’s household remained in Egypt. Joseph lived one hundred and ten years.

content: 23 Joseph lived to see children of the third generation of Ephraim; the children of Machir son of Manasseh were likewise born upon Joseph’s knees.
content_old: 23 Joseph lived to see children of the third generation of Ephraim; the children of Machir son of Manasseh were likewise born upon Joseph’s knees.

content: 24 At length, Joseph said to his brothers, “I am about to die. God will surely take notice of you and bring you up from this land to the land that He promised on oath to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob.”
content_old: 24 At length, Joseph said to his brothers, “I am about to die. God will surely take notice of you and bring you up from this land to the land that He promised on oath to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob.”

content: 25 So Joseph made the sons of Israel swear, saying, “When God has taken notice of you, you shall carry up my bones from here.”
content_old: 25 So Joseph made the sons of Israel swear, saying, “When God has taken notice of you, you shall carry up my bones from here.”
